Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, by the will of God, and Timothy, a brother:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ Jesus who are at Colossa.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Grace be to you and peace, from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ. We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Hearing your faith in Christ Jesus and the love which you have towards all the saints.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For the hope that is laid up for you in heaven, which you have heard in the word of the truth of the gospel,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Which is come unto you, as also it is in the whole world and bringeth forth fruit and groweth, even as it doth in you, since the day you heard and knew the grace of God in truth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: As you learned of Epaphras, our most beloved fellow servant, who is for you a faithful minister of Christ Jesus;

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Who also hath manifested to us your love in the spirit.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Therefore we also, from the day that we heard it, cease not to pray for you and to beg that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will, in all wisdom and spiritual understanding:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: That you may walk worthy of God, in all things pleasing; being fruitful in every good work and increasing in the knowledge of God:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Strengthened with all might according to the power of his glory, in all patience and longsuffering with joy,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Giving thanks to God the Father, who hath made us worthy to be partakers of the lot of the saints in light:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Who hath delivered us from the power of darkness and hath translated us into the kingdom of the Son of his love,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: In whom we have redemption through his blood, the remission of sins:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature: The firstborn.... That is, first begotten; as the Evangelist declares, the only begotten of his Father: hence, St. Chrisostom explains firstborn, not first created, as he was not created at all, but born of his Father before all ages; that is, coeval with the Father and with the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For in him were all things created in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones, or dominations, or principalities, or powers. All things were created by him and in him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And he is before all: and by him all things consist.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And he is the head of the body, the church: who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, that in all things he may hold the primacy:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Because in him, it hath well pleased the Father that all fulness should dwell:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And through him to reconcile all things unto himself, making peace through the blood of his cross, both as to the things that are on earth and the things that are in heaven.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And you, whereas you were some time alienated and enemies in mind in evil works:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Yet now he hath reconciled in the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and unspotted and blameless before him:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: If so ye continue in the faith, grounded and settled, and immoveable from the hope of the gospel which you have heard, which is preached in all the creation that is under heaven: whereof I Paul am made a minister.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Who now rejoice in my sufferings for you and fill up those things that are wanting of the sufferings of Christ, in my flesh, for his body, which is the church: Wanting.... There is no want in the sufferings of Christ in himself as head: but many sufferings are still wanting, or are still to come, in his body the church, and his members the faithful.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Whereof I am made a minister according to the dispensation of God, which is given me towards you, that I may fulfil the word of God:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: The mystery which hath been hidden from ages and generations, but now is manifested to his saints,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: To whom God would make known the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ, in you the hope of glory.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Whom we preach, admonishing every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Wherein also I labour, striving according to his working which he worketh in me in power. Colossians Chapter 2 He warns them against the impostures of the philosophers and the Jewish teachers, that would withdraw them from Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For I would have you know what manner of care I have for you and for them that are at Laodicea and whosoever have not seen my face in the flesh:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: That their hearts may be comforted, being instructed in charity and unto all riches of fulness of understanding, unto the knowledge of the mystery of God the Father and of Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: In whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Now this I say, that no man may deceive you by loftiness of words.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For though I be absent in body, yet in spirit I am with you, rejoicing, and beholding your order and the steadfastness of your faith which is in Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: As therefore you have received Jesus Christ the Lord, walk ye in him:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Rooted and built up in him and confirmed in the faith, as also you have learned: abounding in him in thanksgiving.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Beware lest any man cheat you by philosophy and vain deceit: according to the tradition of men according to the elements of the world and not according to Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead corporeally.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And you are filled in him, who is the head of all principality and power.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: In whom also you are circumcised with circumcision not made by hand in despoiling of the body of the flesh: but in the circumcision of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Buried with him in baptism: in whom also you are risen again by the faith of the operation of God who hath raised him up from the dead.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And you, when you were dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, he hath quickened together with him, forgiving you all offences:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Blotting out the handwriting of the decree that was against us, which was contrary to us. And he hath taken the same out of the way, fastening it to the cross.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And despoiling the principalities and powers, he hath exposed them confidently in open shew, triumphing over them in himself.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Let no man therefore judge you in meat or in drink or in respect of a festival day or of the new moon or of the sabbaths, In meat, etc.... He means with regard to the Jewish observations of the distinction of clean and unclean meats; and of their festivals, new moons, and sabbaths, as being no longer obligatory.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Which are a shadow of things to come: but the body is of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Let no man seduce you, willing in humility and religion of angels, walking in the things which he hath not seen, in vain puffed up by the sense of his flesh: Willing, etc.... That is, by a self willed, self invented, superstitious worship, falsely pretending humility, but really proceeding from pride. Such was the worship, that many of the philosophers (against whom St. Paul speaks, ver. 8) paid to angels or demons, by sacrificing to them, as carriers of intelligence betwixt God and men; pretending humility in so doing, as if God was too great to be addressed by men; and setting aside the mediatorship of Jesus Christ, who is the head both of angels and men. Such also was the worship paid by the ancient heretics, disciples of Simon and Menander, to the angels, whom they believed to be makers and lords of this lower world. This is certain, that they whom the apostle here condemns, did not hold the head, (ver. 19,) that is, Jesus Christ, and his mediatorship; and therefore what he writes here no way touches the Catholic doctrine and practice, of desiring our good angels to pray to God for us, through Jesus Christ. St. Jerome [Epist. ad Algas.] understands by the religion or service of angels, the Jewish teachers, who sought to subject the new Christians to the observance of the Mosaic law.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And not holding the head, from which the whole body, by joints and bands, being supplied with nourishment and compacted, groweth into the increase of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: If then you be dead with Christ from the elements of this world, why do you yet decree as though living in the world?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Touch not: taste not: handle not. Touch not, etc.... The meaning is, that Christians should not subject themselves, either to the ordinances of the old law, forbidding touching or tasting things unclean; or to the superstitious invention of heretics, imposing such restraints, under pretence of wisdom, humility, or mortification.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Which all are unto destruction by the very use, according to the precepts and doctrines of men.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Which things have indeed a shew of wisdom in superstition and humility, and not sparing the body; not in any honour to the filling of the flesh. Colossians Chapter 3 He exhorts them to put off the old man, and to put on the new. The duties of wives and husbands, children and servants.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Therefore if you be risen with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is sitting at the right hand of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Mind the things that are above, not the things that are upon the earth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For you are dead: and your life is hid with Christ in God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: When Christ shall appear, who is your life, then you also shall appear with him in glory.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth: fornication, uncleanness, lust, evil concupiscence and covetousness, which is the service of idols.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For which things the wrath of God cometh upon the children of unbelief.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: In which you also walked some time, when you lived in them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: But now put you also all away: anger, indignation, malice, blasphemy, filthy speech out of your mouth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Lie not one to another: stripping yourselves of the old man with his deeds,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And putting on the new, him who is renewed unto knowledge, according to the image of him that created him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Where there is neither Gentile nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian nor Scythian, bond nor free. But Christ is all and in all.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Put ye on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, the bowels of mercy, benignity, humility, modesty, patience:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Bearing with one another and forgiving one another, if any have a complaint against another. Even as the Lord hath forgiven you, so do you also.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: But above all these things have charity, which is the bond of perfection.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And let the peace of Christ rejoice in your hearts, wherein also you are called in one body: and be ye thankful.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you abundantly: in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another in psalms, hymns and spiritual canticles, singing in grace in your hearts to God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: All whatsoever you do in word or in work, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Wives, be subject to your husbands, as it behoveth in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Husbands, love your wives and be not bitter towards them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Children, obey your parents in all things: for this is well pleasing to the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Fathers, provoke not your children to indignation, lest they be discouraged.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Servants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh: not serving to the eye, as pleasing men: but in simplicity of heart, fearing God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Whatsoever you do, do it from the heart, as to the Lord, and not to men:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Knowing that you shall receive of the Lord the reward of inheritance. Serve ye the Lord Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For he that doth wrong shall receive for that which he hath done wrongfully. And there is no respect of persons with God. Colossians Chapter 4 He recommends constant prayer and wisdom. Various salutations.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Masters, do to your servants that which is just and equal: knowing that you also have a master in heaven.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Be instant in prayer: watching in it with thanksgiving.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Praying withal for us also, that God may open unto us a door of speech to speak the mystery of Christ (for which also I am bound):

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: That I may make it manifest as I ought to speak.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Walk with wisdom towards them that are without, redeeming the time.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Let your speech be always in grace seasoned with salt: that you may know how you ought to answer every man.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: All the things that concern me, Tychicus, our dearest brother and faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord, will make known to you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Whom I have sent to you for this same purpose, that he may know the things that concern you and comfort your hearts:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: With Onesimus, a most beloved and faithful brother, who is one of you. All things that are done here, they shall make known to you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, saluteth you: and Mark, the cousin german of Barnabas, touching whom you have received commandments. If he come unto you, receive him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And Jesus that is called Justus: who are of the circumcision. These only are my helpers, in the kingdom of God: who have been a comfort to me.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Epaphras saluteth you, who is one of you, a servant of Christ Jesus, who is always solicitous for you in prayers, that you may stand perfect and full in all the will of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For I bear him testimony that he hath much labour for you and for them that are at Laodicea and them at Hierapolis.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Luke, the most dear physician, saluteth you: and Demas.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Salute the brethren who are at Laodicea: and Nymphas and the church that is in his house.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And when this epistle shall have been read with you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans: and that you read that which is of the Laodiceans. And that you read that which is of the Laodiceans.... What this epistle was is uncertain, and annotators have given different opinions concerning it. Some expound these words of an epistle which St. Paul wrote to the Laodiceans, and is since lost, for that now extant is no more than a collection of sentences out of the other epistles of St. Paul; therefore it cannot be considered even as a part of that epistle. Others explain that the text means a letter sent to St. Paul by the Laodiceans, which he sends to the Colossians to be read by them. However, this opinion does not seem well founded. Hence it is more probable that St. Paul wrote an epistle from Rome to the Laodiceans, about the same time that he wrote to the Colossians, as he had them both equally at heart, and that he ordered that epistle to be read by the Colossians for their instructions; and being neighbouring cities, they might communicate to each other what they had received from him; as one epistle might contain some matters not related in the other, and would be equally useful for their concern; and more particularly as they were equally disturbed by intruders and false teachers, against which the apostle was anxious to warn them, lest they should be infected by their pernicious doctrine.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And say to Archippus: Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: The salutation of Paul with my own hand. Be mindful of my bands. Grace be with you. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, by the will of God, to all the saints who are at Ephesus and to the faithful in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Grace be to you and peace, from God the Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with spiritual blessings in heavenly places, in Christ: In heavenly places.... or, in heavenly things. In coelestibus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: As he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and unspotted in his sight in charity.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Who hath predestinated us unto the adoption of children through Jesus Christ unto himself: according to the purpose of his will:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Unto the praise of the glory of his grace, in which he hath graced us, in his beloved son.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom we have redemption through his blood, the remission of sins, according to the riches of his, grace,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Which hath superabounded in us, in all wisdom and prudence,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That he might make known unto us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure, which he hath purposed in him,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In the dispensation of the fulness of times, to re-establish all things in Christ, that are in heaven and on earth, in him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom we also are called by lot, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who worketh all things according to the counsel of his will.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That we may be unto the praise of his glory: we who before hoped in Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom you also, after you had heard the word of truth (the gospel of your salvation), in whom also believing, you were signed with the holy Spirit of promise.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Who is the pledge of our inheritance, unto the redemption of acquisition, unto the praise of his glory. Acquisition.... that is, a purchased possession.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore, I also, hearing of your faith that is in the Lord Jesus and of your love towards all the saints,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Cease not to give thanks for you, making commemoration of you in my prayers,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give unto you the spirit of wisdom and of revelation, in the knowledge of him:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: The eyes of your heart enlightened that you may know what the hope is of his calling and what are the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And what is the exceeding greatness of his power towards us, who believe according to the operation of the might of his power,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Which he wrought in Christ, raising him up from the dead and setting him on his right hand in the heavenly places.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Above all principality and power and virtue and dominion and every name that is named, not only in this world, but also in that which is to come.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And he hath subjected all things under his feet and hath made him head over all the church,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Which is his body and the fulness of him who is filled all in all. Ephesians Chapter 2 All our good comes through Christ. He is our peace.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And you, when you were dead in your offences and sins,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherein in time past you walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of this air, of the spirit that now worketh on the children of unbelief:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In which also we all conversed in time past, in the desires of our flesh, fulfilling the will of the flesh and of our thoughts, and were by nature children of wrath, even as the rest:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But God (who is rich in mercy) for his exceeding charity wherewith he loved us

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Even when we were dead in sins, hath quickened us together in Christ (by whose grace you are saved)

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And hath raised us up together and hath made us sit together in the heavenly places, through Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That he might shew in the ages to come the abundant riches of his grace, in his bounty towards us in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For by grace you are saved through faith: and that not of yourselves, for it is the gift of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Not of works, that no man may glory. Not of works.... as of our own growth, or from ourselves; but as from the grace of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus in good works, which God hath prepared that we should walk in them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For which cause be mindful that you, being heretofore gentiles in the flesh, who are called uncircumcision by that which is called circumcision in the flesh, made by hands:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That you were at that time without Christ, being aliens from the conversation of Israel and strangers to the testament, having no hope of the promise and without God in this world.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But now in Christ Jesus, you, who some time were afar off, are made nigh by the blood of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For he is our peace, who hath made both one, and breaking down the middle wall of partition, the enmities in his flesh:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Making void the law of commandments contained in decrees: that he might make the two in himself into one new man, making peace.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And might reconcile both to God in one body by the cross, killing the enmities in himself.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And coming, he preached peace to you that were afar off: and peace to them that were nigh.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For by him we have access both in one Spirit to the Father.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Now therefore you are no more strangers and foreigners: but you are fellow citizens with the saints and the domestics of God,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ himself being the chief corner stone:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom all the building, being framed together, groweth up into an holy temple in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom you also are built together into an habitation of God in the Spirit. Ephesians Chapter 3 The mystery hidden from former ages was discovered to the apostle, to be imparted to the Gentiles. He prays that they may be strengthened in God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause, I Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ, for you Gentiles:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: If yet you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which is given me towards you:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: How that, according to revelation, the mystery has been made known to me, as I have written above in a few words:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: As you reading, may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Which in other generations was not known to the sons of men, as it is now revealed to his holy apostles and prophets in the Spirit:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That the Gentiles should be fellow heirs and of the same body: and copartners of his promise in Christ Jesus, by the gospel

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Of which I am made a minister, according to the gift of the grace of God, which is given to me according to the operation of his power.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: To me, the least of all the saints, is given this grace, to preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And to enlighten all men, that they may see what is the dispensation of the mystery which hath been hidden from eternity in God who created all things:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That the manifold wisdom of God may be made known to the principalities and powers in heavenly places through the church,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: According to the eternal purpose which he made in Christ Jesus our Lord:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore I pray you not to faint at my tribulations for you, which is your glory.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Of whom all paternity in heaven and earth is named: All paternity.... Or, the whole family. God is the Father, both of angels and men; whosoever besides is named father, is so named with subordination to him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened by his Spirit with might unto the inward man:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That Christ may dwell by faith in your hearts: that, being rooted and founded in charity,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: You may be able to comprehend, with all the saints, what is the breadth and length and height and depth,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: To know also the charity of Christ, which surpasseth all knowledge: that you may be filled unto all the fulness of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Now to him who is able to do all things more abundantly than we desire or understand, according to the power that worketh in us:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: To him be glory in the church and in Christ Jesus, unto all generations, world without end. Amen. Ephesians Chapter 4 He exhorts them to unity, to put on the new man, and to fly sin.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: I therefore, a prisoner in the Lord, beseech you that you walk worthy of the vocation in which you are called:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: With all humility and mildness, with patience, supporting one another in charity.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Careful to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: One body and one Spirit: as you are called in one hope of your calling.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: One Lord, one faith, one baptism.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: One God and Father of all, who is above all, and through all, and in us all.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But to every one of us is given grace, according to the measure of the giving of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore he saith: Ascending on high, he led captivity captive: he gave gifts to men.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Now that he ascended, what is it, but because he also descended first into the lower parts of the earth?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: He that descended is the same also that ascended above all the heavens: that he might fill all things.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And he gave some apostles, and some prophets, and other some evangelists, and other some pastors and doctors: Gave some apostles—Until we all meet, etc.... Here it is plainly expressed, that Christ has left in his church a perpetual succession of orthodox pastors and teachers, to preserve the faithful in unity and truth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For the perfecting of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Until we all meet into the unity of faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the age of the fulness of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That henceforth we be no more children tossed to and fro and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the wickedness of men, by cunning craftiness by which they lie in wait to deceive.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But doing the truth in charity, we may in all things grow up in him who is the head, even Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: From whom the whole body, being compacted and fitly joined together, by what every joint supplieth, according to the operation in the measure of every part, maketh increase of the body, unto the edifying of itself in charity.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: This then I say and testify in the Lord: That henceforward you walk not as also the Gentiles walk in the vanity of their mind:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Having their understanding darkened: being alienated from the life of God through the ignorance that is in them, because of the blindness of their hearts.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Who despairing have given themselves up to lasciviousness, unto the working of all uncleanness, unto covetousness.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But you have not so learned Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: If so be that you have heard him and have been taught in him, as the truth is in Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: To put off, according to former conversation, the old man, who is corrupted according to the desire of error.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And be renewed in the spirit of your mind:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And put on the new man, who according to God is created in justice and holiness of truth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore, putting away lying, speak ye the truth, every man with his neighbour. For we are members one of another.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Be angry: and sin not. Let not the sun go down upon your anger.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Give not place to the devil.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: He that stole, let him now steal no more: but rather let him labour, working with his hands the thing which is good, that he may have something to give to him that suffereth need.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Let no evil speech proceed from your mouth: but that which is good, to the edification of faith: that it may administer grace to the hearers.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And grieve not the holy Spirit of God: whereby you are sealed unto the day of redemption.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Let all bitterness and anger and indignation and clamour and blasphemy be put away from you, with all malice.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And be ye kind one to another: merciful, forgiving one another, even as God hath forgiven you in Christ. Ephesians Chapter 5 Exhortations to a virtuous life. The mutual duties of man and wife, by the example of Christ and of the Church.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Be ye therefore followers of God, as most dear children:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us and hath delivered himself for us, an oblation and a sacrifice to God for an odour of sweetness.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But fornication and all uncleanness or covetousness, let it not so much as be named among you, as becometh saints:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Or obscenity or foolish talking or scurrility, which is to no purpose: but rather giving of thanks.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For know you this and understand: That no fornicator or unclean or covetous person (which is a serving of idols) hath inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Let no man deceive you with vain words. For because of these things cometh the anger of God upon the children of unbelief.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Be ye not therefore partakers with them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For you were heretofore darkness, but now light in the Lord. Walk then as children of the light.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For the fruit of the light is in all goodness and justice and truth:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Proving what is well pleasing to God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness: but rather reprove them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For the things that are done by them in secret, it is a shame even to speak of.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for all that is made manifest is light.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore he saith: Rise, thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead: and Christ shall enlighten thee.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: See therefore, brethren, how you walk circumspectly: not as unwise,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But as wise: redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore, become not unwise: but understanding what is the will of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is luxury: but be ye filled with the Holy Spirit,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual canticles, singing and making melody in your hearts to the Lord:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Giving thanks always for all things, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to God and the Father:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Being subject one to another, in the fear of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Let women be subject to their husbands, as to the Lord:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Because the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ is the head of the church. He is the saviour of his body.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Therefore as the church is subject to Christ: so also let the wives be to their husbands in all things. As the church is subject to Christ.... The church then, according to St. Paul, is ever obedient to Christ, and can never fall from him, but remain faithful to him, unspotted and unchanged to the end of the world.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Husbands, love your wives, as Christ also loved the church and delivered himself up for it:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That he might sanctify it, cleansing it by the laver of water in the word of life:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That he might present it to himself, a glorious church, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: So also ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife loveth himself.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For no man ever hated his own flesh, but nourisheth and cherisheth it, as also Christ doth the church:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Because we are members of his body, of his flesh and of his bones.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother: and shall cleave to his wife. And they shall be two in one flesh.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: This is a great sacrament: but I speak in Christ and in the church.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Nevertheless, let every one of you in particular love his wife as himself: And let the wife fear her husband. Ephesians Chapter 6 Duties of children and servants. The Christian’s armour.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is just.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Honour thy father and thy mother, which is the first commandment with a promise:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That it may be well with thee, and thou mayest be long lived upon earth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And you, fathers, provoke not your children to anger: but bring them up in the discipline and correction of the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Servants, be obedient to them that are your lords according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in the simplicity of your heart, as to Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Not serving to the eye, as it were pleasing men: but, as the servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: With a good will serving, as to the Lord, and not to men.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Knowing that whatsoever good thing any man shall do, the same shall he receive from the Lord, whether he be bond or free.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And you, masters, do the same things to them, forbearing threatenings: knowing that the Lord both of them and you is in heaven. And there is no respect of persons with him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Finally, brethren, be strengthened in the Lord and in the might of his power.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Put you on the armour of God, that you may be able to stand against the deceits of the devil.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For our wrestling is not against flesh and blood; but against principalities and powers, against the rulers of the world of this darkness, against the spirits of wickedness in the high places. High places, or heavenly places.... That is to say, in the air, the lowest of the celestial regions; in which God permits these wicked spirits or fallen angels to wander.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Therefore, take unto you the armour of God, that you may be able to resist in the evil day and to stand in all things perfect.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Stand therefore, having your loins girt about with truth and having on the breastplate of justice:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In all things taking the shield of faith, wherewith you may be able to extinguish all the fiery darts of the most wicked one.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And take unto you the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit (which is the word of God).

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: By all prayer and supplication praying at all times in the spirit: and in the same watching with all instance and supplication for all the saints:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And for me, that speech may be given me, that I may open my mouth with confidence, to make known the mystery of the gospel,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For which I am an ambassador in a chain: so that therein I may be bold to speak according as I ought.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But that you also may know the things that concern me and what I am doing, Tychicus, my dearest brother and faithful minister in the Lord, will make known to you all things:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Whom I have sent to you for this same purpose: that you may know the things concerning us, and that he may comfort your hearts.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Peace be to the brethren and charity with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in incorruption. Amen. In incorruption.... That is, with a pure and perfect love.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: In the days of Assuerus, who reigned from India to Ethiopia over a hundred and twenty seven provinces:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: When he sat on the throne of his kingdom, the city Susan was the capital of his kingdom.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now in the third year of his reign he made a great feast for all the princes, and for his servants, for the most mighty of the Persians, and the nobles of the Medes, and the governors of the provinces in his sight,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: That he might shew the riches of the glory of his kingdom, and the greatness, and boasting of his power, for a long time, to wit, for a hundred and fourscore days.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when the days of the feast were expired, he invited all the people that were found in Susan, from the greatest to the least: and commanded a feast to be made seven days in the court of the garden, and of the wood, which was planted by the care and the hand of the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And there were hung up on every side sky coloured, and green, and violet hangings, fastened with cords of silk, and of purple, which were put into rings of ivory, and were held up with marble pillars. The beds also were of gold and silver, placed in order upon a floor paved with porphyry and white marble: which was embellished with painting of wonderful variety.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And they that were invited, drank in golden cups, and the meats were brought in divers vessels one after another. Wine also in abundance and of the best was presented, as was worthy of a king’s magnificence.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Neither was there any one to compel them to drink that were not willing, but as the king had appointed, who set over every table one of his nobles, that every man might take what he would.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Also Vasthi the queen made a feast for the women in the palace, where king Assuerus was used to dwell.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now on the seventh day, when the king was merry, and after very much drinking was well warmed with wine, he commanded Mauman, and Bazatha, and Harbona, and Bagatha, and Abgatha, and Zethar, and Charcas, the seven eunuchs that served in his presence,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: To bring in queen Vasthi before the king, with the crown set upon her head, to shew her beauty to all the people and the princes: for she was exceeding beautiful.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But she refused, and would not come at the king’s commandment, which he had signified to her by the eunuchs. Whereupon the king, being angry, and inflamed with a very great fury,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Asked the wise men, who according to the custom of the kings, were always near his person, and all he did was by their counsel, who knew the laws, and judgments of their forefathers:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: (Now the chief and nearest him were, Charsena, and Sethar, and Admatha, and Tharsis, and Mares, and Marsana, and Mamuchan, seven princes of the Persians and of the Medes, who saw the face of the king, and were used to sit first after him:)

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: What sentence ought to pass upon Vasthi the queen, who had refused to obey the commandment of king Assuerus, which he had sent to her by the eunuchs?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Mamuchan answered, in the hearing of the king and the princes: Queen Vasthi hath not only injured the king, but also all the people and princes that are in all the provinces of king Assuerus.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For this deed of the queen will go abroad to all women, so that they will despise their husbands, and will say: King Assuerus commanded that queen Vasthi should come in to him, and she would not.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And by this example all the wives of the princes of the Persians and the Medes will slight the commandments of their husbands: wherefore the king’s indignation is just.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: If it please thee, let an edict go out from thy presence, and let it be written according to the law of the Persians and of the Medes, which must not be altered, that Vasthi come in no more to the king, but another, that is better than her, be made queen in her place.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And let this be published through all the provinces of thy empire, (which is very wide,) and let all wives, as well of the greater as of the lesser, give honour to their husbands.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: His counsel pleased the king, and the princes: and the king did according to the counsel of Mamuchan.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he sent letters to all the provinces of his kingdom, as every nation could hear and read, in divers languages and characters, that the husbands should be rulers and masters in their houses: and that this should be published to every people. Esther Chapter 2 Esther is advanced to be queen. Mardochai detecteth a plot against the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: After this, when the wrath of king Assuerus was appeased, he remembered Vasthi, and what she had done and what she had suffered:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king’s servants and his officers said: Let young women be sought for the king, virgins and beautiful,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And let some persons be sent through all the provinces to look for beautiful maidens and virgins: and let them bring them to the city of Susan, and put them into the house of the women under the hand of Egeus the eunuch, who is the overseer and keeper of the king’s women: and let them receive women’s ornaments, and other things necessary for their use.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And whosoever among them all shall please the king’s eyes, let her be queen instead of Vasthi. The word pleased the king: and he commanded it should be done as they had suggested.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: There was a man in the city of Susan, a Jew, named Mardochai, the son of Jair, the son of Semei, the son of Cis, of the race of Jemini,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Who had been carried away from Jerusalem at the time that Nabuchodonosor king of Babylon carried away Jechonias king of Juda,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he had brought up his brother’s daughter Edissa, who by another name was called Esther: now she had lost both her parents: and was exceeding fair and beautiful. And her father and mother being dead, Mardochai adopted her for his daughter.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when the king’s ordinance was noised abroad, and according to his commandment many beautiful virgins were brought to Susan, and were delivered to Egeus the eunuch: Esther also among the rest of the maidens was delivered to him to be kept in the number of the women.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And she pleased him, and found favour in his sight. And he commanded the eunuch to hasten the women’s ornaments, and to deliver to her her part, and seven of the most beautiful maidens of the king’s house, and to adorn and deck out both her and her waiting maids.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And she would not tell him her people nor her country. For Mardochai had charged her to say nothing at all of that:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he walked every day before the court of the house, in which the chosen virgins were kept, having a care for Esther’s welfare, and desiring to know what would befall her.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now when every virgin’s turn came to go in to the king, after all had been done for setting them off to advantage, it was the twelfth month: so that for six months they were anointed with oil of myrrh, and for other six months they used certain perfumes and sweet spices.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when they were going in to the king, whatsoever they asked to adorn themselves they received: and being decked out, as it pleased them, they passed from the chamber of the women to the king’s chamber.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And she that went in at evening, came out in the morning, and from thence she was conducted to the second house, that was under the hand of Susagaz the eunuch, who had the charge over the king’s concubines: neither could she return any more to the king, unless the king desired it, and had ordered her by name to come.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And as the time came orderly about, the day was at hand, when Esther, the daughter of Abihail the brother of Mardochai, whom he had adopted for his daughter, was to go in to the king. But she sought not women’s ornaments, but whatsoever Egeus the eunuch the keeper of the virgins had a mind, he gave her to adorn her. For she was exceeding fair, and her incredible beauty made her appear agreeable and amiable in the eyes of all.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So she was brought to the chamber of king Assuerus the tenth month, which is called Tebeth, in the seventh year of his reign.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king loved her more than all the women, and she had favour and kindness before him above all the women, and he set the royal crown on her head, and made her queen instead of Vasthi.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he commanded a magnificent feast to be prepared for all the princes, and for his servants, for the marriage and wedding of Esther, And he gave rest to all the provinces, and bestowed gifts according to princely magnificence.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when the virgins were sought the second time, and gathered together, Mardochai stayed at the king’s gate,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Neither had Esther as yet declared her country and people, according to his commandment. For whatsoever he commanded, Esther observed: and she did all things in the same manner as she was wont at that time when he brought her up a little one.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: At that time, therefore, when Mardochai abode at the king’s gate, Bagathan and Thares, two of the king’s eunuchs, who were porters, and presided in the first entry of the palace, were angry: and they designed to rise up against the king, and to kill him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Mardochai had notice of it, and immediately he told it to queen Esther: and she to the king in Mardochai’s name, who had reported the thing unto her.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: It was inquired into, and found out: and they were both hanged on a gibbet. And it was put in the histories, and recorded in the chronicles before the king. Esther Chapter 3 Aman, advanced by the king, is offended at Mardochai, and therefore procureth the king’s decree to destroy the whole nation of the Jews.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: After these things, king Assuerus advanced Aman, the son of Amadathi, who was of the race of Agag: and he set his throne above all the princes that were with him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And all the king’s servants, that were at the doors of the palace, bent their knees, and worshipped Aman: for so the emperor had commanded them, only Mardochai did not bend his knee, nor worship him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king’s servants that were chief at the doors of the palace, said to him: Why dost thou alone not observe the king’s commandment?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when they were saying this often, and he would not hearken to them, they told Aman, desirous to know whether he would continue in his resolution: for he had told them that he was a Jew.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now when Aman had heard this, and had proved by experience that Mardochai did not bend his knee to him, nor worship him, he was exceeding angry.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he counted it nothing to lay his hands upon Mardochai alone: for he had heard that he was of the nation of the Jews, and he chose rather to destroy all the nation of the Jews that were in the kingdom of Assuerus.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: In the first month (which is called Nisan) in the twelfth year of the reign of Assuerus, the lot was cast into an urn, which in Hebrew is called Phur, before Aman, on what day and what month the nation of the Jews should be destroyed: and there came out the twelfth month, which is called Adar.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Aman said to king Assuerus: There is a people scattered through all the provinces of thy kingdom, and separated one from another, that use new laws and ceremonies, and moreover despise the king’s ordinances: and thou knowest very well that it is not expedient for thy kingdom that they should grow insolent by impunity.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: If it please thee, decree that they may be destroyed, and I will pay ten thousand talents to thy treasurers.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king took the ring that he used, from his own hand, and gave it to Aman, the son of Amadathi of the race of Agag, the enemy of the Jews,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he said to him: As to the money which thou promisest, keep it for thyself: and as to the people, do with them as seemeth good to thee.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king’s scribes were called in the first month Nisan, on the thirteenth day of the same month: and they wrote, as Aman had commanded, to all the king’s lieutenants, and to the judges of the provinces, and of divers nations, as every nation could read, and hear according to their different languages, in the name of king Assuerus: and the letters, sealed with his ring,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Were sent by the king’s messengers to all provinces, to kill and destroy all the Jews, both young and old, little children, and women, in one day, that is, on the thirteenth of the twelfth month, which is called Adar, and to make a spoil of their goods.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the contents of the letters were to this effect, that all provinces might know and be ready against that day.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The couriers that were sent made haste to fulfil the king’s commandment. And immediately the edict was hung up in Susan, the king and Aman feasting together, and all the Jews that were in the city weeping. Esther Chapter 4 Mardochai desireth Esther to petition the king for the Jews. They join in fasting and prayer.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now when Mardochai had heard these things, he rent his garments, and put on sackcloth, strewing ashes on his head and he cried with a loud voice in the street in the midst of the city, shewing the anguish of his mind.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he came lamenting in this manner even to the gate of the palace: for no one clothed with sackcloth might enter the king’s court.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And in all provinces, towns, and places, to which the king’s cruel edict was come, there was great mourning among the Jews, with fasting, wailing, and weeping, many using sackcloth and ashes for their bed.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then Esther’s maids and her eunuchs went in, and told her. And when she heard it she was in a consternation and she sent a garment, to clothe him, and to take away the sackcloth: but he would not receive it.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And she called for Athach the eunuch, whom the king had appointed to attend upon her, and she commanded him to go to Mardochai, and learn of him why he did this.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Athach going out went to Mardochai, who was standing in the street of the city, before the palace gate:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Mardochai told him all that had happened, how Aman had promised to pay money into the king’s treasures, to have the Jews destroyed.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: He gave him also a copy of the edict which was hanging up in Susan, that he should shew it to the queen, and admonish her to go in to the king, and to entreat him for her people.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Athach went back and told Esther all that Mardochai had said.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: She answered him, and bade him say to Mardochai:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: All the king’s servants, and all the provinces that are under his dominion, know, that whosoever, whether man or woman, cometh into the king’s inner court, who is not called for, is immediately to be put to death without any delay: except the king shall hold out the golden sceptre to him, in token of clemency, that so he may live. How then can I go in to the king, who for these thirty days now have not been called unto him?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when Mardochai had heard this,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: He sent word to Esther again, saying: Think not that thou mayst save thy life only, because thou art in the king’s house, more than all the Jews:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For if thou wilt now hold thy peace, the Jews shall be delivered by some other occasion: and thou, and thy father’s house shall perish. And who knoweth whether thou art not therefore come to the kingdom, that thou mightest be ready in such a time as this?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And again Esther sent to Mardochai in these words:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Go, and gather together all the Jews whom thou shalt find in Susan, and pray ye for me. Neither eat nor drink for three days and three nights: and I with my handmaids will fast in like manner, and then I will go in to the king, against the law, not being called, and expose myself to death and to danger.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So Mardochai went, and did all that Esther had commanded him. Esther Chapter 5 Esther is graciously received: she inviteth the king and Aman to dinner, Aman prepareth a gibbet for Mardochai.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And on the third day Esther put on her royal apparel, and stood in the inner court of the king’s house, over against the king’s hall: now he sat upon his throne in the hall of the palace, over against the door of the house.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when he saw Esther the queen standing, she pleased his eyes, and he held out toward her the golden sceptre, which he held in his hand and she drew near, and kissed the top of his sceptre.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said to her: What wilt thou, queen Esther? what is thy request? if thou shouldst even ask one half of the kingdom, it shall be given to thee.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But she answered: If it please the king, I beseech thee to come to me this day, and Aman with thee to the banquet which I have prepared.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said forthwith: Call ye Aman quickly, that he may obey Esther’s will. So the king and Aman came to the banquet which the queen had prepared for them.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said to her, after he had drunk wine plentifully: What dost thou desire should be given thee? and for what thing askest thou? although thou shouldst ask the half of my kingdom, thou shalt have it.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Esther answered: My petition and request is this:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: If I have found favour in the king’s sight, and if it please the king to give me what I ask, and to fulfil my petition: let the king and Aman come to the banquet which I have prepared them, and to morrow I will open my mind to the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So Aman went out that day joyful and merry. And when he saw Mardochai sitting before the gate of the palace, and that he not only did not rise up to honour him, but did not so much as move from the place where he sat, he was exceedingly angry:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But dissembling his anger, and returning into his house, he called together to him his friends, and Zares his wife:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he declared to them the greatness of his riches, and the multitude of his children, and with how great glory the king had advanced him above all his princes and servants.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And after this he said: Queen Esther also hath invited no other to the banquet with the king, but me: and with her I am also to dine to morrow with the king:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And whereas I have all these things, I think I have nothing, so long as I see Mardochai the Jew sitting before the king’s gate.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then Zares his wife, and the rest of his friends answered him: Order a great beam to be prepared, fifty cubits high, and in the morning speak to the king, that Mardochai may be hanged upon it, and so thou shalt go full of joy with the king to the banquet. The counsel pleased him, and he commanded a high gibbet to be prepared. Esther Chapter 6 The king hearing of the good service done him by Mardochai, commandeth Aman to honour him next to the king, which he performeth.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: That night the king passed without sleep, and he commanded the histories and chronicles of former times to be brought him. And when they were reading them before him,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: They came to that place where it was written, how Mardochai had discovered the treason of Bagathan and Thares the eunuchs, who sought to kill king Assuerus.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when the king heard this, he said: What honour and reward hath Mardochai received for this fidelity? His servants and ministers said to him: He hath received no reward at all. No reward at all.... He received some presents from the king, chap. 12.5; but these were so inconsiderable in the opinion of the courtiers, that they esteemed them as nothing at all.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said immediately: Who is in the court? for Aman was coming in to the inner court of the king’s house, to speak to the king, that he might order Mardochai to be hanged upon the gibbet, which was prepared for him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The servants answered: Aman standeth in the court, and the king said: Let him come in.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when he was come in, he said to him: What ought to be done to the man whom the king is desirous to honour? But Aman thinking in his heart, and supposing that the king would honour no other but himself,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Answered: The man whom the king desireth to honour,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Ought to be clothed with the king’s apparel, and to be set upon the horse that the king rideth upon, and to have the royal crown upon his head,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And let the first of the king’s princes and nobles hold his horse, and going through the street of the city, proclaim before him and say: Thus shall he be honoured, whom the king hath a mind to honour.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said to him: Make haste and take the robe and the horse, and do as thou hast spoken to Mardochai the Jew, who sitteth before the gates of the palace. Beware thou pass over any of those things which thou hast spoken.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So Aman took the robe and the horse, and arraying Mardochai in the street of the city, and setting him on the horse, went before him, and proclaimed: This honour is he worthy of, whom the king hath a mind to honour.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But Mardochai returned to the palace gate: and Aman made haste to go to his house, mourning and having his head covered:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he told Zares his wife, and his friends, all that had befallen him. And the wise men whom he had in counsel, and his wife answered him: If Mardochai be of the seed of the Jews, before whom thou hast begun to fall, thou canst not resist him, but thou shalt fall in his sight.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: As they were yet speaking, the king’s eunuchs came, and compelled him to go quickly to the banquet which the queen had prepared. Esther Chapter 7 Esther’s petition for herself and her people: Aman is hanged upon the gibbet he had prepared for Mardochai.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So the king and Aman went in, to drink with the queen.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king said to her again the second day, after he was warm with wine: What is thy petition, Esther, that it may be granted thee? and what wilt thou have done: although thou ask the half of my kingdom, thou shalt have it.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then she answered: If I have found favour in thy sight, O king, and if it please thee, give me my life for which I ask, and my people for which I request.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For we are given up, I and my people, to be destroyed, to be slain, and to perish. And would God we were sold for bondmen and bondwomen: the evil might be borne with, and I would have mourned in silence: but now we have an enemy, whose cruelty redoundeth upon the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And king Assuerus answered and said: Who is this, and of what power, that he should do these things?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Esther said: It is this Aman that is our adversary and most wicked enemy. Aman hearing this was forthwith astonished, not being able to bear the countenance of the king and of the queen.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But the king being angry rose up, and went from the place of the banquet into the garden set with trees. Aman also rose up to entreat Esther the queen for his life, for he understood that evil was prepared for him by the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when the king came back out of the garden set with trees, and entered into the place of the banquet, he found Aman was fallen upon the bed on which Esther lay, and he said: He will force the queen also in my presence, in my own house. The word was not yet gone out of the king’s mouth, and immediately they covered his face.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Harbona, one of the eunuchs that stood waiting on the king, said: Behold the gibbet which he hath prepared for Mardochai, who spoke for the king, standeth in Aman’s house, being fifty cubits high. And the king said to him: Hang him upon it.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So Aman was hanged on the gibbet, which he had prepared for Mardochai: and the king’s wrath ceased. Esther Chapter 8 Mardochai is advanced: Aman’s letters are reversed.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: On that day king Assuerus gave the house of Aman, the Jews’ enemy, to queen Esther, and Mardochai came in before the king. For Esther had confessed to him that he was her uncle.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king took the ring which he had commanded to be taken again from Aman, and gave it to Mardochai. And Esther set Mardochai over her house.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And not content with these things, she fell down at the king’s feet and wept, and speaking to him besought him, that he would give orders that the malice of Aman the Agagite, and his most wicked devices which he had invented against the Jews, should be of no effect.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But he, as the manner was, held out the golden sceptre with his hand, which was the sign of clemency: and she arose up and stood before him,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And said: If it please the king, and if I have found favour in his sight, and my request be not disagreeable to him, I beseech thee, that the former letters of Aman the traitor and enemy of the Jews, by which he commanded that they should be destroyed in all the king’s provinces, may be reversed by new letters.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For how can I endure the murdering and slaughter of my people?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And king Assuerus answered Esther the queen, and Mardochai the Jew: I have given Aman’s house to Esther, and I have commanded him to be hanged on a gibbet, because he durst lay hands on the Jews.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Write ye therefore to the Jews, as it pleaseth you in the king’s name, and seal the letters with my ring. For this was the custom, that no man durst gainsay the letters which were sent in the king’s name, and were sealed with his ring.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then the king’s scribes and secretaries were called for (now it was the time of the third month which is called Siban) the three and twentieth day of the month, and letters were written, as Mardochai had a mind, to the Jews, and to the governors, and to the deputies, and to the judges, who were rulers over the hundred and twenty-seven provinces, from India even to Ethiopia: to province and province, to people and people, according to their languages and characters, and to the Jews, according as they could read and hear.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And these letters which were sent in the king’s name, were sealed with his ring, and sent by posts: who were to run through all the provinces, to prevent the former letters with new messages.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king gave orders to them, to speak to the Jews in every city, and to command them to gather themselves together, and to stand for their lives, and to kill and destroy all their enemies with their wives and children and all their houses, and to take their spoil.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And one day of revenge was appointed through all the provinces, to wit, the thirteenth of the twelfth month Adar.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And this was the content of the letter, that it should be notified in all lands and peoples that were subject to the empire of king Assuerus, that the Jews were ready to be revenged of their enemies.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So the swift posts went out carrying the messages, and the king’s edict was hung up in Susan.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Mardochai going forth out of the palace, and from the king’s presence, shone in royal apparel, to wit, of violet and sky colour, wearing a golden crown on his head, and clothed with a cloak of silk and purple. And all the city rejoiced, and was glad.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But to the Jews, a new light seemed to rise, joy, honour, and dancing.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And in all peoples, cities, and provinces, whithersoever the king’s commandments came, there was wonderful rejoicing, feasts and banquets, and keeping holy day: Insomuch that many of other nations and religion, joined themselves to their worship and ceremonies. For a great dread of the name of the Jews had fallen upon all. Esther Chapter 9 The Jews kill their enemies that would have killed them. The days of Phurim are appointed to be kept holy.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which as we have said above is called Adar, when all the Jews were designed to be massacred, and their enemies were greedy after their blood, the case being altered, the Jews began to have the upper hand, and to revenge themselves of their adversaries. To revenge, etc.... The Jews on this occasion, by authority from the king, were made executioners of the public justice, for punishing by death a crime worthy of death, viz., a malicious conspiracy for extirpating their whole nation.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And they gathered themselves together in every city, and town, and place, to lay their hands on their enemies, and their persecutors. And no one durst withstand them, for the fear of their power had gone through every people.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the judges of the provinces, and the governors, and lieutenants, and every one in dignity, that presided over every place and work, extolled the Jews for fear of Mardochai:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For they knew him to be prince of the palace, and to have great power: and the fame of his name increased daily, and was spread abroad through all men’s mouths.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So the Jews made a great slaughter of their enemies, and killed them, repaying according to what they had prepared to do to them:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Insomuch that even in Susan they killed five hundred men, besides the ten sons of Aman the Agagite, the enemy of the Jews: whose names are these:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Pharsandatha, and Delphon, and Esphatha

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Phoratha, and Adalia, and Aridatha,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Phermesta, and Arisai, and Aridai, and Jezatha.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when they had slain them, they would not touch the spoils of their goods.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And presently the number of them that were killed in Susan was brought to the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he said to the queen: The Jews have killed five hundred men in the city of Susan, besides the ten sons of Aman: how many dost thou think they have slain in all the provinces? What askest thou more, and what wilt thou have me to command to be done?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And she answered: If it please the king, let it be granted to the Jews, to do to morrow in Susan as they have done to day, and that the ten sons of Aman may be hanged upon gibbets.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king commanded that it should be so done. And forthwith the edict was hung up in Susan, and the ten sons of Aman were hanged.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And on the fourteenth day of the month Adar the Jews gathered themselves together, and they killed in Susan three hundred men: but they took not their substance.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Moreover through all the provinces which were subject to the king’s dominion the Jews stood for their lives, and slew their enemies and persecutors: insomuch that the number of them that were killed amounted to seventy-five thousand, and no man took any of their goods.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now the thirteenth day of the month Adar was the first day with them all of the slaughter, and on the fourteenth day they left off. Which they ordained to be kept holy day, so that all times hereafter they should celebrate it with feasting, joy, and banquets.

Book: The Book of Esther
