Text: Therefore are there many infirm and weak among you: and many sleep.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But whilst we are judged, we are chastised by the Lord, that we be not condemned with this world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore, my brethren, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: If any man be hungry, let him eat at home; that you come not together unto judgment. And the rest I will set in order, when I come. 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Of the diversity of spiritual gifts. The members of the mystical body, like those of the natural body, must mutually cherish one another.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now concerning spiritual things, my brethren, I would not have you ignorant.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: You know that when you were heathens, you went to dumb idols, according as you were led.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore, I give you to understand that no man, speaking by the Spirit of God, saith Anathema to Jesus. And no man can say The Lord Jesus, but by the Holy Ghost.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now there are diversities of graces, but the same Spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And there are diversities of ministries, but the same Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And there are diversities of operations, but the same God, who worketh all in all.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man unto profit.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: To one indeed, by the Spirit, is given the word of wisdom: and to another, the word of knowledge, according to the same Spirit:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: To another, faith in the same spirit: to another, the grace of healing in one Spirit:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: To another the working of miracles: to another, prophecy: to another, the discerning of spirits: to another, diverse kinds of tongues: to another, interpretation of speeches.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But all these things, one and the same Spirit worketh, dividing to every one according as he will.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For as the body is one and hath many members; and all the members of the body, whereas they are many, yet are one body: So also is Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For in one Spirit were we all baptized into one body, whether Jews or Gentiles, whether bond or free: and in one Spirit we have all been made to drink.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For the body also is not one member, but many.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: If the foot should say: Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body: Is it therefore not of the body?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And if the ear should say: Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body: Is it therefore not of the body?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: If the whole body were the eye, where would be the hearing? If the whole were hearing, where would be the smelling?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But now God hath set the members, every one of them, in the body as it hath pleased him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And if they all were one member, where would be the body?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But now there are many members indeed, yet one body.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And the eye cannot say to the hand: I need not thy help. Nor again the head to the feet: I have no need of you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Yea, much more those that seem to be the more feeble members of the body are more necessary.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And such as we think to be the less honourable members of the body, about these we put more abundant honour: and those that are our uncomely parts have more abundant comeliness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But our comely parts have no need: but God hath tempered the body together, giving to that which wanted the more abundant honour.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: That there might be no schism in the body: but the members might be mutually careful one for another.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And if one member suffer any thing, all the members suffer with it: or if one member glory, all the members rejoice with it.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now you are the body of Christ and members of member.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And God indeed hath set some in the church; first apostles, secondly prophets, thirdly doctors: after that miracles: then the graces of healings, helps, governments, kinds of tongues, interpretations of speeches.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all doctors?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Are all workers of miracles? Have all the grace of healing? Do all speak with tongues? Do all interpret?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But be zealous for the better gifts. And I shew unto you yet a more excellent way. 1 Corinthians Chapter 13 Charity is to be preferred before all gifts.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: If I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not charity, I am become as sounding brass, or a tinkling cymbal.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And if I should have prophecy and should know all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I should have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, and have not charity, I am nothing.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And if I should distribute all my goods to feed the poor, and if I should deliver my body to be burned, and have not charity, it profiteth me nothing.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Charity is patient, is kind: charity envieth not, dealeth not perversely, is not puffed up,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Is not ambitious, seeketh not her own, is not provoked to anger, thinketh no evil:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth with the truth:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Charity never falleth away: whether prophecies shall be made void or tongues shall cease or knowledge shall be destroyed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For we know in part: and we prophesy in part.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But when that which is perfect is come, that which is in part shall be done away.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child. But, when I became a man, I put away the things of a child.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: We see now through a glass in a dark manner: but then face to face. Now I know in part: but then I shall know even as I am known.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And now there remain faith, hope, and charity, these three: but the greatest of these is charity. 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 The gift of prophesying is to be preferred before that of speaking strange tongues.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Follow after charity, be zealous for spiritual gifts; but rather that you may prophesy. Prophesy.... That is, declare or expound the mysteries of faith.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For he that speaketh in a tongue speaketh not unto men, but unto God: for no man heareth. Yet by the Spirit he speaketh mysteries. Not unto men.... Viz., so as to be heard, that is, so as to be understood by them.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But he that prophesieth speaketh to men unto edification and exhortation and comfort.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: He that speaketh in a tongue edifieth himself: but he that prophesieth, edifieth the church.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And I would have you all to speak with tongues, but rather to prophesy. For greater is he that prophesieth than he that speaketh with tongues: unless perhaps he interpret, that the church may receive edification.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But now, brethren, if I come to you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you, unless I speak to you either in revelation or in knowledge or in prophecy or in doctrine?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Even things without life that give sound, whether pipe or harp, except they give a distinction of sounds, how shall it be known what is piped or harped?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself to the battle?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: So likewise you, except you utter by the tongue plain speech, how shall it be known what is said? For you shall be speaking into the air.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: There are, for example, so many kinds of tongues in this world: and none is without voice.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: If then I know not the power of the voice, I shall be to him to whom I speak a barbarian: and he that speaketh a barbarian to me.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: So you also, forasmuch as you are zealous of spirits, seek to abound unto the edifying of the church. Of spirits.... Of spiritual gifts.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And therefore he that speaketh by a tongue, let him pray that he may interpret.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For if I pray in a tongue, my spirit prayeth: but my understanding is without fruit.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, I will pray also with the understanding, I will sing with the spirit, I will sing also with the understanding.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Else, if thou shalt bless with the spirit, how shall he that holdeth the place of the unlearned say, Amen, to thy blessing? Because he knoweth not what thou sayest. Amen.... The unlearned, not knowing that you are then blessing, will not be qualified to join with you by saying Amen to your blessing. The use or abuse of strange tongues, of which the apostle here speaks, does not regard the public liturgy of the church, (in which strange tongues were never used,) but certain conferences of the faithful, ver. 26, etc., in which, meeting together, they discovered to one another their various miraculous gifts of the Spirit, common in those primitive times; amongst which the apostle prefers that of prophesying before that of speaking strange tongues, because it was more to the public edification. Where also not, that the Latin, used in our liturgy, is so far from being a strange or unknown tongue, that it is perhaps the best known tongue in the world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For thou indeed givest thanks well: but the other is not edified.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: I thank my God I speak with all your tongues.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But in the church I had rather speak five words with my understanding, that I may instruct others also: than ten thousand words in a tongue.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Brethren, do not become children in sense. But in malice be children: and in sense be perfect.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: In the law it is written: In other tongues and other lips I will speak to this people: and neither so will they hear me, saith the Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore tongues are for a sign, not to believers but to unbelievers: but prophecies, not to unbelievers but to believers.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: If therefore the whole church come together into one place, and all speak with tongues, and there come in unlearned persons or infidels, will they not say that you are mad?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But if all prophesy, and there come in one that believeth not or an unlearned person, he is convinced of all: he is judged of all.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: The secrets of his heart are made manifest. And so, falling down on his face, he will adore God, affirming that God is among you indeed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: How is it then, brethren? When you come together, every one of you hath a psalm, hath a doctrine, hath a revelation, hath a tongue, hath an interpretation: let all things be done to edification.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: If any speak with a tongue, let it be by two, or at the most by three, and in course: and let one interpret.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But if there be no interpreter, let him hold his peace in the church and speak to himself and to God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And let the prophets speak, two or three: and let the rest judge.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But if any thing be revealed to another sitting, let the first hold his peace.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For you may all prophesy, one by one, that all may learn and all may be exhorted.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For God is not the God of dissension, but of peace: as also I teach in all the churches of the saints.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Let women keep silence in the churches: for it is not permitted them to speak but to be subject, as also the law saith.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But if they would learn anything, let them ask their husbands at home. For it is a shame for a woman to speak in the church.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Or did the word of God come out from you? Or came it only unto you?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: If any seem to be a prophet or spiritual, let him know the things that I write to you, that they are the commandments of the Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But if any man know not, he shall not be known.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Wherefore, brethren, be zealous to prophesy: and forbid not to speak with tongues.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But let all things be done decently and according to order. 1 Corinthians Chapter 15 Christ’s resurrection and ours. The manner of our resurrection.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now I make known unto you, brethren, the gospel which I preached to you, which also you have received and wherein you stand.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: By which also you are saved, if you hold fast after what manner I preached unto you, unless you have believed in vain.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For I delivered unto you first of all, which I also received: how that Christ died for our sins, according to the scriptures:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And that he was buried: and that he rose again the third day, according to the scriptures:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And that he was seen by Cephas, and after that by the eleven.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Then was he seen by more than five hundred brethren at once: of whom many remain until this present, and some are fallen asleep.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: After that, he was seen by James: then by all the apostles.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And last of all, he was seen also by me, as by one born out of due time.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For I am the least of the apostles, who am not worthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But by the grace of God, I am what I am. And his grace in me hath not been void: but I have laboured more abundantly than all they. Yet not I, but the grace of God with me:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For whether I or they, so we preach: and so you have believed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now if Christ be preached, that he arose again from the dead, how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But if there be no resurrection of the dead, then Christ is not risen again.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And if Christ be not risen again, then is our preaching vain: and your faith is also vain.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Yea, and we are found false witnesses of God: because we have given testimony against God, that he hath raised up Christ, whom he hath not raised up, if the dead rise not again.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For if the dead rise not again, neither is Christ risen again.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And if Christ be not risen again, your faith is vain: for you are yet in your sins.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Then they also that are fallen asleep in Christ are perished.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But now Christ is risen from the dead, the firstfruits of them that sleep:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For by a man came death: and by a man the resurrection of the dead.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And as in Adam all die, so also in Christ all shall be made alive.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But every one in his own order: the firstfruits, Christ: then they that are of Christ, who have believed in his coming.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Afterwards the end: when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to God and the Father: when he shall have brought to nought all principality and power and virtue.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For he must reign, until he hath put all his enemies under his feet.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And the enemy, death, shall be destroyed last: For he hath put all things under his feet. And whereas he saith:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: All things are put under him; undoubtedly, he is excepted, who put all things under him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And when all things shall be subdued unto him, then the Son also himself shall be subject unto him that put all things under him, that God may be all in all. The Son also himself shall be subject unto him.... That is, the Son will be subject to the Father, according to his human nature, even after the general resurrection; and also the whole mystical body of Christ will be entirely subject to God, obeying him in every thing.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Otherwise, what shall they do that are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not again at all? Why are they then baptized for them? That are baptized for the dead.... Some think the apostle here alludes to a ceremony then in use; but others, more probably, to the prayers and penitential labours, performed by the primitive Christians for the souls of the faithful departed; or to the baptism of afflictions and sufferings undergone for sinners spiritually dead.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Why also are we in danger every hour?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: I die daily, I protest by your glory, brethren, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: If (according to man) I fought with beasts at Ephesus, what doth it profit me, if the dead rise not again? Let us eat and drink, for to morrow we shall die. Let us eat and drink, etc.... That is, if we did not believe that we were to rise again from the dead, we might live like the impious and wicked, who have no belief in the resurrection.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Be not seduced: Evil communications corrupt good manners.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Awake, ye just, and sin not. For some have not the knowledge of God. I speak it to your shame.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But some man will say: How do the dead rise again? Or with what manner of body shall they come?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Senseless man, that which thou sowest is not quickened, except it die first.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And that which thou sowest, thou sowest not the body that shall be: but bare grain, as of wheat, or of some of the rest.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But God giveth it a body as he will: and to every seed its proper body.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: All flesh is not the same flesh: but one is the flesh of men, another of beasts, another of birds, another of fishes.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And there are bodies celestial and bodies terrestrial: but, one is the glory of the celestial, and another of the terrestrial.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: One is the glory of the sun, another the glory of the moon, and another the glory of the stars. For star differeth from star in glory.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption: it shall rise in incorruption.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: It is sown in dishonour: it shall rise in glory. It is sown in weakness: it shall rise in power.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: It is sown a natural body: it shall rise a spiritual body. If there be a natural body, there is also a spiritual body, as it is written:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: The first man Adam was made into a living soul; the last Adam into a quickening spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Yet that was not first which is spiritual, but that which is natural: afterwards that which is spiritual.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: The first man was of the earth, earthly: the second man, from heaven, heavenly.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Such as is the earthly, such also are the earthly: and such as is the heavenly, such also are they that are heavenly.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore, as we have borne the image of the earthly, let us bear also the image of the heavenly.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot possess the kingdom of God: neither shall corruption possess incorruption.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Behold, I tell you a mystery. We shall all indeed rise again: but we shall not all be changed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet: for the trumpet shall sound and the dead shall rise again incorruptible. And we shall be changed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For this corruptible must put on incorruption: and this mortal must put on immortality.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And when this mortal hath put on immortality, then shall come to pass the saying that is written: Death is swallowed up in victory.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: O death, where is thy victory? O death, where is thy sting?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now the sting of death is sin: and the power of sin is the law.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But thanks be to God, who hath given us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye steadfast and unmoveable: always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that your labour is not in vain in the Lord. 1 Corinthians Chapter 16 Of collection of alms. Admonitions and salutations.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now concerning the collections that are made for the saints: as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, so do ye also.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: On the first day of the week, let every one of you put apart with himself, laying up what it shall well please him: that when I come, the collections be not then to be made.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And when I shall be with you, whomsoever you shall approve by letters, them will I send to carry your grace to Jerusalem.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And if it be meet that I also go, they shall go with me.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now I will come to you, when I shall have passed through Macedonia. For I shall pass through Macedonia.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And with you perhaps I shall abide, or even spend the winter: that you may bring me on my way whithersoever I shall go.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For I will not see you now by the way: for I trust that I shall abide with you some time, if the Lord permit.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But I will tarry at Ephesus, until Pentecost.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For a great door and evident is opened unto me: and many adversaries.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now if Timothy come, see that he be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct ye him on his way in peace, that he may come to me. For I look for him with the brethren.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And touching our brother Apollo, I give you to understand that I much entreated him to come unto you with the brethren: and indeed it was not his will at all to come at this time. But he will come when he shall have leisure.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Watch ye: stand fast in the faith: do manfully and be strengthened.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Let all your things be done in charity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And I beseech you, brethren, you know the house of Stephanus, and of Fortunatus, and of Achaicus, that they are the firstfruits of Achaia, and have dedicated themselves to the ministry of the saints:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: That you also be subject to such and to every one that worketh with us and laboureth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And I rejoice in the presence of Stephanus and Fortunatus and Achaicus: because that which was wanting on your part, they have supplied.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For they have refreshed both my spirit and yours. Know them, therefore, that are such.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house, with whom I also lodge.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: All the brethren salute you. Salute one another with a holy kiss.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: The salutation of me Paul, with my own hand.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: If any man love not our Lord Jesus Christ, let him be anathema, maranatha. Let him be anathema, maranatha.... Anathema signifies here a thing accursed. Maran-atha, which, according to St. Jerome and St. Chrysostom, signify, ‘The Lord is come’ already, and therefore is to be taken as an admonition to those who doubted of the resurrection, and to put them in mind that Christ, the judge of the living and the dead, is come already. Others explain Maran-atha: ‘May our Lord come’, that is, to judge and punish those with exemplary judgments and punishments, that do not love the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: My charity be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon and our hands have handled, of the word of life.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For the life was manifested: and we have seen and do bear witness and declare unto you the life eternal, which was with the Father and hath appeared to us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: That which we have seen and have heard, we declare unto you: that you also may have fellowship with us and our fellowship may be with the Father and with his Son Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And these things we write to you, that you may rejoice and your joy may be full.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this is the declaration which we have heard from him and declare unto you: That God is light and in him there is no darkness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If we say that we have fellowship with him and walk in darkness, we lie and do not the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But if we walk in the light, as he also is in the light, we have fellowship one with another: And the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just, to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all iniquity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar: and his word is not in us. 1 John Chapter 2 Christ is our advocate. We must keep his commandments and love one another. We must not love the world nor give ear to new teachers, but abide by the spirit of God in the church.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: My little children, these things I write to you, that you may not sin. But if any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the just.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he is the propitiation for our sins: and not for ours only, but also for those of the whole world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And by this we know that we have known him, if we keep his commandments. We have known him, if we keep his commandments.... He speaks of that practical knowledge by love and affection, which can only be proved by our keeping his commandments; and without which we can not be said to know God as we should do.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He who saith that he knoweth him and keepeth not his commandments is a liar: and the truth is not in him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But he that keepeth his word, in him in very deed the charity of God is perfected. And by this we know that we are in him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also to walk even as he walked.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, I write not a new commandment to you, but an old commandment which you had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which you have heard.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Again a new commandment I write unto you: which thing is true both in him and in you, because the darkness is passed and the true light now shineth. A new commandment.... Viz., the commandment of love, which was first given in the old law; but was renewed and extended by Christ. See John 13.34.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that saith he is in the light and hateth his brother is in darkness even until now.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that loveth his brother abideth in the light: and there is no scandal in him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But he that hateth his brother is in darkness and walketh in darkness and knoweth not whither he goeth: because the darkness hath blinded his eyes.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I write unto you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name’s sake.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I write unto you, fathers, because you have known him who is from the beginning. I write unto you, young men, because you have overcome the wicked one.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I write unto you, babes, because you have known the Father. I write unto you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God abideth in you, and you have overcome the wicked one.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Love not the world, nor the things which are in the world. If any man love the world, the charity of the Father is not in him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For all that is in the world is the concupiscence of the flesh and the concupiscence of the eyes and the pride of life, which is not of the Father but is of the world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the world passeth away and the concupiscence thereof: but he that doth the will of God abideth for ever.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Little children, it is the last hour: and as you have heard that Antichrist cometh, even now there are become many Antichrists: whereby we know that it is the last hour. It is the last hour.... That is, it is the last age of the world. Many Antichrists; ... that is, many heretics, enemies of Christ and his church, and forerunners of the great Antichrist.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: They went out from us but they were not of us. For if they had been of us, they would no doubt have remained with us: but that they may be manifest, that they are not all of us. They were not of us.... That is, they were not solid, steadfast, genuine Christians: otherwise they would have remained in the church.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But you have the unction from the Holy One and know all things. The unction from the Holy One.... That is, grace and wisdom from the Holy Ghost. Know all things.... The true children of God’s church, remaining in unity, under the guidance of their lawful pastors, partake of the grace of the Holy Ghost, promised to the church and her pastors; and have in the church all necessary knowledge and instruction; so as to have no need to seek it elsewhere, since it can be only found in that society of which they are members.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I have not written to you as to them that know not the truth, but as to them that know it: and that no lie is of the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Who is a liar, but he who denieth that Jesus is the Christ? This is Antichrist, who denieth the Father and the Son.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever denieth the Son, the same hath not the Father. He that confesseth the Son hath the Father also.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: As for you, let that which you have heard from the beginning abide in you. If that abide in you, which you have heard from the beginning, you also shall abide in the Son and in the Father.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this is the promise which he hath promised us, life everlasting.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: These things have I written to you concerning them that seduce you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And as for you, let the unction, which you have received from him abide in you. And you have no need that any man teach you: but as his unction teacheth you of all things and is truth and is no lie. And as it hath taught you, abide in him. You have no need, etc.... You want not to be taught by any of these men, who, under pretence of imparting more knowledge to you, seek to seduce you (ver. 26), since you are sufficiently taught already, and have all knowledge and grace in the church, with the unction of the Holy Ghost; which these new teachers have no share in.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And now, little children, abide in him, that when he shall appear we may have confidence and not be confounded by him at his coming.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If you know that he is just, know ye, that every one also who doth justice is born of him. 1 John Chapter 3 Of the love of God to us. How we may distinguish the children of God and those of the devil. Of loving one another and of purity of conscience.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Behold what manner of charity the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called and should be the sons of God. Therefore the world knoweth not us, because it knew not him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, we are now the sons of God: and it hath not yet appeared what we shall be. We know that when he shall appear we shall be like to him: because we shall see him as he is.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And every one that hath this hope in him sanctifieth himself, as he also is holy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever committeth sin committeth also iniquity. And sin is iniquity. Iniquity.... transgression of the law.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And you know that he appeared to take away our sins: and in him there is no sin.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever abideth in him sinneth not: and whosoever sinneth hath not seen him nor known him. Sinneth not.... viz., mortally. See chap. 1.8.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Little children, let no man deceive you. He that doth justice is just, even as he is just.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that committeth sin is of the devil: for the devil sinneth from the beginning. For this purpose the Son of God appeared, that he might destroy the works of the devil.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever is born of God committeth not sin: for his seed abideth in him. And he cannot sin, because he is born of God. Committeth not sin.... That is, as long as he keepeth in himself this seed of grace, and this divine generation, by which he is born of God. But then he may fall from this happy state, by the abuse of his free will, as appears from Rom. 11.20-22; Cor. 9.27; and 10.12; Phil. 2.12; Apoc. 3.11.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this the children of God are manifest, and the children of the devil. Whosoever is not just is not of God, nor he that loveth not his brother.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For this is the declaration which you have heard from the beginning, that you should love one another.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Not as Cain, who was of the wicked one and killed his brother. And wherefore did he kill him? Because his own works were wicked: and his brother’s just.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Wonder not, brethren, if the world hate you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: We know that we have passed from death to life, because we love the brethren. He that loveth not abideth in death.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever hateth his brother is a murderer. And you know that no murderer hath eternal life abiding in himself.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this we have known the charity of God, because he hath laid down his life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brethren.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hath the substance of this world and shall see his brother in need and shall shut up his bowels from him: how doth the charity of God abide in him?

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: My little children, let us not love in word nor in tongue, but in deed and in truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this we know that we are of the truth and in his sight shall persuade our hearts.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For if our heart reprehend us, God is greater than our heart and knoweth all things.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, if our heart do not reprehend us, we have confidence towards God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And whatsoever we shall ask, we shall receive of him: because we keep his commandments and do those things which are pleasing in his sight.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this is his commandment: That we should believe in the name of his Son Jesus Christ and love one another, as he hath given commandment unto us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he that keepeth his commandments abideth in him, and he in him. And in this we know that he abideth in us by the Spirit which he hath given us. 1 John Chapter 4 What spirits are of God, and what are not. We must love one another, because God has loved us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits if they be of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world. Try the spirits.... Viz., by examining whether their teaching be agreeable to the rule of the Catholic faith, and the doctrine of the church. For as he says, (ver. 6,) He that knoweth God, heareth us [the pastors of the church]. By this we know the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: By this is the spirit of God known. Every spirit which confesseth that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God: Every spirit which confesseth, etc.... Not that the confession of this point of faith alone, is, at all times, and in all cases, sufficient; but that with relation to that time, and for that part of the Christian doctrine, which was then particularly to be confessed, taught, and maintained against the heretics of those days, this was the most proper token, by which the true teachers might be distinguished form the false.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And every spirit that dissolveth Jesus is not of God. And this is Antichrist, of whom you have heard that he cometh: and he is now already in the world. That dissolveth Jesus.... Viz., either by denying his humanity, or his divinity. He is now already in the world.... Not in his person, but in his spirit, and in his precursors.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: You are of God, little children, and have overcome him. Because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: They are of the world. Therefore of the world they speak: and the world heareth them.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: We are of God. He that knoweth God heareth us. He that is not of God heareth us not. By this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, let us love one another: for charity is of God. And every one that loveth is born of God and knoweth God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that loveth not knoweth not God: for God is charity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: By this hath the charity of God appeared towards us, because God hath sent his only begotten Son into the world, that we may live by him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this is charity: not as though we had loved God, but because he hath first loved us, and sent his Son to be a propitiation for our sins.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: My dearest, if God hath so loved us, we also ought to love one another.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: No man hath seen God at any time. If we love one another, God abideth in us: and his charity is perfected in us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this we know that we abide in him, and he in us: because he hath given us of his spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And we have seen and do testify that the Father hath sent his Son to be the Saviour of the world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God abideth in him, and he in God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And we have known and have believed the charity which God hath to us. God is charity: and he that abideth in charity abideth in God, and God in him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this is the charity of God perfected with us, that we may have confidence in the day of judgment: because as he is, we also are in this world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Fear is not in charity: but perfect charity casteth out fear, because fear hath pain. And he that feareth is not perfected in charity. Fear is not in charity, etc.... Perfect charity, or love, banisheth human fear, that is, the fear of men; as also all perplexing fear, which makes men mistrust or despair of God’s mercy; and that kind of servile fear, which makes them fear the punishment of sin more than the offence offered to God. But it no way excludes the wholesome fear of God’s judgments, so often recomended in holy writ; nor that fear and trembling, with which we are told to work out our salvation. Phil. 2.12.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Let us therefore love God: because God first hath loved us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If any man say: I love God, and hateth his brother; he is a liar. For he that loveth not his brother whom he seeth, how can he love God whom he seeth not?

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this commandment we have from God, that he who loveth God love also his brother. 1 John Chapter 5 Of them that are born of God, and of true charity. Faith overcomes the world. Three that bear witness to Christ. Of faith in his name and of sin that is and is not to death.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ, is born of God. And every one that loveth him who begot, loveth him also who is born of him. Is born of God.... That is, is justified, and become a child of God by baptism: which is also to be understood; provided the belief of this fundamental article of the Christian faith be accompanied with all the other conditions, which, by the word of God, and his appointment, are also required to justification; such as a general belief of all that God has revealed and promised: hope, love, repentance, and a sincere disposition to keep God’s holy law and commandments.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this we know that we love the children of God: when we love God and keep his commandments.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For this is the charity of God: That we keep his commandments. And his commandments are not heavy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world. And this is the victory which overcometh the world: Our faith. Our faith.... Not a bare, speculative, or dead faith; but a faith that worketh by charity. Gal. 5.6

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Who is he that overcometh the world, but he that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God?

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: This is he that came by water and blood, Jesus Christ: not by water only but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit which testifieth that Christ is the truth. Came by water and blood.... Not only to wash away our sins by the water of baptism, but by his own blood.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there are Three who give testimony in heaven, the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost. And these three are one.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there are three that give testimony on earth: the spirit and the water and the blood. And these three are one. The spirit, and the water, and the blood.... As the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost, all bear witness to Christ’s divinity; so the spirit, which he yielded up, crying out with a loud voice upon the cross; and the water and blood that issued from his side, bear witness to his humanity, and are one; that is, all agree in one testimony.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If we receive the testimony of men, the testimony of God is greater. For this is the testimony of God, which is greater, because he hath testified of his Son.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that believeth in the Son of God hath the testimony of God in himself. He that believeth not the Son maketh him a liar: because he believeth not in the testimony which God hath testified of his Son. He that believeth not the Son, etc.... By refusing to believe the testimonies given by the three divine persons, that Jesus was the Messias, and the true Son of God, by whom eternal life is obtained and promised to all that comply with his doctrine. In him we have also this lively confidence, that we shall obtain whatever we ask, according to his will, when we ask what is for our good, with perseverance, and in the manner we ought. And this we know, and have experience of, by having obtained the petitions that we have made.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this is the testimony that God hath given to us eternal life. And this life is in his Son.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hath the Son hath life. He that hath not the Son hath not life.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: These things I write to you that you may know that you have eternal life: you who believe in the name of the Son of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this is the confidence which we have towards him: That, whatsoever we shall ask according to his will, he heareth us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And we know that he heareth us whatsoever we ask: we know that we have the petitions which we request of him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that knoweth his brother to sin a sin which is not to death, let him ask: and life shall be given to him who sinneth not to death. There is a sin unto death. For that I say not that any man ask. A sin which is not to death, etc.... It is hard to determine what St. John here calls a sin which is not to death, and a sin which is unto death. The difference can not be the same as betwixt sins that are called venial and mortal: for he says, that if a man pray for his brother, who commits a sin that is not to death, life shall be given him: therefore such a one had before lost the life of grace, and been guilty of what is commonly called a mortal sin. And when he speaks of a sin that is unto death, and adds these words, for that I say not that any man ask, it cannot be supposed that St. John would say this of every mortal sin, but only of some heinous sins, which are very seldom remitted, because such sinners very seldom repent. By a sin therefore which is unto death, interpreters commonly understand a wilfull apostasy from the faith, and from the known truth, when a sinner, hardened by his own ingratitude, becomes deaf to all admonitions, will do nothing for himself, but runs on to a final impenitence. Nor yet does St. John say, that such a sin is never remitted, or cannot be remitted, but only has these words, for that I say not that any man ask the remission: that is, though we must pray for all sinners whatsoever, yet men can not pray for such sinners with such a confidence of obtaining always their petitions, as St. John said before, ver. 14. Whatever exposition we follow on this verse, our faith teacheth us from the holy scriptures, that God desires not the death of any sinner, but that he be converted and live, Ezech. 33.11. Though men’s sins be as red as scarlet, they shall become as white as snow, Isa. 3.18. It is the will of God that every one come to the knowledge of the truth, and be saved. There is no sin so great but which God is willing to forgive, and has left a power in his church to remit the most enormous sins: so that no sinner need despair of pardon, nor will any sinner perish, but by his own fault. A sin unto death.... Some understand this of final impenitence, or of dying in mortal sin; which is the only sin that never can be remitted. But, it is probable, he may also comprise under this name, the sin of apostasy from the faith, and some other such heinous sins as are seldom and hardly remitted: and therefore he gives little encouragement, to such as pray for these sinners, to expect what they ask.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: All iniquity is sin. And there is a sin unto death.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: We know that whosoever is born of God sinneth not: but the generation of God preserveth him and the wicked one toucheth him not.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: We know that we are of God and the whole world is seated in wickedness. And the whole world is seated in wickedness.... That is, a great part of the world. It may also signify, is under the wicked one, meaning the devil, who is elsewhere called the prince of this world, that is, of all the wicked. John 12.31.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And we know that the Son of God is come. And he hath given us understanding that we may know the true God and may be in his true Son. This is the true God and life eternal. And may be in his true Son. He is, or this is the true God, and life eternal.... Which words are a clear proof of Christ’s divinity, and as such made use of by the ancient fathers.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Little children, keep yourselves from idols. Amen. Keep yourselves from idols.... An admonition to the newly converted Christians, lest conversing with heathens and idolaters, they might fall back into the sin of idolatry, which may be the sin unto death here mentioned by St. John.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the strangers dispersed through Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia and Bithynia, elect,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: According to the foreknowledge of God the Father, unto the sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ. Grace unto you and peace be multiplied.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to his great mercy hath regenerated us unto a lively hope, by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Unto an inheritance, incorruptible, and undefiled and that cannot fade, reserved in heaven for you,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who, by the power of God, are kept by faith unto salvation, ready to be revealed in the last time.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherein you shall greatly rejoice, if now you must be for a little time made sorrowful in divers temptations:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: That the trial of your faith (much more precious than gold which is tried by the fire) may be found unto praise and glory and honour at the appearing of Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Whom having not seen, you love: in whom also now though you see him not, you believe and, believing, shall rejoice with joy unspeakable and glorified;

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Receiving the end of your faith, even the salvation of your souls.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Of which salvation the prophets have inquired and diligently searched, who prophesied of the grace to come in you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Searching what or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ in them did signify, when it foretold those sufferings that are in Christ and the glories that should follow.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: To whom it was revealed that, not to themselves but to you, they ministered those things which are now declared to you by them that have preached the gospel to you: the Holy Ghost being sent down from heaven, on whom the angels desire to look.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherefore, having the loins of your mind girt up, being sober, trust perfectly in the grace which is offered you in the revelation of Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As children of obedience, not fashioned according to the former desires of your ignorance,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But according to him that hath called you, who is holy, be you also in all manner of conversation holy:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Because it is written: You shall be holy, for I am holy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And if you invoke as Father him who, without respect of persons, judgeth according to every one’s work: converse in fear during the time of your sojourning here.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Knowing that you were not redeemed with corruptible things, as gold or silver, from your vain conversation of the tradition of your fathers:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb unspotted and undefiled.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Foreknown indeed before the foundation of the world, but manifested in the last times for you:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who through him are faithful in God who raised him up from the dead and hath given him glory, that your faith and hope might be in God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Purifying your souls in the obedience of charity, with a brotherly love, from a sincere heart love one another earnestly:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Being born again, not of corruptible seed, but incorruptible, by the word of God who liveth and remaineth for ever.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For all flesh is as grass and all the glory thereof as the flower of grass. The grass is withered and the flower thereof is fallen away.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the word of the Lord endureth for ever. And this is the word which by the gospel hath been preached unto you. 1 Peter Chapter 2 We are to lay aside all guile and go to Christ the living stone, and, as being now his people, walk worthily of him, with submission to superiors and patience under sufferings.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherefore laying away all malice and all guile and dissimulations and envies and all detractions,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As newborn babes, desire the rational milk without guile, that thereby you may grow unto salvation:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: If so be you have tasted that the Lord is sweet.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Unto whom coming, as to a living stone, rejected indeed by men but chosen and made honourable by God:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Be you also as living stones built up, a spiritual house, a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherefore it is said in the scripture: Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious. And he that shall believe in him shall not be confounded.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: To you therefore that believe, he is honour: but to them that believe not, the stone which the builders rejected, the same is made the head of the corner:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And a stone of stumbling and a rock of scandal, to them who stumble at the word, neither do believe, whereunto also they are set.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But you are a chosen generation, a kingly priesthood, a holy nation, a purchased people: that you may declare his virtues, who hath called you out of darkness into his marvelous light:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who in time past were not a people: but are now the people of God. Who had not obtained mercy: but now have obtained mercy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, I beseech you, as strangers and pilgrims, to refrain yourselves from carnal desires which war against the soul,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Having your conversation good among the Gentiles: that whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may, by the good works which they shall behold in you, glorify God in the day of visitation.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Be ye subject therefore to every human creature for God’s sake: whether it be to the king as excelling,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Or to governors as sent by him for the punishment of evildoers and for the praise of the good.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For so is the will of God, that by doing well you may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As free and not as making liberty a cloak for malice, but as the servants of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Honour all men. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Servants, be subject to your masters with all fear, not only to the good and gentle but also to the froward.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For this is thankworthy: if, for conscience towards God, a man endure sorrows, suffering wrongfully.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For what glory is it, if, committing sin and being buffeted for it, you endure? But if doing well you suffer patiently: this is thankworthy before God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For unto this are you called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving you an example that you should follow his steps.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who, when he was reviled, did not revile: when he suffered, he threatened not, but delivered himself to him that judged him unjustly.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who his own self bore our sins in his body upon the tree: that we, being dead to sins, should live to justice: by whose stripes you were healed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For you were as sheep going astray: but you are now converted to the shepherd and bishop of your souls. 1 Peter Chapter 3 How wives are to behave to their husbands. What ornaments they are to seek. Exhortations to divers Virtues.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: In like manner also, let wives be subject to their husbands: that, if any believe not the word, they may be won without the word, by the conversation of the wives,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Considering your chaste conversation with fear.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Whose adorning, let it not be the outward plaiting of the hair, or the wearing of gold, or the putting on of apparel:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the hidden man of the heart, in the incorruptibility of a quiet and a meek spirit which is rich in the sight of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For after this manner heretofore, the holy women also who trusted in God adorned themselves, being in subjection to their own husbands:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose daughters you are, doing well and not fearing any disturbance.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Ye husbands, likewise dwelling with them according to knowledge, giving honour to the female as to the weaker vessel and as to the co-heirs of the grace of life: that your prayers be not hindered.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And in fine, be ye all of one mind, having compassion one of another, being lovers of the brotherhood, merciful, modest, humble:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Not rendering evil for evil, nor railing for railing, but contrariwise, blessing: for unto this are you called, that you may inherit a blessing.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For he that will love life and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Let him decline from evil and do good: Let him seek after peace and pursue it:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Because the eyes of the Lord are upon the just, and his ears unto their prayers but the countenance of the Lord upon them that do evil things.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And who is he that can hurt you, if you be zealous of good?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But if also you suffer any thing for justice’ sake, blessed are ye. And be not afraid of their fear: and be not troubled.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But sanctify the Lord Christ in your hearts, being ready always to satisfy every one that asketh you a reason of that hope which is in you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But with modesty and fear, having a good conscience: that whereas they speak evil of you, they may be ashamed who falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For it is better doing well (if such be the will of God) to suffer than doing ill.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Because Christ also died once for our sins, the just for the unjust: that he might offer us to God, being put to death indeed in the flesh, but enlivened in the spirit,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: In which also coming he preached to those spirits that were in prison: Spirits that were in prison.... See here a proof of a third place, or middle state of souls: for these spirits in prison, to whom Christ went to preach, after his death, were not in heaven; nor yet in the hell of the damned: because heaven is no prison: and Christ did not go to preach to the damned.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Which had been some time incredulous, when they waited for the patience of God in the days of Noe, when the ark was a building: wherein a few, that is, eight souls, were saved by water.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Whereunto baptism, being of the like form, now saveth you also: not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but, the examination of a good conscience towards God by the resurrection of Jesus Christ. Whereunto baptism, etc.... Baptism is said to be of the like form with the water by which Noe was saved, because the one was a figure of the other. Not the putting away, etc.... As much as to say, that baptism has not its efficacy, in order to salvation, from its washing away any bodily filth or dirt; but from its purging the conscience from sin, when accompanied with suitable dispositions in the party, to answer the interrogations made at that time, with relation to faith, the renouncing of Satan with all his works; and the obedience to God’s commandments.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who is on the right hand of God, swallowing down death that we might be made heirs of life everlasting: being gone into heaven, the angels and powers and virtues being made subject to him. 1 Peter Chapter 4 Exhortations to cease from sin, to mutual charity, to do all for the glory of God, to be willing to suffer for Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Christ therefore having suffered in the flesh, be you also armed with the same thought: for he that hath suffered in the flesh hath ceased from sins:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: That now he may live the rest of his time in the flesh, not after the desires of men but according to the will of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For the time past is sufficient to have fulfilled the will of the Gentiles, for them who have walked in riotousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings and unlawful worshipping of idols.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherein they think it strange that you run not with them into the same confusion of riotousness: speaking evil of you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who shall render account to him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For, for this cause was the gospel preached also to the dead: That they might be judged indeed according to men, in the flesh: but may live according to God, in the Spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the end of all is at hand. Be prudent therefore and watch in prayers.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But before all things have a constant mutual charity among yourselves: for charity covereth a multitude of sins.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Using hospitality one towards another, without murmuring,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As every man hath received grace, ministering the same one to another: as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: If any man speak, let him speak, as the words of God. If any minister, let him do it, as of the power which God administereth: that in all things God may be honoured through Jesus Christ: to whom is glory and empire for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, think not strange the burning heat which is to try you: as if some new thing happened to you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But if you partake of the sufferings of Christ, rejoice that, when his glory shall be revealed, you may also be glad with exceeding joy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: If you be reproached for the name of Christ, you shall be blessed: for that which is of the honour, glory and power of God, and that which is his Spirit resteth upon you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But let none of you suffer as a murderer or a thief or a railer or a coveter of other men’s things.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But, if as a Christian, let him not be ashamed: but let him glorify God in that name.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For the time is, that judgment should begin at the house of God. And if at first at us, what shall be the end of them that believe not the gospel of God?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And if the just man shall scarcely be saved, where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear? Scarcely.... That is, not without much labour and difficulty; and because of the dangers which constantly surround, the temptations of the world, of the devil, and of our own corrupt nature.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherefore let them also that suffer according to the will of God commend their souls in good deeds to the faithful Creator. 1 Peter Chapter 5 He exhorts both priests and laity to their respective duties and recommends to all humility and watchfulness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: The ancients therefore that are among you, I beseech who am myself also an ancient and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, as also a partaker of that glory which is to be revealed in time to come:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Feed the flock of God which is among you, taking care of it, not by constraint but willingly, according to God: not for filthy lucre’s sake but voluntarily:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Neither as lording it over the clergy but being made a pattern of the flock from the heart.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And when the prince of pastors shall appear, you shall receive a never fading crown of glory.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: In like manner, ye young men, be subject to the ancients. And do you all insinuate humility one to another: for God resisteth the proud, but to the humble he giveth grace.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Be you humbled therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in the time of visitation:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Casting all your care upon him, for he hath care of you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Be sober and watch: because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, goeth about seeking whom he may devour.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Whom resist ye, strong in faith: knowing that the same affliction befalls, your brethren who are in the world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the God of all grace, who hath called us unto his eternal glory in Christ Jesus, after you have suffered a little, will himself perfect you and confirm you and establish you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: To him be glory and empire, for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: By Sylvanus, a faithful brother unto you, as I think, I have written briefly: beseeching and testifying that this is the true grace of God, wherein you stand.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: The church that is in Babylon, elected together with you, saluteth you. And so doth my son, Mark.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Salute one another with a holy kiss. Grace be to all you who are in Christ Jesus. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Paul and Sylvanus and Timothy to the church of the Thessalonians: in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Grace be to you and peace. We give thanks to God always for you all: making a remembrance of you in our prayers without ceasing,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Being mindful of the work of your faith and labour and charity: and of the enduring of the hope of our Lord Jesus Christ before God and our Father.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Knowing, brethren, beloved of God, your election:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For our gospel hath not been unto you in word only, but in power also: and in the Holy Ghost and in much fulness, as you know what manner of men we have been among you for your sakes.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And you became followers of us and of the Lord: receiving the word in much tribulation, with joy of the Holy Ghost:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: So that you were made a pattern to all that believe in Macedonia and in Achaia.
