Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For from you was spread abroad the word of the Lord not only in Macedonia and in Achaia but also in every place: your faith which is towards God, is gone forth, so that we need not to speak any thing.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For they themselves relate of us, what manner of entering in we had unto you: and how you turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And to wait for his Son from heaven (whom he raised up from the dead), Jesus, who hath delivered us from the wrath to come. 1 Thessalonians Chapter 2 The sincerity of the apostle’s preaching the gospel to them and of their receiving it.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For yourselves know, brethren, our entrance in unto you, that it was not in vain:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But having suffered many things before and been shamefully treated, (as you know) at Philippi, we had confidence in our God, to speak unto you the gospel of God in much carefulness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For our exhortation was not of error, nor of uncleanness, nor in deceit.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But as we were approved by God that the gospel should be committed to us: even so we speak, not as pleasing men but God, who proveth our hearts.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For neither have we used at any time the speech of flattery, as you know: nor taken an occasion of covetousness (God is witness):

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Nor sought we glory of men, neither of you, nor of others.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Whereas we might have been burdensome to you, as the apostles of Christ: but we became little ones in the midst of you, as if a nurse should cherish her children:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: So desirous of you, we would gladly impart unto you not only the gospel of God but also our own souls: because you were become most dear unto us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For you remember, brethren, our labour and toil: working night and day, lest we should be chargeable to any of you, we preached among you the gospel of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: You are witnesses, and God also, how holily and justly and without blame we have been to you that have believed:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: As you know in what manner, entreating and comforting you (as a father doth his children),

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: We testified to every one of you that you would walk worthy of God, who hath called you unto his kingdom and glory.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Therefore, we also give thanks to God without ceasing: because, that when you had received of us the word of the hearing of God, you received it not as the word of men, but (as it is indeed) the word of God, who worketh in you that have believed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For you, brethren, are become followers of the churches of God which are in Judea, in Christ Jesus: for you also have suffered the same things from your own countrymen, even as they have from the Jews:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Who both killed the Lord Jesus, and the prophets, and have persecuted us, and please not God, and are adversaries to all men;

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Prohibiting us to speak to the Gentiles, that they may be saved, to fill up their sins always: for the wrath of God is come upon them to the end. To fill up their sins.... That is, to fill up the measure of their sins, after which God’s justice would punish them. For the wrath of God is come upon them to the end.... That is, to continue on them to the end.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But we, brethren, being taken away from you for a short time, in sight, not in heart, have hastened the more abundantly to see your face with great desire.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For we would have come unto you, I Paul indeed, once and again: but Satan hath hindered us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For what is our hope or joy or crown of glory? Are not you, in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at his coming?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For you are our glory and joy. 1 Thessalonians Chapter 3 The apostle’s concern and love for the Thessalonians.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For which cause, forbearing no longer, we thought it good to remain at Athens alone.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And we sent Timothy, our brother and the minister of God in the gospel of Christ, to confirm you and exhort you concerning your faith:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: That no man should be moved in these tribulations: for yourselves know that we are appointed thereunto.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For even when we were with you, we foretold you that we should suffer tribulations: as also it is come to pass, and you know.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For this cause also, I, forbearing no longer, sent to know your faith: lest perhaps he that tempteth should have tempted you: and our labour should be made vain.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But now when Timothy came to us from you and related to us your faith and charity, and that you have a good remembrance of us always, desiring to see us as we also to see you:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Therefore we were comforted, brethren, in you, in all our necessity and tribulation, by your faith.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Because now we live, if you stand in the Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For what thanks can we return to God for you, in all the joy wherewith we rejoice for you before our God,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Night and day more abundantly praying that we may see your face and may accomplish those things that are wanting to your faith?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Now God himself and our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way unto you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And may the Lord multiply you and make you abound in charity towards one another and towards all men: as we do also towards you,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: To confirm your hearts without blame, in holiness, before God and our Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, with all his saints. Amen. 1 Thessalonians Chapter 4 He exhorts them to purity and mutual charity. He treats of the resurrection of the dead.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For the rest therefore, brethren, we pray and beseech you in the Lord Jesus that, as you have received from us, how you ought to walk and to please God, so also you would walk, that you may abound the more.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For you know what precepts I have given to you by the Lord Jesus.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For this is the will of God, your sanctification: That you should abstain from fornication:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: That every one of you should know how to possess his vessel in sanctification and honour,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Not in the passion of lust, like the Gentiles that know not God:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And that no man overreach nor circumvent his brother in business: because the Lord is the avenger of all these things, as we have told you before and have testified.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For God hath not called us unto uncleanness, but unto sanctification.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Therefore, he that despiseth these things, despiseth not man, but God, who also hath given his holy Spirit in us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But as touching the charity of brotherhood, we have no need to write to you: for yourselves have learned of God to love one another.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For indeed you do it towards all the brethren in all Macedonia. But we entreat you, brethren, that you abound more:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And that you use your endeavour to be quiet: and that you do your own business and work with your own hands, as we commanded you: and that you walk honestly towards them that are without: and that you want nothing of any man’s.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And we will not have you ignorant brethren, concerning them that are asleep, that you be not sorrowful, even as others who have no hope.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again: even so them who have slept through Jesus, will God bring with him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For this we say unto you in the word of the Lord, that we who are alive, who remain unto the coming of the Lord, shall not prevent them who have slept.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For the Lord himself shall come down from heaven with commandment and with the voice of an archangel and with the trumpet of God: and the dead who are in Christ shall rise first.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Then we who are alive, who are left, shall be taken up together with them in the clouds to meet Christ, into the air: and so shall we be always with the Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore, comfort ye one another with these words. 1 Thessalonians Chapter 5 The day of the Lord shall come when least expected. Exhortations to several duties.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But of the times and moments, brethren, you need not, that we should write to you:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord shall so come as a thief in the night.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For when they shall say: Peace and security; then shall sudden destruction come upon them, as the pains upon her that is with child, and they shall not escape.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But you, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For all you are the children of light and children of the day: we are not of the night nor of darkness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Therefore, let us not sleep, as others do: but let us watch, and be sober.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For they that sleep, sleep in the night; and they that are drunk, are drunk in the night.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But let us, who are of the day, be sober, having on the breast plate of faith and charity and, for a helmet, the hope of salvation.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For God hath not appointed us unto wrath: but unto the purchasing of salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Who died for us: that, whether we watch or sleep, we may live together with him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For which cause comfort one another and edify one another, as you also do.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And we beseech you, brethren, to know them who labour among you and are over you in the Lord and admonish you;

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: That you esteem them more abundantly in charity, for their work’s sake. Have peace with them.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And we beseech you, brethren, rebuke the unquiet: comfort the feeble minded: support the weak: be patient towards all men. The unquiet.... That is, such as are irregular and disorderly.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: See that none render evil for evil to any man: but ever follow that which is good towards each other and towards all men.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Always rejoice.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Pray without ceasing.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: In all things give thanks for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you all.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Extinguish not the spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Despise not prophecies.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But prove all things: hold fast that which is good.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: From all appearance of evil refrain yourselves.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And may the God of peace himself sanctify you in all things: that your whole spirit and soul and body may be preserved blameless in the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: He is faithful who hath called you, who also will do it.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Brethren, pray for us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Salute all the brethren with a holy kiss.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: I charge you by the Lord that this epistle be read to all the holy brethren.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the commandment of God our Saviour and Christ Jesus our hope:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: To Timothy, his beloved son in faith. Grace, mercy and peace, from God the Father and from Christ Jesus our Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: As I desired thee to remain at Ephesus when I went into Macedonia, that thou mightest charge some not to teach otherwise:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Not to give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which furnish questions rather than the edification of God which is in faith.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Now the end of the commandment is charity from a pure heart, and a good conscience, and an unfeigned faith.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: From which things some, going astray, are turned aside unto vain babbling:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Desiring to be teachers of the law: understanding neither the things they say, nor whereof they affirm.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But we know that the law is good, if a man use it lawfully.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Knowing this: That the law is not made for the just man but for the unjust and disobedient, for the ungodly and for sinners, for the wicked and defiled, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers, The law is not.... He means, that the just man doth good, and avoideth evil, not as compelled by the law, and merely for fear of the punishment appointed for transgressors; but voluntarily, and out of the love of God and virtue; and would do so, though there were no law.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For fornicators, for them who defile themselves with mankind, for menstealers, for liars, for perjured persons, and whatever other thing is contrary to sound doctrine:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Which is according to the gospel of the glory of the blessed God which hath been committed to my trust.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I give him thanks who hath strengthened me, even to Christ Jesus our Lord, for that he hath counted me faithful, putting me in the ministry:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Who before was a blasphemer and a persecutor and contumelious. But I obtained the mercy of God, because I did it ignorantly in unbelief.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Now the grace of our Lord hath abounded exceedingly with faith and love, which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: A faithful saying, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am the chief.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But for this cause have I obtained mercy: that in me first Christ Jesus might shew forth all patience, for the information of them that shall believe in him unto life everlasting.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Now to the king of ages, immortal, invisible, the only God, be honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: This precept, I commend to thee, O son Timothy: according to the prophecies going before on thee, that thou war in them a good warfare,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Having faith and a good conscience, which some rejecting have made shipwreck concerning the faith.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Of whom is Hymeneus and Alexander, whom I have delivered up to Satan, that they may learn not to blaspheme. 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Prayers are to be said for all men, because God wills the salvation of all. Women are not to teach.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I desire therefore, first of all, that supplications, prayers, intercessions and thanksgivings be made for all men:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For kings and for all that are in high station: that we may lead a quiet and a peaceable life in all piety and chastity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Saviour,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Who will have all men to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For there is one God: and one mediator of God and men, the man Christ Jesus: One mediator.... Christ is the one and only mediator of redemption, who gave himself, as the apostle writes in the following verse.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Who gave himself a redemption for all, a testimony in due times. A redemption for all.... He is also the only mediator, who stands in need of no other to recommend his petitions to the Father. But this is not against our seeking the prayers and intercession, as well of the faithful upon earth, as of the saints and angels in heaven, for obtaining mercy, grace, and salvation, through Jesus Christ. As St. Paul himself often desired the help of the prayers of the faithful, without any injury to the mediatorship of Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Whereunto I am appointed a preacher and an apostle (I say the truth, I lie not), a doctor of the Gentiles in faith and truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I will therefore that men pray in every place, lifting up pure hands, without anger and contention.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: In like manner, women also in decent apparel: adorning themselves with modesty and sobriety, not with plaited hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly attire:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But, as it becometh women professing godliness, with good works.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to use authority over the man: but to be in silence. 2:13.For Adam was first formed; then Eve.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And Adam was not seduced; but the woman, being seduced, was in the transgression.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Yet she shall be saved through child bearing; if she continue in faith and love and sanctification with sobriety. 1 Timothy Chapter 3 What sort of men are to be admitted into the clergy. The church is the pillar of truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: A faithful saying: If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: It behoveth therefore a bishop to be blameless, the husband of one wife, sober, prudent, of good behaviour, chaste, given to hospitality, a teacher, Of one wife.... The meaning is not that every bishop should have a wife (for St. Paul himself had none), but that no one should be admitted to the holy orders of bishop, priest, or deacon, who had been married more than once.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Not given to wine, no striker, but modest, not quarrelsome, not covetous, but

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: One that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all chastity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Not a neophyte: lest, being puffed up with pride, he fall into the judgment of the devil. A neophyte.... That is, one lately baptized, a young convert.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Moreover, he must have a good testimony of them who are without: lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Deacons in like manner: chaste, not double tongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of filthy lucre:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Holding the mystery of faith in a pure conscience.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And let these also first be proved: and so let them minister, having no crime.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: The women in like manner: chaste, not slanderers, but sober, faithful in all things.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Let deacons be the husbands of one wife: who rule well their children and their own houses.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For they that have ministered well shall purchase to themselves a good degree and much confidence in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: These things I write to thee, hoping that I shall come to thee shortly.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth. The pillar and ground of the truth.... Therefore the church of the living God can never uphold error, nor bring in corruptions, superstition, or idolatry.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And evidently great is the mystery of godliness, which was manifested in the flesh, was justified in the spirit, appeared unto angels, hath been preached unto the Gentiles, is believed in the world, is taken up in glory. 1 Timothy Chapter 4 He warns him against heretics, and exhorts him to the exercise of piety.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Now the Spirit manifestly saith that in the last times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to spirits of error and doctrines of devils,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Speaking lies in hypocrisy and having their conscience seared,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Forbidding to marry, to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving by the faithful and by them that have known the truth. Forbidding to marry, to abstain from meats.... He speaks of the Gnostics, the Marcionites, the Eneratites, the Manicheans, and other ancient heretics, who absolutely condemned marriage, and the use of all kind of meat; because they pretended that all flesh was from an evil principle. Whereas the church of God, so far from condemning marriage, holds it a holy sacrament; and forbids it to none but such as by vow have chosen the better part: and prohibits not the use of any meats whatsoever in proper times and seasons; though she does not judge all kind of diet proper for days of fasting and penance.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For every creature of God is good, and nothing to be rejected that is received with thanksgiving:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: These things proposing to the brethren, thou shalt be a good minister of Christ Jesus, nourished up in the words of faith and of the good doctrine which thou hast attained unto.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But avoid foolish and old wives fables: and exercise thyself unto godliness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For bodily exercise is profitable to little: but godliness is profitable to all things, having promise of the life that now is and of that which is to come.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: A faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For therefore we labour and are reviled, because we hope in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, especially of the faithful.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: These things command and teach:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Let no man despise thy youth: but be thou an example of the faithful, in word, in conversation, in charity, in faith, in chastity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Till I come, attend unto reading, to exhortation and to doctrine.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Neglect not the grace that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with imposition of the hands of the priesthood.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Meditate upon these things, be wholly in these things: that thy profiting may be manifest to all.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Take heed to thyself and to doctrine: be earnest in them. For in doing this thou shalt both save thyself and them that hear thee. 1 Timothy Chapter 5 He gives him lessons concerning widows, and how he is to behave to his clergy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: An ancient man rebuke not, but entreat him as a father: young men, as brethren:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Old women, as mothers: young women, as sisters, in all chastity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Honour widows that are widows indeed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But if any widow have children or grandchildren, let her learn first to govern her own house and to make a return of duty to her parents; for this is acceptable before God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But she that is a widow indeed, and desolate, let her trust in God and continue in supplications and prayers night and day.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For she that liveth in pleasures is dead while she is living.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And this give in charge, that they may be blameless.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But if any man have not care of his own and especially of those of his house, he hath denied the faith and is worse than an infidel.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Let a widow be chosen of no less than threescore years of age, who hath been the wife of one husband.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Having testimony for her good works, if she have brought up children, if she have received to harbour, if she have washed the saints’ feet, if she have ministered to them that suffer tribulation, if she have diligently followed every good work.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But the younger widows avoid. For when they have grown wanton in Christ, they will marry:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Having damnation, because they have made void their first faith. Their first faith.... Their vow, by which they had engaged themselves to Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And withal being idle they learn to go about from house to house: and are not only idle, but tattlers also and busy bodies, speaking things which they ought not.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I will, therefore, that the younger should marry, bear children, be mistresses of families, give no occasion to the adversary to speak evil.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For some are already turned aside after Satan.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: If any of the faithful have widows, let him minister to them, and let not the church be charged: that there may be sufficient for them that are widows indeed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Let the priests that rule well be esteemed worthy of double honour: especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For the scripture saith: Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn: and, The labourer is worthy of his reward.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Against a priest receive not an accusation, but under two or three witnesses.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Them that sin reprove before all that the rest also may have fear.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I charge thee, before God and Christ Jesus and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without prejudice, doing nothing by declining to either side.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Impose not hands lightly upon any man, neither be partaker of other men’s sins. Keep thyself chaste.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Do not still drink water, but use a little wine for thy stomach’s sake and thy frequent infirmities.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Some men’s sins are manifest, going before to judgment: and some men they follow after.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: In like manner also good deeds are manifest: and they that are otherwise cannot be hid. 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Duties of servants. The danger of covetousness. Lessons for the rich.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Whosoever are servants under the yoke, let them count their masters worthy of all honour; lest the name of the Lord and his doctrine be blasphemed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But they that have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren; but serve them the rather, because they are faithful and beloved, who are partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: If any man teach otherwise and consent not to the sound words of our Lord Jesus Christ and to that doctrine which is according to godliness,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: He is proud, knowing nothing, but sick about questions and strifes of words; from which arise envies, contentions, blasphemies, evil suspicions,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Conflicts of men corrupted in mind and who are destitute of the truth, supposing gain to be godliness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For we brought nothing into this world: and certainly we can carry nothing out.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But having food and wherewith to be covered, with these we are content.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For they that will become rich fall into temptation and into the snare of the devil and into many unprofitable and hurtful desires, which drown men into destruction and perdition.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For the desire of money is the root of all evils; which some coveting have erred from the faith and have entangled themselves in many sorrows.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But thou, O man of God, fly these things: and pursue justice, godliness, faith, charity, patience, mildness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Fight the good fight of faith. Lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art called and hast confessed a good confession before many witnesses.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I charge thee before God who quickeneth all things, and before Christ Jesus who gave testimony under Pontius Pilate, a good confession:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: That thou keep the commandment without spot, blameless, unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Which in his times he shall shew, who is the Blessed and only Mighty, the King of kings and Lord of lords:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Who only hath immortality and inhabiteth light inaccessible: whom no man hath seen, nor can see: to whom be honour and empire everlasting. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Charge the rich of this world not to be highminded nor to trust in the uncertainty of riches, but in the living God (who giveth us abundantly all things to enjoy)

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: To do good, to be rich in good works, to give easily, to communicate to others,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: To lay up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold on the true life.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, avoiding the profane novelties of words and oppositions of knowledge falsely so called.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Which some promising, have erred concerning the faith. Grace be with thee. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Paul, an apostle, not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised him from the dead:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And all the brethren who are with me: to the churches of Galatia.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Grace be to you, and peace from God the Father and from our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present wicked world, according to the will of God and our Father:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: To whom is glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: I wonder that you are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ, unto another gospel.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Which is not another: only there are some that trouble you and would pervert the gospel of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach a gospel to you besides that which we have preached to you, let him be anathema.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: As we said before, so now I say again: If any one preach to you a gospel, besides that which you have received, let him be anathema.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For do I now persuade men, or God? Or do I seek to please men? If I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For I give you to understand, brethren, that the gospel which was preached by me is not according to man.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For neither did I receive it of man: nor did I learn it but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For you have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews’ religion: how that, beyond measure, I persecuted the church of God and wasted it.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And I made progress in the Jews’ religion above many of my equals in my own nation, being more abundantly zealous for the traditions of my fathers.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But when it pleased him who separated me from my mother’s womb and called me by his grace,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: To reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the Gentiles: immediately I condescended not to flesh and blood.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Neither went I to Jerusalem, to the apostles who were before me: but I went into Arabia, and again I returned to Damascus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Then, after three years, I went to Jerusalem to see Peter: and I tarried with him fifteen days.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But other of the apostles I saw none, saving James the brother of the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Now the things which I write to you, behold, before God, I lie not.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Afterwards, I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And I was unknown by face to the churches of Judea, which were in Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But they had heard only: He, who persecuted us in times past doth now preach the faith which once he impugned.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And they glorified God in me. Galatians Chapter 2 The apostle’s preaching was approved of by the other apostles. The Gentiles were not to be constrained to the observance of the law.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Then, after fourteen years, I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus also with me.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And I went up according to revelation and communicated to them the gospel which I preach among the Gentiles: but apart to them who seemed to be some thing: lest perhaps I should run or had run in vain.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But neither Titus, who was with me, being a Gentile, was compelled to be circumcised.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But because of false brethren unawares brought in, who came in privately to spy our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into servitude.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: To whom we yielded not by subjection: no, not for an hour: that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But of them who seemed to be some thing, (what they were some time it is nothing to me, God accepteth not the person of man): for to me they that seemed to be some thing added nothing.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But contrariwise, when they had seen that to me was committed the gospel of the uncircumcision, as to Peter was that of the circumcision. The gospel of the uncircumcision.... The preaching of the gospel to the uncircumcised, that is, to the Gentiles. St. Paul was called in an extraordinary manner to be the apostle of the Gentiles; St. Peter, besides his general commission over the whole flock, (John 21. 15, etc.,) had a peculiar charge of the people of the circumcision, that is, of the Jews.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: (For he who wrought in Peter to the apostleship of the circumcision wrought in me also among the Gentiles.)

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And when they had known the grace that was given to me, James and Cephas and John, who seemed to be pillars, gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship: that we should go unto the Gentiles, and they unto the circumcision:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Only that we should be mindful of the poor: which same thing also I was careful to do.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But when Cephas was come to Antioch, I withstood him to the face, because he was to be blamed. I withstood, etc.... The fault that is here noted in the conduct of St. Peter, was only a certain imprudence, in withdrawing himself from the table of the Gentiles, for fear of giving offence to the Jewish converts; but this, in such circumstances, when his so doing might be of ill consequence to the Gentiles, who might be induced thereby to think themselves obliged to conform to the Jewish way of living, to the prejudice of their Christian liberty. Neither was St. Paul’s reprehending him any argument against his supremacy; for in such cases an inferior may, and sometimes ought, with respect, to admonish his superior.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For before that some came from James, he did eat with the Gentiles: but when they were come, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing them who were of the circumcision.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And to his dissimulation the rest of the Jews consented: so that Barnabas also was led by them into that dissimulation.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But when I saw that they walked not uprightly unto the truth of the gospel, I said to Cephas before them all: If thou, being a Jew, livest after the manner of the Gentiles and not as the Jews do, how dost thou compel the Gentiles to live as do the Jews?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: We by nature are Jews: and not of the Gentiles, sinners.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But knowing that man is not justified by the works of the law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ, we also believe in Christ Jesus, that we may be justified by the faith of Christ and not by the works of the law: because by the works of the law no flesh shall be justified.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But if, while we seek to be justified in Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, is Christ then the minister of sin? God forbid!

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For if I build up again the things which I have destroyed, I make myself a prevaricator.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For I, through the law, am dead to the law, that I may live to God; with Christ I am nailed to the cross.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And I live, now not I: but Christ liveth in me. And that I live now in the flesh: I live in the faith of the Son of God, who loved me and delivered himself for me.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: I cast not away the grace of God. For if justice be by the law, then Christ died in vain. Galatians Chapter 3 The Spirit, and the blessing promised to Abraham cometh not by the law, but by faith.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: O senseless Galatians, who hath bewitched you that you should not obey the truth: before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been set forth, crucified among you?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: This only would I learn of you: Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the law or by the hearing of faith?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Are you so foolish that, whereas you began in the Spirit, you would now be made perfect by the flesh?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Have you suffered so great things in vain? If it be yet in vain.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: He therefore who giveth to you the Spirit and worketh miracles among you: doth he do it by the works of the law or by the hearing of the faith?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: As it is written: Abraham believed God: and it was reputed to him unto justice.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Know ye, therefore, that they who are of faith, the same are the children of Abraham.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And the scripture, foreseeing that God justifieth the Gentiles by faith, told unto Abraham before: In thee shall all nations be blessed.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Therefore, they that are of faith shall be blessed with faithful Abraham.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For as many as are of the works of the law are under a curse. For it is written: Cursed is every one that abideth, not in all things which are written in the book of the law to do them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But that in the law no man is justified with God, it is manifest: because the just man liveth by faith.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But the law is not of faith: but he that doth those things shall live in them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law, being made a curse for us (for it is written: Cursed is every one that hangeth on a tree).

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: That the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Christ Jesus: that we may receive the promise of the Spirit by faith.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Brethren (I speak after the manner of man), yet a man’s testament, if it be confirmed, no man despiseth nor addeth to it.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: To Abraham were the promises made and to his seed. He saith not: And to his seeds as of many. But as of one: And to thy seed, which is Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Now this I say: that the testament which was confirmed by God, the law which was made after four hundred and thirty years doth not disannul, to make the promise of no effect.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For if the inheritance be of the law, it is no more of promise. But God gave it to Abraham by promise.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Why then was the law? It was set because of transgressions, until the seed should come to whom he made the promise, being ordained by angels in the hand of a mediator. Because of transgressions.... To restrain them from sin, by fear and threats. Ordained by angels.... The law was delivered by angels, speaking in the name and person of God to Moses, who was the mediator, on this occasion, between God and the people.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Now a mediator is not of one: but God is one.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Was the law then against the promises of God: God forbid! For if there had been a law given which could give life, verily justice should have been by the law.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But the scripture hath concluded all under sin, that the promise, by the faith of Jesus Christ, might be given to them that believe. Hath concluded all under sin.... that is, hath declared all to be under sin, from which they could not be delivered but by faith in Jesus Christ, the promised seed.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But before the faith came, we were kept under the law shut up, unto that faith which was to be revealed.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Wherefore the law was our pedagogue in Christ: that we might be justified by faith. Pedagogue.... That is, schoolmaster, conductor, or instructor.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But after the faith is come, we are no longer under a pedagogue.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For you are all the children of God, by faith in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For as many of you as have been baptized in Christ have put on Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: There is neither Jew nor Greek: there is neither bond nor free: there is neither male nor female. For you are all one in Christ Jesus. Neither Jew, etc.... That is, no distinction of Jew, etc.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And if you be Christ’s, then are you the seed of Abraham, heirs according to the promise. Galatians Chapter 4 Christ has freed us from the servitude of the law. We are the freeborn sons of Abraham.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Now I say, as long as the heir is a child, he differeth nothing from a servant, though he be lord of all,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But is under tutors and governors until the time appointed by the father.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: So we also, when we were children, were serving under the elements of the world. Under the elements, etc.... That is, under the first rudiments of religion, in which the carnal Jews were trained up; or under those corporeal creatures, used in their manifold rites, sacrifices, and sacraments.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But when the fulness of the time was come, God sent his Son, made of a woman, made under the law:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: That he might redeem them who were under the law: that we might receive the adoption of sons.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And because you are sons, God hath sent the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, crying: Abba, Father.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Therefore, now he is not a servant, but a son. And if a son, an heir also through God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But then indeed, not knowing God, you served them who, by nature, are not gods.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But now, after that you have known God, or rather are known by God: how turn you again to the weak and needy elements which you desire to serve again?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: You observe days and months and times, and years. You observe days, etc.... He speaks not of the observation of the Lord’s day, or other Christian festivals; but either of the superstitious observation of days lucky and unlucky; or else of the Jewish festivals, to the observance of which, certain Jewish teachers sought to induce the Galatians.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: I am afraid of you, lest perhaps I have laboured in vain among you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Be ye as I, because I also am as you brethren, I beseech you. You have not injured me at all.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And you know how, through infirmity of the flesh, I preached the gospel to you heretofore: and your temptation in my flesh.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: You despised not, nor rejected: but received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Where is then your blessedness? For I bear you witness that, if it could be done, you would have plucked out your own eyes and would have given them to me.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Am I then become your enemy, because I tell you the truth?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: They are zealous in your regard not well: but they would exclude you, that you might be zealous for them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But be zealous for that which is good in a good thing always: and not only when I am present with you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: My little children, of whom I am in labour again, until Christ be formed in you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And I would willingly be present with you now and change my voice: because I am ashamed for you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Tell me, you that desire to be under the law, have you not read the law?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For it is written that Abraham had two sons: the one by a bondwoman and the other by a free woman.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But he who was of the bondwoman was born according to the flesh: but he of the free woman was by promise.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Which things are said by an allegory. For these are the two testaments. The one from Mount Sina, engendering unto bondage, which is Agar.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For Sina is a mountain in Arabia, which hath affinity to that Jerusalem which now is: and is in bondage with her children.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But that Jerusalem which is above is free: which is our mother.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For it is written: Rejoice, thou barren, that bearest not: break forth and cry thou that travailest not: for many are the children of the desolate, more than of her that hath a husband.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are the children of promise.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But as then he that was born according to the flesh persecuted him that was after the spirit: so also it is now.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But what saith the scripture? Cast out the bondwoman and her son: for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the free woman.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: So then, brethren, we are not the children of the bondwoman but of the free: by the freedom wherewith Christ has made us free. Galatians Chapter 5 He exhorts them to stand to their Christian liberty. Of the fruits of the flesh and of the spirit.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Stand fast and be not held again under the yoke of bondage.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Behold, I Paul tell you, that if you be circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And I testify again to every man circumcising himself that he is a debtor to do the whole law.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: You are made void of Christ, you who are justified in the law: you are fallen from grace.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For we in spirit, by faith, wait for the hope of justice.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth any thing nor uncircumcision: but faith that worketh by Charity.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: You did run well. What hath hindered you, that you should not obey the truth?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: This persuasion is not from him that calleth you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: A little leaven corrupteth the whole lump.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: I have confidence in you in the Lord that you will not be of another mind: but he that troubleth you shall bear the judgment, whosoever he be.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And I, brethren, if I yet preach circumcision, why do I yet suffer persecution? Then is the scandal of the cross made void.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: I would they were even cut off, who trouble you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For you, brethren, have been called unto liberty. Only make not liberty an occasion to the flesh: but by charity of the spirit serve one another.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For all the law is fulfilled in one word: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But if you bite and devour one another: take heed you be not consumed one of another.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: I say then: Walk in the spirit: and you shall not fulfill the lusts of the flesh.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For the flesh lusteth against the spirit: and the spirit against the flesh: For these are contrary one to another: so that you do not the things that you would.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But if you are led by the spirit, you are not under the law.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Now the works of the flesh are manifest: which are fornication, uncleanness, immodesty, luxury,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Idolatry, witchcrafts, enmities, contentions, emulations, wraths, quarrels, dissensions, sects,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Envies, murders, drunkenness, revellings, and such like. Of the which I foretell you, as I have foretold to you, that they who do such things shall not obtain the kingdom of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But the fruit of the Spirit is, charity, joy, peace, patience, benignity, goodness, longanimity,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Mildness, faith, modesty, continency, chastity. Against such there is no law.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And they that are Christ’s have crucified their flesh, with the vices and concupiscences.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Let us not be made desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another. Galatians Chapter 6 He exhorts to charity, humility and all virtue. He glories in nothing but in the cross of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Brethren, and if a man be overtaken in any fault, you, who are spiritual, instruct such a one in the spirit of meekness, considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Bear ye one another’s burdens: and so you shall fulfil the law of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For if any man think himself to be some thing, whereas he is nothing, he deceiveth himself.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But let every one prove his own work: and so he shall have glory in himself only and not in another.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For every one shall bear his own burden.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And let him that is instructed in the word communicate to him that instructeth him, in all good things.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Be not deceived: God is not mocked.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For what things a man shall sow, those also shall he reap. For he that soweth in his flesh of the flesh also shall reap corruption. But he that soweth in the spirit of the spirit shall reap life everlasting.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And in doing good, let us not fail. For in due time we shall reap, not failing.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: Therefore, whilst we have time, let us work good to all men, but especially to those who are of the household of the faith.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: See what a letter I have written to you with my own hand.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For as many as desire to please in the flesh, they constrain you to be circumcised, only that they may not suffer the persecution of the cross of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For neither they themselves who are circumcised keep the law: but they will have you to be circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: But God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ: by whom the world is crucified to me, and I to the world.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth any thing, nor uncircumcision: but a new creature.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: And whosoever shall follow this rule, peace on them and mercy: and upon the Israel of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: From henceforth let no man be troublesome to me: for I bear the marks of the Lord Jesus in my body.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Galatians
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brethren. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: God, who, at sundry times and in divers manners, spoke in times past to the fathers by the prophets, last of all,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: In these days, hath spoken to us by his Son, whom he hath appointed heir of all things, by whom also he made the world.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Who being the brightness of his glory and the figure of his substance and upholding all things by the word of his power, making purgation of sins, sitteth on the right hand of the majesty on high: The figure ... that is, the express image, and most perfect resemblance. Making purgation.... That is, having purged away our sins by his passion.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Being made so much better than the angels as he hath inherited a more excellent name than they.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For to which of the angels hath he said at any time: Thou art my Son, to-day have I begotten thee? And again: I will be to him a Father, and he shall be to me a Son?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And again, when he bringeth in the first begotten into the world, he saith: And let all the angels of God adore him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And to the angels indeed he saith: He that maketh his angels spirits and his ministers a flame of fire.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: But to the Son: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: a sceptre of justice is the sceptre of thy kingdom.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Thou hast loved justice and hated iniquity: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And: Thou in the beginning, O Lord, didst found the earth: and the works of thy hands are the heavens.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: They shall perish: but thou shalt continue: and they shall all grow old as a garment.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed. But thou art the selfsame: and thy years shall not fail.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: But to which of the angels said he at any time: Sit on my right hand, until I make thy enemies thy footstool?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Are they not all ministering spirits, sent to minister for them who shall receive the inheritance of salvation? Hebrews Chapter 2 The transgression of the precepts of the Son of God is far more condemnable than of those of the Old Testament given by angels.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Therefore ought we more diligently to observe the things which we have heard lest perhaps we should let them slip.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For if the word spoken by angels became steadfast and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompense of reward:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: How shall we escape if we neglect so great salvation? Which, having begun to be declared by the Lord, was confirmed unto us by them that heard him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: God also bearing them witness by signs and wonders and divers miracles and distributions of the Holy Ghost, according to his own will.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For God hath not subjected unto angels the world to come, whereof we speak.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: But one in a certain place hath testified, saying: What is man, that thou art mindful of him? Or the son of man, that thou visitest him?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Thou hast made him a little lower than the angels: thou hast crowned him with glory and honour and hast set him over the works of thy hands.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Thou hast subjected all things under his feet. For in that he hath subjected all things to him he left nothing not subject to him. But now we see not as yet all things subject to him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels, for the suffering of death, crowned with glory and honour: that, through the grace of God he might taste death for all.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For it became him for whom are all things and by whom are all things, who had brought many children into glory, to perfect the author of their salvation, by his passion. Perfect by his passion.... By suffering, Christ was to enter into his glory, Luke 24.26, which the apostle here calls being made perfect.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctified are all of one. For which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren, saying:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: I will declare thy name to my brethren: in the midst of the church will I praise thee.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And again: I will put my trust in him. And again: Behold I and my children, whom God hath given me.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Therefore because the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself in like manner hath been partaker of the same: that, through death, he might destroy him who had the empire of death, that is to say, the devil:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And might deliver them, who through the fear of death were all their lifetime subject to servitude.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For nowhere doth he take hold of the angels: but of the seed of Abraham he taketh hold. No where doth he, etc.... That is, he never took upon him the nature of angels, but that of the seed of Abraham.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore, it behoved him in all things to be made like unto his brethren, that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest before God, that he might be a propitiation for the sins of the people.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For in that wherein he himself hath suffered and been tempted he is able to succour them also that are tempted. Hebrews Chapter 3 Christ is more excellent than Moses. Wherefore we must adhere to him by faith and obedience.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly vocation consider the apostle and high priest of our confession, Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Who is faithful to him that made him, as was also Moses in all his house.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For this man was counted worthy of greater glory than Moses, by so much as he that hath built the house hath greater honour than the house.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For every house is built by some man: but he that created all things is God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And Moses indeed was faithful in all his house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were to be said:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: But Christ, as the Son in his own house: which house are we, if we hold fast the confidence and glory of hope unto the end.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore, as the Holy Ghost saith: To-day if you shall hear his voice,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the desert,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Where your fathers tempted me, proved and saw my works,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Forty years: for which cause I was offended with this generation, and I said: They always err in heart. And they have not known my ways.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: As I have sworn in my wrath: If they shall enter into my rest.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Take heed, brethren, lest perhaps there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, to depart from the living God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: But exhort one another every day, whilst it is called to day, that none of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For we are made partakers of Christ: yet so, if we hold the beginning of his substance firm unto the end.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: While it is said: To day, if you shall hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in that provocation.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For some who heard did provoke: but not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And with whom was he offended forty years? Was it not with them that sinned, whose carcasses were overthrown in the desert?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And to whom did he swear, that they should not enter into his rest: but to them that were incredulous?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And we see that they could not enter in, because of unbelief. Hebrews Chapter 4 The Christian’s rest. We are to enter into it through Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Let us fear therefore lest, the promise being left of entering into his rest, any of you should be thought to be wanting.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For unto us also it hath been declared in like manner as unto them. But the word of hearing did not profit them, not being mixed with faith of those things they heard.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For we, who have believed, shall enter into rest; as he said: As I have sworn in my wrath: If they shall enter into my rest; and this indeed when the works from the foundation of the world were finished.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For in a certain place he spoke of the seventh day thus: And God rested the seventh day from all his works.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And in this place again: If they shall enter into my rest.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Seeing then it remaineth that some are to enter into it, and they to whom it was first preached did not enter because of unbelief:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Again he limiteth a certain day, saying in David; To day, after so long a time as it is above said: To day if you shall hear his voice, harden not your hearts.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For if Jesus had given them rest he would never have afterwards spoken of another day. Jesus.... Josue, who in Greek is called Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: There remaineth therefore a day of rest for the people of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For he that is entered into his rest, the same also hath rested from his works, as God did from his.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Let us hasten therefore to enter into that rest: lest any man fall into the same example of unbelief.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For the word of God is living and effectual and more piercing than any two edged sword; and reaching unto the division of the soul and the spirit, of the joints also and the marrow: and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Neither is there any creature invisible in his sight: but all things are naked and open to his eyes, to whom our speech is.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Having therefore a great high priest that hath passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God: let us hold fast our confession.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For we have not a high priest who cannot have compassion on our infirmities: but one tempted in all things like as we are, without sin.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Let us go therefore with confidence to the throne of grace: that we may obtain mercy and find grace in seasonable aid. Hebrews Chapter 5 The office of a high priest. Christ is our high priest.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For every high priest taken from among men is ordained for men in the things that appertain to God, that he may offer up gifts and sacrifices for sins:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Who can have compassion on them that are ignorant and that err: because he himself also is compassed with infirmity.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And therefore he ought, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Neither doth any man take the honour to himself, but he that is called by God, as Aaron was.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: So Christ also did not glorify himself, that he might be made a high priest: but he that said unto him: Thou art my Son: this day have I begotten thee.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: As he saith also in another place: Thou art a priest for ever, according to the order of Melchisedech.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Who in the days of his flesh, with a strong cry and tears, offering up prayers and supplications to him that was able to save him from death, was heard for his reverence.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And whereas indeed he was the Son of God, he learned obedience by the things which he suffered.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And being consummated, he became, to all that obey him, the cause of eternal salvation:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Called by God a high priest, according to the order of Melchisedech.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Of whom we have much to say and hard to be intelligibly uttered: because you are become weak to hear.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For whereas for the time you ought to be masters, you have need to be taught again what are the first elements of the words of God: and you are become such as have need of milk and not of strong meat.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For every one that is a partaker of milk is unskilful in the word of justice: for he is a little child.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: But strong meat is for the perfect: for them who by custom have their senses exercised to the discerning of good and evil. Hebrews Chapter 6 He warns them of the danger of falling by apostasy and exhorts them to patience and perseverance.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Wherefore, leaving the word of the beginning of Christ, let us go on to things more perfect: not laying again the foundation of penance from dead works and of faith towards God, The word of the beginning.... The first rudiments of the Christian doctrine.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Of the doctrine of baptisms and imposition of hands, and of the resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And this will we do, if God permit.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For it is impossible for those who were once illuminated, have tasted also the heavenly gift and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost, It is impossible, etc.... The meaning is, that it is impossible for such as have fallen after baptism, to be again baptized; and very hard for such as have apostatized from the faith, after having received many graces, to return again to the happy state from which they fell.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: Have moreover tasted the good word of God and the powers of the world to come,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And are fallen away: to be renewed again to penance, crucifying again to themselves the Son of God and making him a mockery.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For the earth, that drinketh in the rain which cometh often upon it and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is tilled, receiveth blessing from God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: But that which bringeth forth thorns and briers is reprobate and very near unto a curse: whose end is to be burnt.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: But, my dearly beloved, we trust better things of you, and nearer to salvation; though we speak thus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: For God is not unjust, that he should forget your work and the love which you have shewn in his name, you who have ministered and do minister to the saints.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: And we desire that every one of you shew forth the same carefulness to the accomplishing of hope unto the end:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
Text: That you become not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience shall inherit the promises.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Hebrews
