Text: And he that sat was to the sight like the jasper and the sardine stone. And there was a rainbow round about the throne, in sight like unto an emerald.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And round about the throne were four and twenty seats: and upon the seats, four and twenty ancients sitting, clothed in white garments. And on their heads were crowns of gold.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And from the throne proceeded lightnings and voices and thunders. And there were seven lamps burning before the throne, which are the seven spirits of God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And in the sight of the throne was, as it were, a sea of glass like to crystal: and in the midst of the throne, and round about the throne, were four living creatures, full of eyes before and behind.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the first living creature was like a lion: and the second living creature like a calf: and the third living creature, having the face, as it were, of a man: and the fourth living creature was like an eagle flying.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the four living creatures had each of them six wings: and round about and within they are full of eyes. And they rested not day and night, saying: Holy, Holy, Holy, Lord God Almighty, who was and who is and who is to come.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when those living creatures gave glory and honour and benediction to him that sitteth on the throne, who liveth for ever and ever:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: The four and twenty ancients fell down before him that sitteth on the throne and adored him that liveth for ever and ever and cast their crowns before the throne, saying:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Thou art worthy, O Lord our God, to receive glory and honour and power. Because thou hast created all things: and for thy will they were and have been created. Apocalypse Chapter 5 The book sealed with seven seals is opened by the Lamb, who thereupon receives adoration and praise from all.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw, in the right hand of him that sat on the throne, a book, written within and without, sealed with seven seals.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw a strong angel, proclaiming with a loud voice: Who is worthy to open the book and to loose the seals thereof?

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And no man was able, neither in heaven nor on earth nor under the earth, to open the book, nor to look on it.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I wept much, because no man was found worthy to open the book, nor to see it.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And one of the ancients said to me: Weep not: behold the lion of the tribe of Juda, the root of David, hath prevailed to open the book and to loose the seven seals thereof.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw: and behold in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures and in the midst of the ancients, a Lamb standing, as it were slain, having seven horns and seven eyes: which are the seven Spirits of God, sent forth into all the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat on the throne.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the book, the four living creatures and the four and twenty ancients fell down before the Lamb, having every one of them harps and golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints. The prayers of saints.... Here we see that the saints in heaven offer up to Christ the prayers of the faithful upon earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they sung a new canticle, saying: Thou art worthy, O Lord, to take the book and to open the seals thereof: because thou wast slain and hast redeemed us to God, in thy blood, out of every tribe and tongue and people and nation:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And hast made us to our God a kingdom and priests, and we shall reign on the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I beheld, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the living creatures and the ancients (and the number of them was thousands of thousands),

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Saying with a loud voice: The Lamb that was slain is worthy to receive power and divinity and wisdom and strength and honour and glory and benediction.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And every creature which is in heaven and on the earth and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, I heard all saying: To him that sitteth on the throne and to the Lamb, benediction and honour and glory and power, for ever and ever.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the four living creatures said: Amen. And the four and twenty ancients fell down on their faces and adored him that liveth for ever and ever. Apocalypse Chapter 6 What followed upon opening six of the seals.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw that the Lamb had opened one of the seven seals: and I heard one of the four living creatures, as it were the voice of thunder, saying: Come and see.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw: and behold a white horse, and he that sat on him had a bow, and there was a crown given him, and he went forth conquering that he might conquer. White horse.... He that sitteth on the white horse is Christ, going forth to subdue the world by his gospel. The other horses that follow represent the judgments and punishment that were to fall on the enemies of Christ and his church. The red horse signifies war; the black horse, famine; and the pale horse (which has Death for its rider), plagues or pestilence.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature saying: Come and see.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there went out another horse that was red. And to him that sat thereon, it was given that he should take peace from the earth: and that they should kill one another. And a great sword was given to him.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature saying: Come and see. And behold a black horse. And he that sat on him had a pair of scales in his hand.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard, as it were a voice in the midst of the four living creatures, saying: Two pounds of wheat for a penny, and thrice two pounds of barley for a penny: and see thou hurt not the wine and the oil.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature saying: Come and see.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And behold a pale horse: and he that sat upon him, his name was Death. And hell followed him. And power was given to him over the four parts of the earth, to kill with sword, with famine and with death and with the beasts of the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of them that were slain for the word of God and for the testimony which they held. Under the altar.... Christ, as man, is this altar, under which the souls of the martyrs live in heaven, as their bodies are here deposited under our altars.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they cried with a loud voice, saying: How long, O Lord (Holy and True), dost thou not judge and revenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth? Revenge our blood.... They ask not this out of hatred to their enemies, but out of zeal for the glory of God, and a desire that the Lord would accelerate the general judgment, and the complete beatitude of all his elect.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And white robes were given to every one of them one; And it was said to them that they should rest for a little time till their fellow servants and their brethren, who are to be slain even as they, should be filled up.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw, when he had opened the sixth seal: and behold there was a great earthquake. And the sun became black as sackcloth of hair: and the whole moon became as blood.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the stars from heaven fell upon the earth, as the fig tree casteth its green figs when it is shaken by a great wind.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the heaven departed as a book folded up. And every mountain, and the islands, were moved out of their places.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the kings of the earth and the princes and tribunes and the rich and the strong and every bondman and every freeman hid themselves in the dens and in the rocks of mountains:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they say to the mountains and the rocks: Fall upon us and hide us from the face of him that sitteth upon the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For the great day of their wrath is come. And who shall be able to stand? Apocalypse Chapter 7 The number of them that were marked with the seal of the living God and clothed in white robes.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: After these things, I saw four angels standing on the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, that they should not blow upon the earth nor upon the sea nor on any tree.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw another angel ascending from the rising of the sun, having the sign of the living God. And he cried with a loud voice to the four angels to whom it was given to hurt the earth and the sea,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Saying: Hurt not the earth nor the sea nor the trees, till we sign the servants of our God in their foreheads.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard the number of them that were signed. An hundred forty-four thousand were signed, of every tribe of the children of Israel.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Of the tribe of Juda, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Ruben, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Gad, twelve thousand signed:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Of the tribe of Aser, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Nephthali, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Manasses, twelve thousand signed:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Of the tribe of Simeon, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Levi, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Issachar, twelve thousand signed:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Of the tribe of Zabulon, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Joseph, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Benjamin, twelve thousand signed.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: After this, I saw a great multitude, which no man could number, of all nations and tribes and peoples and tongues, standing before the throne and in sight of the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palms in their hands.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they cried with a loud voice, saying: Salvation to our God, who sitteth upon the throne and to the Lamb.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And all the angels stood round about the throne and the ancients and the four living creatures. And they fell down before the throne upon their faces and adored God,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Saying: Amen. Benediction and glory and wisdom and thanksgiving, honour and power and strength, to our God, for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And one of the ancients answered and said to me: These that are clothed in white robes, who are they? And whence came they?

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I said to him: My Lord, thou knowest. And he said to me: These are they who are come out of great tribulation and have washed their robes and have made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Therefore, they are before the throne of God: and they serve him day and night in his temple. And he that sitteth on the throne shall dwell over them.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: They shall no more hunger nor thirst: neither shall the sun fall on them, nor any heat.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For the Lamb, which is in the midst of the throne, shall rule them and shall lead them to the fountains of the waters of life: and God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes. Apocalypse Chapter 8 The seventh seal is opened. The angels with the seven trumpets.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven, as it were for half an hour.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw seven angels standing in the presence of God: and there were given to them seven trumpets.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And another angel came and stood before the altar, having a golden censer: and there was given to him much incense, that he should offer of the prayers of all saints, upon the golden altar which is before the throne of God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the smoke of the incense of the prayers of the saints ascended up before God from the hand of the angel.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the angel took the censer and filled it with the fire of the altar and cast it on the earth: and there were thunders and voices and lightnings and a great earthquake.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the seven angels who had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound the trumpet.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the first angel sounded the trumpet: and there followed hail and fire, mingled with blood: and it was cast on the earth. And the third part of the earth was burnt up: and the third part of the trees was burnt up: and all green grass was burnt up.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the second angel sounded the trumpet: and, as it were, a great mountain, burning with fire, was cast into the sea. And the third part of the sea became blood.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the third part of those creatures died which had life in the sea: and the third part of the ships was destroyed.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the third angel sounded the trumpet: and a great star fell from heaven, burning as it were a torch. And it fell on the third part of the rivers and upon the fountains of waters:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the name of the star is called Wormwood. And the third part of the waters became wormwood. And many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the fourth angel sounded the trumpet: and the third part of the sun was smitten, and the third part of the moon, and the third part of the stars, so that the third part of them was darkened. And the day did not shine for a third part of it: and the night in like manner.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I beheld: and heard the voice of one eagle flying through the midst of heaven, saying with a loud voice: Woe, Woe, Woe to the inhabitants of the earth, by reason of the rest of the voices of the three angels, who are yet to sound the trumpet! Apocalypse Chapter 9 Locusts come forth from the bottomless pit. The vision of the army of horsemen.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the fifth angel sounded the trumpet: and I saw a star fall from heaven upon the earth. And there was given to him the key of the bottomless pit. A star full.... This may mean the fall and apostasy of great and learned men from the true faith. Or a whole nation falling into error and separating from the church, not having the sign of God in their foreheads. And there was given to him the key of the bottomless pit.... That is, to the angel, not to the fallen star. To this angel was given the power, which is here signified by a key, of opening hell.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he opened the bottomless pit: and the smoke of the pit arose, as the smoke of a great furnace. And the sun and the air were darkened with the smoke of the pit.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And from the smoke of the pit there came out locusts upon the earth. And power was given to them, as the scorpions of the earth have power. There came out locusts.... These may be devils in Antichrist’s time, having the appearance of locusts, but large and monstrous, as here described. Or they may be real locusts, but of an extraordinary size and monstrous shape, such as were never before seen on earth, sent to torment those who have not the sign (or seal) of God on their foreheads. Some commentators by these locusts understand heretics, and especially those heretics, that sprung from Jews, and with them denied the divinity of Jesus Christ; as Theodotus, Praxeas, Noetus, Paul of Samosata, Sabellius, Arius, etc. These were great enemies of the Christian religion; they tormented and infected the souls of men, stinging them like scorpions, with the poison of their heresies. Others have explained these locusts, and other animals, mentioned in different places throughout this sacred and mystical book, in a most absurd, fanciful, and ridiculous manner; they make Abaddon the Pope, and the locusts to be friars mendicant, etc. Here it is thought proper, not to enter into any controversy upon that subject, as the inventors of these fancies have been already answered, and fully refuted by many controvertists: besides, those who might be inposed on by such chimerical writers, are in these days much better informed.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And it was commanded them that they should not hurt the grass of the earth nor any green thing nor any tree: but only the men who have not the sign of God on their foreheads.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And it was given unto them that they should not kill them: but that they should torment them five months. And their torment was as the torment of a scorpion when he striketh a man.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And in those days, men shall seek death and shall not find it. And they shall desire to die: and death shall fly from them.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the shapes of the locusts were like unto horses prepared unto battle. And on their heads were, as it were, crowns like gold: and their faces were as the faces of men.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they had hair as the hair of women: and their teeth were as lions.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they had breastplates as breastplates of iron: and the noise of their wings was as the noise of chariots and many horses running to battle.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they had tails like to scorpions: and there were stings in their tails. And their power was to hurt men, five months. And they had over them

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: A king, the angel of the bottomless pit (whose name in Hebrew is Abaddon and in Greek Apollyon, in Latin Exterminans).

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: One woe is past: and behold there come yet two woes more hereafter.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the sixth angel sounded the trumpet: and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which is before the eyes of God,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Saying to the sixth angel who had the trumpet: Loose the four angels who are bound in the great river Euphrates.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the four angels were loosed, who were prepared for an hour, and a day, and a month, and a year: for to kill the third part of men.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the number of the army of horsemen was twenty thousand times ten thousand. And I heard the number of them.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And thus I saw the horses in the vision. And they that sat on them had breastplates of fire and of hyacinth and of brimstone. And the heads of the horses were as the heads of lions: and from their mouths proceeded fire and smoke and brimstone.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And by these three plagues was slain the third part of men, by the fire and by the smoke and by the brimstone which issued out of their mouths.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For the power of the horses is in their mouths and in their tails. For, their tails are like to serpents and have heads: and with them they hurt.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the rest of the men, who were not slain by these plagues, did not do penance from the works of their hands, that they should not adore devils and idols of gold and silver and brass and stone and wood, which neither can see nor hear nor walk:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Neither did they penance from their murders nor from their sorceries nor from their fornication nor from their thefts. Apocalypse Chapter 10 The cry of a mighty angel. He gives John a book to eat.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw another mighty angel come down from heaven, clothed with a cloud. And a rainbow was on his head: and his face was as the sun, and his feet as pillars of fire.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he had in his hand a little book, open. And he set his right foot upon the sea, and his left foot upon the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he cried with a loud voice as when a lion roareth. And when he had cried, seven thunders uttered their voices.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when the seven thunders had uttered their voices, I was about to write. And I heard a voice from heaven saying to me: Seal up the things which the seven thunders have spoken. And write them not.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the angel whom I saw standing upon the sea and upon the earth lifted up his hand to heaven.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he swore by him that liveth for ever and ever, who created heaven and the things which are therein, and the earth and the things which are in it, and the sea and the things which are therein: That time shall be no longer.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: But in the days of the voice of the seventh angel, when he shall begin to sound the trumpet, the mystery of God shall be finished, as he hath declared by his servants the prophets. Declared.... literally evangelized, to signify the good tidings, agreeable to the Gospel, of the final victory of Christ, and of that eternal life, which should be the reward of the temporal sufferings of the martyrs and faithful servants of God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard a voice from heaven, again speaking to me and saying: Go and take the book that is open, from the hand of the angel who standeth upon the sea and upon the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I went to the angel, saying unto him that he should give me the book. And he said to me: Take the book and eat it up. And it shall make thy belly bitter: but in thy mouth it shall be sweet as honey.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I took the book from the hand of the angel and ate it up: and it was in my mouth, sweet as honey. And when I had eaten it, my belly was bitter.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he said to me: Thou must prophesy again to many nations and peoples and tongues and kings. Apocalypse Chapter 11 He is ordered to measure the temple. The two witnesses.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there was given me a reed, like unto a rod. And it was said to me: Arise, and measure the temple of God and the altar and them that adore therein.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: But the court which is without the temple, cast out and measure it not: because it is given unto the Gentiles. And the holy city they shall tread under foot, two and forty months:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I will give unto my two witnesses: and they shall prophesy, a thousand two hundred sixty days, clothed in sackcloth. My two witnesses.... It is commonly understood of Henoch and Elias.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: These are the two olive trees and the two candlesticks that stand before the Lord of the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And if any man will hurt them, fire shall come out of their mouths and shall devour their enemies. And if any man will hurt them, in this manner must he be slain.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: These have power to shut heaven, that it rain not in the days of their prophecy: And they have power over waters, to turn them into blood and to strike the earth with all plagues, as often as they will.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when they shall have finished their testimony, the beast that ascendeth out of the abyss shall make war against them and shall overcome them and kill them.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And their bodies shall lie in the streets of the great city which is called spiritually, Sodom and Egypt: where their Lord also was crucified.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they of the tribes and peoples and tongues and nations shall see their bodies for three days and a half: and they shall not suffer their bodies to be laid in sepulchres.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they that dwell upon the earth shall rejoice over them and make merry: and shall send gifts one to another, because these two prophets tormented them that dwelt upon the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And after three days and a half, the spirit of life from God entered into them. And they stood upon their feet: and great fear fell upon them that saw them.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they heard a great voice from heaven, saying to them: Come up hither. And they went up to heaven in a cloud: and their enemies saw them.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And at that hour there was made a great earthquake: and the tenth part of the city fell. And there were slain in the earthquake, names of men, seven thousand: and the rest were cast into a fear and gave glory to the God of heaven.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: The second woe is past: and behold the third woe will come quickly.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the seventh angel sounded the trumpet: and there were great voices in heaven, saying: The kingdom of this world is become our Lord’s and his Christ’s, and he shall reign for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the four and twenty ancients who sit on their seats in the sight of God, fell on their faces and adored God, saying:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: We give thee thanks, O Lord God Almighty, who art and who wast and who art to come: because thou hast taken to thee thy great power, and thou hast reigned.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the nations were angry: and thy wrath is come. And the time of the dead, that they should be judged and that thou shouldest render reward to thy servants the prophets and the saints, and to them that fear thy name, little and great: and shouldest destroy them who have corrupted the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the temple of God was opened in heaven: and the ark of his testament was seen in his temple. And there were lightnings and voices and an earthquake and great hail. Apocalypse Chapter 12 The vision of the woman clothed with the sun and of the great dragon her persecutor.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And a great sign appeared in heaven: A woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars. A woman.... The church of God. It may also, by allusion, be applied to our blessed Lady. The church is clothed with the sun, that is, with Christ: she hath the moon, that is, the changeable things of the world, under her feet: and the twelve stars with which she is crowned, are the twelve apostles: she is in labour and pain, whilst she brings forth her children, and Christ in them, in the midst of afflictions and persecutions.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And being with child, she cried travailing in birth: and was in pain to be delivered.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there was seen another sign in heaven. And behold a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns and on his heads seven diadems.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And his tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven and cast them to the earth. And the dragon stood before the woman who was ready to be delivered: that, when she should be delivered, he might devour her son.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And she brought forth a man child, who was to rule all nations with an iron rod. And her son was taken up to God and to his throne.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she had a place prepared by God, that there they should feed her, a thousand two hundred sixty days.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there was a great battle in heaven: Michael and his angels fought with the dragon, and the dragon fought, and his angels.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they prevailed not: neither was their place found any more in heaven.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And that great dragon was cast out, that old serpent, who is called the devil and Satan, who seduceth the whole world. And he was cast unto the earth: and his angels were thrown down with him.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard a loud voice in heaven, saying: Now is come salvation and strength and the kingdom of our God and the power of his Christ: because the accuser of our brethren is cast forth, who accused them before our God day and night.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb and by the word of the testimony: and they loved not their lives unto death.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Therefore, rejoice, O heavens, and you that dwell therein. Woe to the earth and to the sea, because the devil is come down unto you, having great wrath, knowing that he hath but a short time.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when the dragon saw that he was cast unto the earth, he persecuted the woman who brought forth the man child.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there were given to the woman two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the desert, unto her place, where she is nourished for a time and times, and half a time, from the face of the serpent.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the serpent cast out of his mouth, after the woman, water, as it were a river: that he might cause her to be carried away by the river.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the earth helped the woman: and the earth opened her mouth and swallowed up the river which the dragon cast out of his mouth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the dragon was angry against the woman: and went to make war with the rest of her seed, who keep the commandments of God and have the testimony of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he stood upon the sand of the sea. Apocalypse Chapter 13 Of the beast with seven heads and of a second beast.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw a beast coming up out of the sea, having seven heads and ten horns: and upon his horns, ten diadems: and upon his heads, names of blasphemy. A beast.... This first beast with seven heads and ten horns, is probably the whole company of infidels, enemies and persecutors of the people of God, from the beginning to the end of the world. The seven heads are seven kings, that is, seven principal kingdoms or empires, which have exercised, or shall exercise, tyrannical power over the people of God; of these, five were then fallen, viz.: the Egyptian, Assyrian, Chaldean, Persian, and Grecian monarchies: one was present, viz., the empire of Rome: and the seventh and chiefest was to come, viz., the great Antichrist and his empire. The ten horns may be understood of ten lesser persecutors.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the beast which I saw was like to a leopard: and his feet were as the feet of a bear, and his mouth as the mouth of a lion. And the dragon gave him his own strength and great power.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw one of his heads as it were slain to death: and his death’s wound was healed. And all the earth was in admiration after the beast. One of his heads, etc.... Some understand this of the mortal wound, which the idolatry of the Roman empire (signified by the sixth head) received from Constantine; which was, as it were, healed again by Julian the Apostate.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they adored the dragon which gave power to the beast. And they adored the beast, saying: Who is like to the beast? And who shall be able to fight with him?

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there was given to him a mouth speaking great things and blasphemies: and power was given to him to do, two and forty months.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he opened his mouth unto blasphemies against God, to blaspheme his name and his tabernacle and them that dwell in heaven. His tabernacle, etc.... That is, his church and his saints.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And it was given unto him to make war with the saints and to overcome them. And power was given him over every tribe and people and tongue and nation.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And all that dwell upon the earth adored him, whose names are not written in the book of life of the Lamb which was slain from the beginning of the world. Slain from the beginning, etc.... In the foreknowledge of God; and inasmuch as all mercy and grace, from the beginning, was given in view of his death and passion.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: If any man have an ear, let him hear.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that shall lead into captivity shall go into captivity: he that shall kill by the sword must be killed by the sword. Here is the patience and the faith of the saints.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw another beast coming up out of the earth: and he had two horns, like a lamb: and he spoke as a dragon. Another beast.... This second beast with two horns, may be understood of the heathenish priests and magicians; the principal promoters both of idolatry and persecution.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he executed all the power of the former beast in his sight. And he caused the earth and them that dwell therein to adore the first beast, whose wound to death was healed.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he did great signs, so that he made also fire to come down from heaven unto the earth, in the sight of men.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he seduced them that dwell on the earth, for the signs which were given him to do in the sight of the beast: saying to them that dwell on the earth that they should make the image of the beast which had the wound by the sword and lived.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And it was given him to give life to the image of the beast: and that the image of the beast should speak: and should cause that whosoever will not adore the image of the beast should be slain.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he shall make all, both little and great, rich and poor, freemen and bondmen, to have a character in their right hand or on their foreheads:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And that no man might buy or sell, but he that hath the character, or the name of the beast, or the number of his name.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Here is wisdom. He that hath understanding, let him count the number of the beast. For it is the number of a man: and the number of him is six hundred sixty-six. Six hundred sixty-six.... The numeral letters of his name shall make up this number. Apocalypse Chapter 14 Of the Lamb and of the virgins that follow him. Of the judgments that shall fall upon the wicked.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I beheld: and lo a Lamb stood upon mount Sion, and with him an hundred forty-four thousand, having his name and the name of his Father written on their foreheads.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard a voice from heaven, as the noise of many waters and as the voice of great thunder. And the voice which I heard was as the voice of harpers, harping on their harps.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they sung as it were a new canticle, before the throne and before the four living creatures and the ancients: and no man could say the canticle, but those hundred forty-four thousand who were purchased from the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: These are they who were not defiled with women: for they are virgins. These follow the Lamb whithersoever he goeth. These were purchased from among men, the firstfruits to God and to the Lamb.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And in their mouth there was found no lie: for they are without spot before the throne of God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw another angel flying through the midst of heaven, having the eternal gospel, to preach unto them that sit upon the earth and over every nation and tribe and tongue and people:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Saying with a loud voice: Fear the Lord and give him honour, because the hour of his judgment is come. And adore ye him that made heaven and earth, the sea and the fountains of waters.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And another angel followed, saying: That great Babylon is fallen, is fallen; which made all nations to drink of the wine of the wrath of her fornication. Babylon.... By Babylon may be very probably signified all the wicked world in general, which God will punish, and destroy after the short time of this mortal life: or it may signify every great city wherein enormous sins and abominations are daily committed; and that when the measure of its iniquities is full, the punishments due to its crimes are poured on it. It may also be some city of the description in the text, that will exist, and be destroyed, as here described, towards the end of the world.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice: If any man shall adore the beast and his image and receive his character in his forehead or in his hand,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He also shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is mingled with pure wine in the cup of his wrath: and shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the sight of the holy angels and in the sight of the Lamb.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the smoke of their torments, shall ascend up for ever and ever: neither have they rest day nor night, who have adored the beast and his image and whoever receiveth the character of his name.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Here is the patience of the saints, who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard a voice from heaven, saying to me: Write: Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord. From henceforth now, saith the Spirit, that they may rest from their labours. For their works follow them. Die in the Lord.... It is understood of the martyrs who die for the Lord.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw: and behold a white cloud and upon the cloud one sitting like to the Son of man, having on his head a crown of gold and in his hand a sharp sickle.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And another angel came out from the temple, crying with a loud voice to him that sat upon the cloud: Thrust in thy sickle and reap, because the hour is come to reap. For the harvest of the earth is ripe.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he that sat on the cloud thrust his sickle into the earth: and the earth was reaped.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven, he also having a sharp sickle.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And another angel came out from the altar, who had power over fire. And he cried with a loud voice to him that had the sharp sickle, saying: Thrust in thy sharp sickle and gather the clusters of the vineyard of the earth, because the grapes thereof are ripe.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the angel thrust in his sharp sickle into the earth and gathered the vineyard of the earth and cast it into the great press of the wrath of God:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the press was trodden without the city, and blood came out of the press, up to the horses’ bridles, for a thousand and six hundred furlongs. Apocalypse Chapter 15 They that have overcome the beast glorify God. Of the seven angels with the seven vials.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw another sign in heaven, great and wonderful: seven angels having the seven last plagues. For in them is filled up the wrath of God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw as it were a sea of glass mingled with fire: and them that had overcome the beast and his image and the number of his name, standing on the sea of glass, having the harps of God:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And singing the canticle of Moses, the servant of God, and the canticle of the Lamb, saying: Great and wonderful are thy works, O Lord God Almighty. Just and true are thy ways, O King of ages.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Who shall not fear thee, O Lord, and magnify thy name? For thou only art holy. For all nations shall come and shall adore in thy sight, because thy judgments are manifest.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And after these things, I looked: and behold, the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the seven angels came out of the temple, having the seven plagues, clothed with clean and white linen and girt about the breasts with golden girdles.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And one of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven golden vials, full of the wrath of God, who liveth for ever and ever.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the temple was filled with smoke from the majesty of God and from his power. And no man was able to enter into the temple, till the seven plagues of the seven angels were fulfilled. Apocalypse Chapter 16 The seven vials are poured out. The plagues that ensue.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard a great voice out of the temple, saying to the seven angels: Go and pour out the seven vials of the wrath of God upon the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the first went and poured out his vial upon the earth. And there fell a sore and grievous wound upon men who had the character of the beast: and upon them that adored the image thereof.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the second angel poured out his vial upon the sea. And there came blood as it were of a dead man: and every living soul died in the sea.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the third poured out his vial upon the rivers and the fountains of waters. And there was made blood.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard the angel of the waters saying: Thou art just, O Lord, who art and who wast, the Holy One, because thou hast judged these things.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For they have shed the blood of saints and prophets: and thou hast given them blood to drink. For they are worthy.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard another, from the altar, saying: Yea, O Lord God Almighty, true and just are thy judgments.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the fourth angel poured out his vial upon the sun. And it was given unto him to afflict men with heat and fire.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And men were scorched with great heat: and they blasphemed the name of God, who hath power over these plagues. Neither did they penance to give him glory.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the fifth angel poured out his vial upon the seat of the beast. And his kingdom became dark: and they gnawed their tongues for pain.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they blasphemed the God of heaven, because of their pains and wounds: and did not penance for their works.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the sixth angel poured out his vial upon that great river Euphrates and dried up the water thereof, that a way might be prepared for the kings from the rising of the sun.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw from the mouth of the dragon and from the mouth of the beast and from the mouth of the false prophet, three unclean spirits like frogs.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For they are the spirits of devils, working signs: and they go forth unto the kings of the whole earth, to gather them to battle against the great day of the Almighty God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Behold, I come as a thief. Blessed is he that watcheth and keepeth his garments, lest he walk naked, and they see his shame.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he shall gather them together into a place which in Hebrew is called Armagedon. Armagedon.... That is, the hill of robbers.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the seventh angel poured out his vial upon the air. And there came a great voice out of the temple from the throne, saying: It is done.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there were lightnings and voices and thunders: and there was a great earthquake, such an one as never had been since men were upon the earth, such an earthquake, so great.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the great city was divided into three parts: and the cities of the Gentiles fell. And great Babylon came in remembrance before God, to give her the cup of the wine of the indignation of his wrath.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And every island fled away: and the mountains were not found.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And great hail, like a talent, came down from heaven upon men: and men blasphemed God, for the plague of the hail: because it was exceeding great. Apocalypse Chapter 17 The description of the great harlot and of the beast upon which she sits.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there came one of the seven angels who had the seven vials and spoke with me, saying: Come, I will shew thee the condemnation of the great harlot, who sitteth upon many waters:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: With whom the kings of the earth have committed fornication. And they who inhabit the earth have been made drunk with the wine of her whoredom.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he took me away in spirit into the desert. And I saw a woman sitting upon a scarlet coloured beast, full of names of blasphemy, having seven heads and ten horns.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the woman was clothed round about with purple and scarlet, and gilt with gold and precious stones and pearls, having a golden cup in her hand, full of the abomination and filthiness of her fornication.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And on her forehead a name was written: A mystery: Babylon the great, the mother of the fornications and the abominations of the earth. A mystery.... That is, a secret; because what follows of the name and title of the great harlot is to be taken in a mystical sense. Babylon.... Either the city of the devil in general; or, if this place be to be understood of any particular city, pagan Rome, which then and for three hundred years persecuted the church; and was the principal seat both of empire and idolatry.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw the woman drunk with the blood of the saints and with the blood of the martyrs of Jesus. And I wondered, when I had seen her, with great admiration.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the angel said to me: Why dost thou wonder? I will tell thee the mystery of the woman and of the beast which carrieth her, which hath the seven heads and ten horns.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: The beast which thou sawest, was, and is not, and shall come up out of the bottomless pit and go into destruction. And the inhabitants on the earth (whose names are not written in the book of life from the foundation of the world) shall wonder, seeing the beast that was and is not. The beast which thou sawest.... This beast which supports Babylon, may signify the power of the devil: which was and is not, being much limited by the coming of Christ, but shall again exert itself under Antichrist. The seven heads of this beast are seven mountains or empires, instruments of his tyranny; of which five were then fallen. (See chap. 13.1, and below, ver. 10.) The beast itself is said to be the eighth, and is of the seven; because they all act under the devil, and by his instigation, so that his power is in them all, yet so as to make up, as it were, an eighth empire, distinct from them all.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And here is the understanding that hath wisdom. The seven heads are seven mountains, upon which the woman sitteth: and they are seven kings.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Five are fallen, one is, and the other is not yet come: and when he is come, he must remain a short time.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the beast which was and is not: the same also is the eighth, and is of the seven, and goeth into destruction.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the ten horns which thou sawest are ten kings, who have not yet received a kingdom: but shall receive power as kings, one hour after the beast. Ten kings.... Ten lesser kingdoms, enemies also of the church of Christ: which, nevertheless, shall be made instruments of the justice of God for the punishment of Babylon. Some understand this of the Goths, Vandals, Huns, and other barbarous nations, that destroyed the empire of Rome.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: These have one design: and their strength and power they shall deliver to the beast.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: These shall fight with the Lamb. And the Lamb shall overcome them because he is Lord of lords and King of kings: and they that are with him are called and elect and faithful.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he said to me: The waters which thou sawest, where the harlot sitteth, are peoples and nations and tongues.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the ten horns which thou sawest in the beast: These shall hate the harlot and shall make her desolate and naked and shall eat her flesh and shall burn her with fire.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For God hath given into their hearts to do that which pleaseth him: that they give their kingdom to the beast, till the words of God be fulfilled.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the woman which thou sawest is the great city which hath kingdom over the kings of the earth. Apocalypse Chapter 18 The fall of Babylon. Kings and merchants lament over her.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And after these things, I saw another angel come down from heaven, having great power: and the earth was enlightened with his glory.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he cried out with a strong voice, saying: Babylon the great is fallen, is fallen: and is become the habitation of devils and the hold of every unclean spirit and the hold of every unclean and hateful bird:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Because all nations have drunk of the wine of the wrath of her fornication: and the kings of the earth have committed fornication with her; And the merchants of the earth have been made rich by the power of her delicacies.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard another voice from heaven, saying: Go out from her, my people; that you be not partakers of her sins and that you receive not of her plagues.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For her sins have reached unto heaven: and the Lord hath remembered her iniquities.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Render to her as she also hath rendered to you: and double unto her double, according to her works. In the cup wherein she hath mingled, mingle ye double unto her.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: As much as she hath glorified herself and lived in delicacies, so much torment and sorrow give ye to her. Because she saith in her heart: I sit a queen and am no widow: and sorrow I shall not see.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Therefore, shall her plagues come in one day, death and mourning and famine. And she shall be burnt with the fire: because God is strong, who shall judge her.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the kings of the earth, who have committed fornication and lived in delicacies with her, shall weep and bewail themselves over her, when they shall see the smoke of her burning:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Standing afar off for fear of her torments, saying: Alas! alas! that great city, Babylon, that mighty city: for in one hour is thy judgment come.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the merchants of the earth shall weep and mourn over her: for no man shall buy their merchandise any more.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Merchandise of gold and silver and precious stones: and of pearls and fine linen and purple and silk and scarlet: and all thyine wood: and all manner of vessels of ivory: and all manner of vessels of precious stone and of brass and of iron and of marble:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And cinnamon and odours and ointment and frankincense and wine and oil and fine flour and wheat and beasts and sheep and horses and chariots: and slaves and souls of men.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the fruits of the desire of thy soul are departed from thee: and all fat and goodly things are perished from thee. And they shall find them no more at all.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: The merchants of these things, who were made rich, shall stand afar off from her, for fear of her torments, weeping and mourning,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And saying: Alas! alas! that great city, which was clothed with fine linen and purple and scarlet and was gilt with gold and precious stones and pearls.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For in one hour are so great riches come to nought. And every shipmaster and all that sail into the lake, and mariners, and as many as work in the sea, stood afar off,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And cried, seeing the place of her burning, saying: What city is like to this great city?

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they cast dust upon their heads and cried, weeping and mourning, saying: Alas! alas! that great city, wherein all were made rich, that had ships at sea, by reason of her prices. For, in one hour she is made desolate.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Rejoice over her, thou heaven and ye holy apostles and prophets. For God hath judged your judgment on her.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And a mighty angel took up a stone, as it were a great millstone, and cast it into the sea, saying: With such violence as this, shall Babylon, that great city, be thrown down and shall be found no more at all.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the voice of harpers and of musicians and of them that play on the pipe and on the trumpet shall no more be heard at all in thee: and no craftsman of any art whatsoever shall be found any more at all in thee: and the sound of the mill shall be heard no more at all in thee:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the light of the lamp shall shine no more at all in thee: and the voice of the bridegroom and the bride shall be heard no more at all in thee. For thy merchants were the great men of the earth: for all nations have been deceived by thy enchantments.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And in her was found the blood of prophets and of saints and of all that were slain upon the earth. Apocalypse Chapter 19 The saints glorify God for his judgments on the great harlot. Christ’s victory over the beast and the kings of the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: After these things, I heard as it were the voice of much people in heaven, saying: Alleluia. Salvation and glory and power is to our God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For true and just are his judgments, who hath judged the great harlot which corrupted the earth with her fornication and hath revenged the blood of his servants, at her hands.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And again they said: Alleluia. And her smoke ascendeth for ever and ever.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the four and twenty ancients and the four living creatures fell down and adored God that sitteth upon the throne, saying: Amen. Alleluia.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And a voice came out from the throne, saying: Give praise to our God, all ye his servants: and you that fear him, little and great.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard as it were the voice of a great multitude, and as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of great thunders, saying: Alleluia: for the Lord our God, the Almighty, hath reigned.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Let us be glad and rejoice and give glory to him. For the marriage of the Lamb is come: and his wife hath prepared herself.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And it is granted to her that she should clothe herself with fine linen, glittering and white. For the fine linen are the justifications of saints.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he said to me: Write: Blessed are they that are called to the marriage supper of the Lamb. And he saith to me: These words of God are true.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I fell down before his feet, to adore him. And he saith to me: See thou do it not. I am thy fellow servant and of thy brethren who have the testimony of Jesus. Adore God. For the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy. I fell down before, etc.... St. Augustine (lib. 20, contra Faust, c. 21) is of opinion, that this angel appeared in so glorious a manner, that St. John took him to be God; and therefore would have given him divine honour had not the angel stopped him, by telling him he was but his fellow servant. St. Gregory (Hom. 8, in Evang.) rather thinks that the veneration offered by St. John, was not divine honour, or indeed any other than what might lawfully be given; but was nevertheless refused by the angel, in consideration of the dignity to which our human nature had been raised, by the incarnation of the Son of God, and the dignity of St. John, an apostle, prophet, and martyr.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw heaven opened: and behold a white horse. And he that sat upon him was called faithful and true: and with justice doth he judge and fight.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And his eyes were as a flame of fire: and on his head were many diadems. And he had a name written, which no man knoweth but himself.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he was clothed with a garment sprinkled with blood. And his name is called: THE WORD OF GOD.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the armies that are in heaven followed him on white horses, clothed in fine linen, white and clean.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And out of his mouth proceedeth a sharp two-edged sword, that with it he may strike the nations. And he shall rule them with a rod of iron: and he treadeth the winepress of the fierceness of the wrath of God the Almighty.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he hath on his garment and on his thigh written: KING OF KINGS AND LORD OF LORDS.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw an angel standing in the sun: and he cried with a loud voice, saying to all the birds that did fly through the midst of heaven: Come, gather yourselves together to the great supper of God:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: That you may eat the flesh of kings and the flesh of tribunes and the flesh of mighty men and the flesh of horses and of them that sit on them: and the flesh of all freemen and bondmen and of little and of great.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw the beast and the kings of the earth and their armies, gathered together to make war with him that sat upon the horse and with his army.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the beast was taken, and with him the false prophet who wrought signs before him, wherewith he seduced them who received the character of the beast and who adored his image. These two were cast alive into the pool of fire burning with brimstone.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the rest were slain by the sword of him that sitteth upon the horse, which proceedeth out of his mouth: and all the birds were filled with their flesh. Apocalypse Chapter 20 Satan is bound for a thousand years. The souls of the martyrs reign with Christ in the first resurrection. The last attempts of Satan against the church. The last judgment.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw an angel coming down from heaven, having the key of the bottomless pit and a great chain in his hand.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he laid hold on the dragon, the old serpent, which is the devil and Satan, and bound him for a thousand years. Bound him, etc.... The power of Satan has been very much limited by the passion of Christ: for a thousand years; that is, for the whole time of the New Testament; but especially from the time of the destruction of Babylon or pagan Rome, till the new efforts of Gog and Magog against the church, towards the end of the world. During which time the souls of the martyrs and saints live and reign with Christ in heaven, in the first resurrection, which is that of the soul to the life of glory; as the second resurrection will be that of the body, at the day of the general judgment.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he cast him into the bottomless pit and shut him up and set a seal upon him, that he should no more seduce the nations till the thousand years be finished. And after that, he must be loosed a little time.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw seats. And they sat upon them: and judgment was given unto them. And the souls of them that were beheaded for the testimony of Jesus and for the word of God and who had not adored the beast nor his image nor received his character on their foreheads or in their hands. And they lived and reigned with Christ a thousand years.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: The rest of the dead lived not, till the thousand years were finished. This is the first resurrection.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Blessed and holy is he that hath part in the first resurrection. In these the second death hath no power. But they shall be priests of God and of Christ: and shall reign with him a thousand years.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when the thousand years shall be finished, Satan shall be loosed out of his prison and shall go forth and seduce the nations which are over the four quarters of the earth, Gog and Magog: and shall gather them together to battle, the number of whom is as the sand of the sea.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they came upon the breadth of the earth and encompassed the camp of the saints and the beloved city.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there came down fire from God out of heaven and devoured them: and the devil, who seduced them, was cast into the pool of fire and brimstone, where both the beast

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the false prophet shall be tormented day and night for ever and ever.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw a great white throne and one sitting upon it, from whose face the earth and heaven fled away: and there was no place found for them.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw the dead, great and small, standing in the presence of the throne. And the books were opened: and another book was opened, which is the book of life. And the dead were judged by those things which were written in the books, according to their works.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the sea gave up the dead that were in it: and death and hell gave up their dead that were in them. And they were judged, every one according to their works.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And hell and death were cast into the pool of fire. This is the second death.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And whosoever was not found written in the book of life was cast into the pool of fire. Apocalypse Chapter 21 The new Jerusalem described.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw a new heaven and a new earth. For the first heaven and the first earth was gone: and the sea is now no more. The first heaven and the first earth was gone ... being changed, not as to their substance, but in their qualities.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I, John, saw the holy city, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard a great voice from the throne, saying: Behold the tabernacle of God with men: and he will dwell with them. And they shall be his people: and God himself with them shall be their God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes: and death shall be no more. Nor mourning, nor crying, nor sorrow shall be any more, for the former things are passed away.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he that sat on the throne, said: Behold, I make all things new. And he said to me: Write. For these words are most faithful and true.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he said to me: It is done. I am Alpha and Omega: the Beginning and the End. To him that thirsteth, I will give of the fountain of the water of life, freely.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that shall overcome shall possess these things. And I will be his God: and he shall be my son.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: But the fearful and unbelieving and the abominable and murderers and whoremongers and sorcerers and idolaters and all liars, they shall have their portion in the pool burning with fire and brimstone, which is the second death.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there came one of the seven angels, who had the vials full of the seven last plagues, and spoke with me, saying: Come and I will shew thee the bride, the wife of the Lamb.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he took me up in spirit to a great and high mountain: and he shewed me the holy city Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Having the glory of God, and the light thereof was like to a precious stone, as to the jasper stone even as crystal.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And it had a wall great and high, having twelve gates, and in the gates twelve angels, and names written thereon, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the children of Israel.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: On the east, three gates: and on the north, three gates: and on the south, three gates: and on the west, three gates.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the wall of the city had twelve foundations: And in them, the twelve names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he that spoke with me had a measure of a reed of gold, to measure the city and the gates thereof and the wall.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the city lieth in a four-square: and the length thereof is as great as the breadth. And he measured the city with the golden reed for twelve thousand furlongs: and the length and the height and the breadth thereof are equal.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he measured the wall thereof an hundred forty-four cubits, the measure of a man, which is of an angel. The measure of a man, i.e., According to the measure of men, and used by the angel.... This seems to be the true meaning of these words.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the building of the wall thereof was of jasper stone: but the city itself pure gold like to clear glass.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the foundations of the wall of the city were adorned with all manner of precious stones. The first foundation was jasper: the second, sapphire: the third; a chalcedony: the fourth, an emerald:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: The fifth, sardonyx: the sixth, sardius: the seventh, chrysolite: the eighth, beryl: the ninth, a topaz: the tenth, a chrysoprasus: the eleventh, a jacinth: the twelfth, an amethyst.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the twelve gates are twelve pearls, one to each: and every several gate was of one several pearl. And the street of the city was pure gold, as it were, transparent glass.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw no temple therein. For the Lord God Almighty is the temple thereof, and the Lamb.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the city hath no need of the sun, nor of the moon, to shine in it. For the glory of God hath enlightened it: and the Lamb is the lamp thereof.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the nations shall walk in the light of it: and the kings of the earth shall bring their glory and honour into it.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the gates thereof shall not be shut by day: for there shall be no night there.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they shall bring the glory and honour of the nations into it.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: There shall not enter into it any thing defiled or that worketh abomination or maketh a lie: but they that are written in the book of life of the Lamb. Apocalypse Chapter 22 The water and tree of life. The conclusion.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he shewed me a river of water of life, clear as crystal, proceeding from the throne of God and of the Lamb.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: In the midst of the street thereof, and on both sides of the river, was the tree of life, bearing twelve fruits, yielding its fruits every month: and the leaves of the tree for the healing of the nations.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there shall be no curse any more: but the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it. And his servants shall serve him.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they shall see his face: and his name shall be on their foreheads.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And night shall be no more. And they shall not need the light of the lamp, nor the light of the sun, because the Lord God shall enlighten them. And they shall reign for ever and ever.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he said to me: These words are most faithful and true. And the Lord God of the spirits of the prophets sent his angel to shew his servants the things which must be done shortly.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And: Behold I come quickly. Blessed is he that keepeth the words of the prophecy of this book.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I, John, who have heard and seen these things. And, after I had heard and seen, I fell down to adore before the feet of the angel who shewed me these things.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he said to me: See thou do it not. For I am thy fellow servant, and of thy brethren the prophets and of them that keep the words of the prophecy of this book. Adore God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he saith to me: Seal not the words of the prophecy of this book. For the time is at hand. For the time is at hand.... That is, when compared to eternity, all time and temporal things vanish, and are but of short duration. As to the time when the chief predictions should come to pass, we have no certainty, as appears by the different opinions, both of the ancient fathers and late interpreters. Many think that most things set down from the 4th chapter to the end, will not be fulfilled till a little time before the end of the world. Others are of opinion, that a great part of them, and particularly the fall of the wicked Babylon, happened at the destruction of paganism, by the destruction of heathen Rome, and its persecuting heathen emperors. Of these interpretations, see Aleazar, in his long commentary; see the learned Bossnet, bishop of Meaux, in his treatise on this Book; and P. Alleman, in his notes on the same Apocalypse, tom. 12, who in his Preface says, that this, in a great measure, may be now looked upon as the opinion followed by the learned men. In fine, others think that St. John’s design was in a mystical way, by metaphors and allegories, to represent the attempts and persecutions of the wicked against the servants of God, the punishments that should in a short time fall upon Babylon, that is, upon all the wicked in general: the eternal happiness and reward, which God had reserved for the pious inhabitants of Jerusalem, that is, for his faithful servants, after their short trials and the tribulations of this mortal life. In the mean time we meet with many profitable instructions and admonitions, which we may easily enough understand: but we have no certainty when we apply these predictions to particular events: for as St. Jerome takes notice, the Apocalypse has as many mysteries as words, or rather mysteries in every word. Apocalypsis Joannis tot habet Sacramenta quot verba—parum dixi, in verbis singulis multiplices latent intelligentiae. Ep. ad Paulin, t. 4. p. 574. Edit. Benedict.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hurteth, let him hurt still: and he that is filthy, let him be filthy still: and he that is just, let him be justified still: and he that is holy, let him be sanctified still. Let him hurt still.... It is not an exhortation, or license to go on in sin; but an intimation, that how far soever the wicked may proceed, their progress shall quickly end, and then they must expect to meet with proportionable punishments.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Behold, I come quickly: and my reward is with me, to render to every, man according to his works.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I am Alpha and Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Blessed are they that wash their robes in the blood of the Lamb: that they may have a right to the tree of life and may enter in by the gates into the city.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Without are dogs and sorcerers and unchaste and murderers and servers of idols and every one that loveth and maketh a lie.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I, Jesus, have sent my angel, to testify to you these things in the churches. I am the root and stock of David, the bright and morning star.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the spirit and the bride say: Come. And he that heareth, let him say: Come. And he that thirsteth, let him come. And he that will, let him take the water of life, freely.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For I testify to every one that heareth the words of the prophecy of this book: If any man shall add to these things, God shall add unto him the plagues written in this book.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
