Text: And if any man shall take away from the words of the book of this prophecy, God shall take away his part out of the book of life, and out of the holy city, and from these things that are written in this book.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that giveth testimony of these things, saith: Surely, I come quickly: Amen. Come, Lord Jesus.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen. APPENDICES These texts come from the 1582 Rhemes and 1610 Doway printings of the portions of the Bible. The primary sources provide a glimpse both into the history of the Douay-Rheims version and the English language itself. The reader will quickly notice that the letter ‘j’ does not appear in the texts, rather ‘i’ functions either as a vowel or a consonant. Likewise ‘u’ is not a distinct letter; it is employed typographically in the lower-case in place of ‘v’ where not starting a word. The letters ‘u’ and ‘v’ both function either as vowels or consonants. The word ‘vniuersity’ demonstrates this rule. The letter ‘w’ is often employed, but in many cases the earlier form of a double-v (vv) appears instead. The transcriber has done his best to render the text accurately. Note the relaxed spelling standards of the time; many variants appear. While the errata section from the 1610 edition observed: “We haue also found some other faultes of lesse importance; and feare there be more. But we trust the reader may easely correct them, as they occurre.” only obvious errors have been amended. Where the transcriber has doubt between whether an irregular spelling is either an error and a variant, the printed text stands. 7-bit ASCII cannot fully represent the typographical standards of the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries, and many special characters have been replaced with modern equivalents. Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy, a brother: to Philemon, our beloved and fellow labourer,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: And to Appia, our dearest sister, and to Archippus, our fellow soldier, and to the church which is in thy house.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: Grace to you and peace, from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: I give thanks to my God, always making a remembrance of thee in my prayers.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: Hearing of thy charity and faith, which thou hast in the Lord Jesus and towards all the saints:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: That the communication of thy faith may be made evident in the acknowledgment of every good work that is in you in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: For I have had great joy and consolation in thy charity, because the bowels of the saints have been refreshed by thee, brother.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: Wherefore, though I have much confidence in Christ Jesus to command thee that which is to the purpose:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: For charity sake I rather beseech, whereas thou art such a one, as Paul, an old man and now a prisoner also of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: I beseech thee for my son, whom I have begotten in my bands, Onesimus,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: Who hath been heretofore unprofitable to thee but now is profitable both to me and thee:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: Whom I have sent back to thee. And do thou receive him as my own bowels.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered to me in the bands of the gospel.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: But without thy counsel I would do nothing: that thy good deed might not be as it were of necessity, but voluntary.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season from thee that thou mightest receive him again for ever:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: Not now as a servant, but instead of a servant, a most dear brother, especially to me. But how much more to thee, both in the flesh and in the Lord?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: If therefore thou count me a partner, receive him as myself.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: And if he hath wronged thee in any thing or is in thy debt, put that to my account.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: I Paul have written it with my own hand: I will repay it: not to say to thee that thou owest me thy own self also.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: Yea, brother. May I enjoy thee in the Lord! Refresh my bowels in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: Trusting in thy obedience, I have written to thee: knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: But withal prepare me also a lodging. For I hope that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: Mark, Aristarchus, Demas and Luke, my fellow labourers.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Philemon
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Paul and Timothy, the servants of Jesus Christ: to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Grace be unto you and peace, from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: I give thanks to my God in every remembrance of you:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Always in all my prayers making supplication for you all with joy:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For your communication in the gospel of Christ, from the first day until now.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Being confident of this very thing: that he who hath begun a good work in you will perfect it unto the day of Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: As it is meet for me to think this for you all, for that I have you in my heart; and that, in my bands and in the defence and confirmation of the gospel, you all are partakers of my joy.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For God is my witness how I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And this I pray: That your charity may more and more abound in knowledge and in all understanding:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: That you may approve the better things: that you may be sincere and without offence unto the day of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Filled with the fruit of justice, through Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Now, brethren, I desire you should know that the things which have happened to me have fallen out rather to the furtherance of the gospel:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: So that my bands are made manifest in Christ, in all the court and in all other places.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And many of the brethren in the Lord, growing confident by my bands, are much more bold to speak the word of God without fear.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Some indeed, even out of envy and contention: but some also for good will preach Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Some out of charity, knowing that I am set for the defence of the gospel.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And some out of contention preach Christ not sincerely: supposing that they raise affliction to my bands.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: But what then? So that by all means, whether by occasion or by truth, Christ be preached: in this also I rejoice, yea, and will rejoice.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For I know that this shall fall out to me unto salvation, through your prayer and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: According to my expectation and hope; that in nothing I shall be confounded: but with all confidence, as always, so now also, shall Christ be magnified in my body, whether it be by life or by death.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For to me, to live is Christ: and to die is gain.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And if to live in the flesh: this is to me the fruit of labour. And what I shall choose I know not. This is to me, etc.... His meaning is, that although his dying immediately for Christ would be his gain, by putting him presently in possession of heaven; yet he is doubtful what he should choose, because by staying longer in the flesh, he should be more beneficial to the souls of his neighbours.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: But I am straitened between two: having a desire to be dissolved and to be with Christ, a thing by far the better.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: But to abide still in the flesh is needful for you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all, for your furtherance and joy of faith:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: That your rejoicing may abound in Christ Jesus for me, by my coming to you again.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Only let your conversation be worthy of the gospel of Christ: that, whether I come and see you, or, being absent, may hear of you, that you stand fast in one spirit, with one mind labouring together for the faith of the gospel.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And in nothing be ye terrified by the adversaries: which to them is a cause of perdition, but to you of salvation, and this from God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For unto you it is given for Christ, not only to believe in him, but also to suffer for him:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Having the same conflict as that which you have seen in me and now have heard of me. Philippians Chapter 2 He recommends them to unity and humility, and to work out their salvation with fear and trembling.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of charity, if any society of the spirit, if any bowels of commiseration:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Fulfil ye my joy, that you be of one mind, having the same charity, being of one accord, agreeing in sentiment.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Let nothing be done through contention: neither by vain glory. But in humility, let each esteem others better than themselves:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Each one not considering the things that are his own, but those that are other men’s.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Who being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: But emptied himself, taking the form of a servant, being made in the likeness of men, and in habit found as a man. Emptied himself, exinanivit.... made himself as of no account.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: He humbled himself, becoming obedient unto death, even to the death of the cross.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For which cause, God also hath exalted him and hath given him a name which is above all names:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: That in the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those that are in heaven, on earth, and under the earth:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And that every tongue should confess that the Lord Jesus Christ is in the glory of God the Father.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Wherefore, my dearly beloved, (as you have always obeyed, not as in my presence only but much more now in my absence) with fear and trembling work out your salvation. With fear, etc.... This is against the false faith, and presumptuous security of modern sectaries.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For it is God who worketh in you, both to will and to accomplish, according to his good will.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And do ye all things without murmurings and hesitations:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: That you may be blameless and sincere children of God, without reproof, in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation: among whom you shine as lights in the world.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Holding forth the word of life to my glory in the day of Christ: because I have not run in vain, nor laboured in vain.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Yea, and if I be made a victim upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I rejoice and congratulate with you all.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And for the selfsame thing, do you also rejoice and congratulate with me.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy unto you shortly, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know the things concerning you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For I have no man so of the same mind, who with sincere affection is solicitous for you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For all seek the things that are their own not the things that are Jesus Christ’s.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Now know ye the proof of him: that as a son with the father, so hath he served with me in the gospel.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Him therefore I hope to send unto you immediately: so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And I trust in the Lord that I myself also shall come to you shortly.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: But I have thought it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother and fellow labourer and fellow soldier, but your apostle: and he that hath ministered to my wants.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For indeed he longed after you all: and was sad, for that you had heard that he was sick.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For indeed he was sick, nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him. And not only on him, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Therefore, I sent him the more speedily: that seeing him again, you may rejoice, and I may be without sorrow.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Receive him therefore with all joy in the Lord: and treat with honour such as he is.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Because for the work of Christ he came to the point of death: delivering his life, that he might fulfil that which on your part was wanting towards my service. Philippians Chapter 3 He warneth them against false teachers. He counts all other things loss, that he may gain Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: As to the rest, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things to you, to me indeed is not wearisome, but to you is necessary.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Beware of dogs: beware of evil workers: beware of the concision.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For we are the circumcision, who in spirit serve God and glory in Christ Jesus, not having confidence in the flesh.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Though I might also have confidence in the flesh. If any other thinketh he may have confidence in the flesh, I more:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Being circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, an Hebrew of the Hebrews. According to the law, a Pharisee:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: According to zeal, persecuting the church of God: According to the justice that is in the law, conversing without blame.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: But the things that were gain to me, the same I have counted loss for Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Furthermore, I count all things to be but loss for the excellent knowledge of Jesus Christ, my Lord: for whom I have suffered the loss of all things and count them but as dung, that I may gain Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And may be found in him, not having my justice, which is of the law, but that which is of the faith of Christ Jesus, which is of God: justice in faith.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: That I may know him and the power of his resurrection and the fellowship of his sufferings: being made conformable to his death,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: If by any means I may attain to the resurrection which is from the dead.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Not as though I had already attained, or were already perfect: but I follow after, if I may by any means apprehend, wherein I am also apprehended by Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Brethren, I do not count myself to have apprehended. But one thing I do: Forgetting the things that are behind and stretching forth myself to those that are before,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: I press towards the mark, to the prize of the supernal vocation of God in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Let us therefore, as many as are perfect, be thus minded: and if in any thing you be otherwise minded, this also God will reveal to you,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Nevertheless, whereunto we are come, that we be of the same mind, let us also continue in the same rule.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Be ye followers of me, brethren: and observe them who walk so as you have our model.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For many walk, of whom I have told you often (and now tell you weeping) that they are enemies of the cross of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Whose end is destruction: whose God is their belly: and whose glory is in their shame: who mind earthly things.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: But our conversation is in heaven: from whence also we look for the Saviour, our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Who will reform the body of our lowness, made like to the body of his glory, according to the operation whereby also he is able to subdue all things unto himself. Philippians Chapter 4 He exhorts them to perseverance in all good and acknowledges their charitable contributions to him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Therefore my dearly beloved brethren and most desired, my joy and my crown: so stand fast in the Lord, my dearly beloved.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: I beg of Evodia and I beseech Syntyche to be of one mind in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And I entreat thee also, my sincere companion, help those women who have laboured with me in the gospel, with Clement and the rest of my fellow labourers, whose names are in the book of life.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Rejoice in the Lord always: again, I say, rejoice.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Let your modesty be known to all men. The Lord is nigh.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Be nothing solicitous: but in every thing, by prayer and supplication, with thanksgiving, let your petitions be made known to God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And the peace of God, which surpasseth all understanding, keep your hearts and minds in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For the rest, brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever modest, whatsoever just, whatsoever holy, whatsoever lovely, whatsoever of good fame, if there be any virtue, if any praise of discipline: think on these things. For the rest, brethren, whatsoever things are true, etc.... Here the apostle enumerates general precepts of morality, which they ought to practise. Whatsoever things are true.... in words, in promises, in lawful oaths, etc., he commands rectitude of mind, and sincerity of heart. Whatsoever modest.... by these words he prescribes gravity in manners, modesty in dress, and decency in conversation. Whatsoever just.... That is, in dealing with others, in buying or selling, in trade or business, to be fair and honest. Whatsoever holy.... by these words may be understood, that those who are in a religious state professed, or in holy orders, should lead a life of sanctity and chastity, according to the vows they make; but these words being also applied to those in the world, indicate the virtuous life they are bound by the divine commandments to follow. Whatsoever lovely.... that is, to practise those good offices in society, that procure us the esteem and good will of our neighbours. Whatsoever of good fame.... That is, that by our conduct and behaviour we should edify our neighbours, and give them good example by our actions. If there be any virtue, if any praise of discipline.... that those in error, by seeing the morality and good discipline of the true religion, may be converted. And finally, the apostle commands, not only the Philippians, but all Christians, to think on these things.... that is, to make it their study and concern that the peace of God might be with them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: The things which you have both learned and received and heard and seen in me, these do ye: and the God of peace shall be with you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Now I rejoice in the Lord exceedingly that now at length your thought for me hath flourished again, as you did also think; but you were busied.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: I speak not as it were for want. For I have learned, in whatsoever state I am, to be content therewith.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: I know both how to be brought low, and I know how to abound (every where and in all things I am instructed): both to be full and to be hungry: both to abound and to suffer need.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: I can do all things in him who strengtheneth me.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Nevertheless, you have done well in communicating to my tribulation.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And you also know, O Philippians, that in the beginning of the gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, no church communicated with me as concerning giving and receiving, but you only.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: For unto Thessalonica also you sent once and again for my use.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Not that I seek the gift: but I seek the fruit that may abound to your account.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: But I have all and abound: I am filled, having received from Epaphroditus the things you sent, an odour of sweetness, an acceptable sacrifice, pleasing to God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: And may my God supply all your want, according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Now to God and our Father be glory, world without end. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: Salute ye every saint in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: The brethren who are with me salute you. All the saints salute you: especially they that are of Caesar’s household.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Philippians
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the man who hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stood in the way of sinners, nor sat in the chair of pestilence:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But his will is in the law of the Lord, and on his law he shall meditate day and night.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall be like a tree which is planted near the running waters, which shall bring forth its fruit, in due season. And his leaf shall not fall off: and all whatsoever he shall do shall prosper.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Not so the wicked, not so: but like the dust, which the wind driveth from the face of the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore the wicked shall not rise again in judgment: nor sinners in the council of the just.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord knoweth the way of the just: and the way of the wicked shall perish. Psalms Chapter 2 Quare fremuerunt. The vain efforts of persecutors against Christ and his church.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why have the Gentiles raged, and the people devised vain things?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The kings of the earth stood up, and the princes met together, against the Lord, and against his Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let us break their bonds asunder: and let us cast away their yoke from us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh at them: and the Lord shall deride them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then shall he speak to them in his anger, and trouble them in his rage.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I am appointed king by him over Sion, his holy mountain, preaching his commandment.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath said to me: Thou art my son, this day have I begotten thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ask of me, and I will give thee the Gentiles for thy inheritance, and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt rule them with a rod of iron, and shalt break them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And now, O ye kings, understand: receive instruction, you that judge the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Serve ye the Lord with fear: and rejoice unto him with trembling.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Embrace discipline, lest at any time the Lord be angry, and you perish from the just way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When his wrath shall be kindled in a short time, blessed are all they that trust in him. Psalms Chapter 3 Domine, quid multiplicati. The prophet’s danger and delivery from his son Absalom: mystically, the passion and resurrection of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The psalm of David when he fled from the face of his son Absalom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why, O Lord, are they multipied that afflict me? many are they who rise up against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many say to my soul: There is no salvation for him in his God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou, O Lord, art my protector, my glory, and the lifter up of my head.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have cried to the Lord with my voice: and he hath heard me from his holy hill.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have slept and have taken my rest: and I have risen up, because the Lord hath protected me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will not fear thousands of the people surrounding me: arise, O Lord; save me, O my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast struck all them who are my adversaries without cause: thou hast broken the teeth of sinners.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Salvation is of the Lord: and thy blessing is upon thy people. Psalms Chapter 4 Cum invocarem. The prophet teacheth us to flee to God in tribulation, with confidence in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, in verses. A psalm for David. Unto the end.... Or, as St. Jerome renders it, victori, to him that overcometh: which some understand of the chief musician; to whom they suppose the psalms, which bear that title, were given to be sung: we rather understand the psalms thus inscribed to refer to Christ, who is the end of the law, and the great conqueror of death and hell, and to the New Testament.—Ibid. In verses, in carminibus.... In the Hebrew, it is neghinoth, supposed by some to be a musical instrument, with which this psalm was to be sung.—Ibid. For David, or to David.... That is, inspired to David himself, or to be sung.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When I called upon him, the God of my justice heard me: when I was in distress, thou hast enlarged me. Have mercy on me: and hear my prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O ye sons of men, how long will you be dull of heart? why do you love vanity, and seek after lying?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Know ye also that the Lord hath made his holy one wonderful: the Lord will hear me when I shall cry unto him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be ye angry, and sin not: the things you say in your hearts, be sorry for them upon your beds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Offer up the sacrifice of justice, and trust in the Lord: many say, Who sheweth us good things?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The light of thy countenance, O Lord, is signed upon us: thou hast given gladness in my heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By the fruit of their corn, their wine, and oil, they are multiplied.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In peace in the self same I will sleep, and I will rest:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou, O Lord, singularly hast settled me in hope. Psalms Chapter 5 Verba mea auribul. A prayer to God against the iniquities of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for her that obtaineth the inheritance. A psalm for David. For her that obtaineth the inheritance.... That is, for the church of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give ear, O Lord, to my words, understand my cry.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hearken to the voice of my prayer, O my King and my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For to thee will I pray: O Lord, in the morning thou shalt hear my voice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the morning I will stand before thee, and I will see: because thou art not a God that willest iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Neither shall the wicked dwell near thee: nor shall the unjust abide before thy eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hatest all the workers of iniquity: thou wilt destroy all that speak a lie. The bloody and the deceitful man the Lord will abhor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But as for me in the multitude of thy mercy, I will come into thy house; I will worship towards thy holy temple, in thy fear.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Conduct me, O Lord, in thy justice: because of my enemies, direct my way in thy sight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For there is no truth in their mouth: their heart is vain.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their throat is an open sepulchre: they dealt deceitfully with their tongues: judge them, O God. Let them fall from their devices: according to the multitude of their wickednesses cast them out: for they have provoked thee, O Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But let all them be glad that hope in thee: they shall rejoice for ever, and thou shalt dwell in them. And all they that love thy name shall glory in thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou wilt bless the just. O Lord, thou hast crowned us, as with a shield of thy good will. Psalms Chapter 6 Domine, ne in furore. A prayer of a penitent sinner, under the scourge of God. The first penitential psalm.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, in verses, a psalm for David, for the octave. For the octave.... That is, to be sung on an instrument of eight strings. St. Augustine understands it mystically, of the last resurrection, and the world to come; which is, as it were, the octave, or eighth day, after the seven days of this mortal life: and for this octave, sinners must dispose themselves, like David, by bewailing their sins, whilst they are here upon earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, rebuke me not in thy indignation, nor chastise me in thy wrath.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am weak: heal me, O Lord, for my bones are troubled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And my soul is troubled exceedingly: but thou, O Lord, how long?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn to me, O Lord, and deliver my soul: O save me for thy mercy’s sake.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For there is no one in death, that is mindful of thee: and who shall confess to thee in hell?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have laboured in my groanings, every night I will wash my bed: I will water my couch with my tears.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eye is troubled through indignation: I have grown old amongst all my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity: for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath heard my supplication: the Lord hath received my prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all my enemies be ashamed, and be very much troubled: let them be turned back, and be ashamed very speedily. Psalms Chapter 7 Domine, Deus meus. David, trusting in the justice of his cause, prayeth for God’s help against his enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The psalm of David, which he sung to the Lord, for the words of Chusi, the son of Jemini.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, my God, in thee have I put my trust; save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lest at any time he seize upon my soul like a lion, while there is no one to redeem me, nor to save.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, my God, if I have done this thing, if there be iniquity in my hands:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I have rendered to them that repaid me evils, let me deservedly fall empty before my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the enemy pursue my soul, and take it, and tread down my life, on the earth, and bring down my glory to the dust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Rise up, O Lord, in thy anger: and be thou exalted in the borders of my enemies. And arise, O Lord, my God, in the precept which thou hast commanded:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And a congregation of people shall surround thee. And for their sakes return thou on high.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord judgeth the people. Judge me, O Lord, according to my justice, and according to my innocence in me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wickedness of sinners shall be brought to nought; and thou shalt direct the just: the searcher of hearts and reins is God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Just is my help from the Lord; who saveth the upright of heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God is a just judge, strong and patient: is he angry every day?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Except you will be converted, he will brandish his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And in it he hath prepared the instruments of death, he hath made ready his arrows for them that burn. For them that burn.... That is, against the persecutors of his saints.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold he hath been in labour with injustice: he hath conceived sorrow, and brought forth iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath opened a pit and dug it: and he is fallen into the hole he made.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His sorrow shall be turned on his own head: and his iniquity shall come down upon his crown.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will give glory to the Lord according to his justice: and will sing to the name of the Lord the most high. Psalms Chapter 8 Domine, Dominus noster. God is wonderful in his works; especially in mankind, singularly exalted by the incarnation of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the presses: a psalm for David. The presses.... In Hebrew, Gittith, supposed to be a musical instrument.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, our Lord, how admirable is thy name in the whole earth! For thy magnificence is elevated above the heavens.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Out of the mouth of infants and of sucklings thou hast perfected praise, because of thy enemies, that thou mayst destroy the enemy and the avenger.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I will behold thy heavens, the works of thy fingers: the moon and the stars which thou hast founded.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What is man, that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man, that thou visitest him?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast made him a little less than the angels, thou hast crowned him with glory and honour:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And hast set him over the works of thy hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast subjected all things under his feet, all sheep and oxen: moreover, the beasts also of the fields.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The birds of the air, and the fishes of the sea, that pass through the paths of the sea.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, our Lord, how admirable is thy name in the whole earth! Psalms Chapter 9 Confitebor tibi, Domine. The church praiseth God for his protection against her enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the hidden things of the Son. A psalm for David. The hidden things of the Son.... The humility and sufferings of Christ, the Son of God; and of good Christians, who are his sons by adoption; are called hidden things, with regard to the children of this world, who know not the value and merit of them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will give praise to thee, O Lord, with my whole heart: I will relate all thy wonders.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will be glad, and rejoice in thee: I will sing to thy name, O thou most high.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When my enemy shall be turned back: they shall be weakened, and perish before thy face.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast maintained my judgment and my cause: thou hast sat on the throne, who judgest justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast rebuked the Gentiles, and the wicked one hath perished; thou hast blotted out their name for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The swords of the enemy have failed unto the end: and their cities thou hast destroyed. Their memory hath perished with a noise:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the Lord remaineth for ever. He hath prepared his throne in judgment:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall judge the world in equity, he shall judge the people in justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Lord is become a refuge for the poor: a helper in due time in tribulation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let them trust in thee who know thy name: for thou hast not forsaken them that seek thee, O Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing ye to the Lord, who dwelleth in Sion: declare his ways among the Gentiles:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For requiring their blood, he hath remembered them: he hath not forgotten the cry of the poor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have mercy on me, O Lord: see my humiliation which I suffer from my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou that liftest me up from the gates of death, that I may declare all thy praises in the gates of the daughter of Sion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will rejoice in thy salvation: the Gentiles have stuck fast in the destruction which they prepared. Their foot hath been taken in the very snare which they hid.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord shall be known when he executeth judgments: the sinner hath been caught in the works of his own hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked shall be turned into hell, all the nations that forget God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the poor man shall not be forgotten to the end: the patience of the poor shall not perish for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O Lord, let not man be strengthened: let the Gentiles be judged in thy sight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Appoint, O Lord, a lawgiver over them: that the Gentiles may know themselves to be but men. Here the late Hebrew doctors divide this psalm into two, making ver. 22 the beginning of Psalm 10. And again they join Psalms 146 and 147 into one, in order that the whole number of psalms should not exceed 150. And in this manner the psalms are numbered in the Protestant Bible. Psalm 10 according to the Hebrews. 9a:1. Why, O Lord, hast thou retired afar off? why dost thou slight us in our wants, in the time of trouble? 9a:2. Whilst the wicked man is proud, the poor is set on fire: they are caught in the counsels which they devise. 9a:3. For the sinner is praised in the desires of his soul: and the unjust man is blessed. 9a:4. The sinner hath provoked the Lord, according to the multitude of his wrath, he will not seek him: 9a:5. God is not before his eyes: his ways are filthy at all times. Thy judgments are removed from his sight: he shall rule over all his enemies. 9a:6. For he hath said in his heart: I shall not be moved from generation to generation, and shall be without evil. 9a:7. His mouth is full of cursing, and of bitterness, and of deceit: under his tongue are labour and sorrow. 9a:8. He sitteth in ambush with the rich, in private places, that he may kill the innocent. 9a:9. His eyes are upon the poor man: he lieth in wait, in secret, like a lion in his den. He lieth in ambush, that he may catch the poor man: so catch the poor, whilst he draweth him to him. 9a:10. In his net he will bring him down, he will crouch and fall, when he shall have power over the poor. 9a:11. For he hath said in his heart: God hath forgotten, he hath turned away his face, not to see to the end. 9a:12. Arise, O Lord God, let thy hand be exalted: forget not the poor. 9a:13. Wherefore hath the wicked provoked God? for he hath said in his heart: He will not require it. 9a:14. Thou seest it, for thou considerest labour and sorrow: that thou mayst deliver them into thy hands. To thee is the poor man left: thou wilt be a helper to the orphan. 9a:15. Break thou the arm of the sinner and of the malignant: his sin shall be sought, and shall not be found. 9a:16. The Lord shall reign to eternity, yea, for ever and ever: ye Gentiles shall perish from his land. 9a:17. The Lord hath heard the desire of the poor: thy ear hath heard the preparation of their heart. 9a:18. To judge for the fatherless and for the humble, that man may no more presume to magnify himself upon earth. Psalms Chapter 10 In Domino confido. The just man’s confidence in God in the midst of persecutions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end. A psalm to David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the Lord I put my trust: how then do you say to my soul: Get thee away from hence to the mountain, like a sparrow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For, lo, the wicked have bent their bow: they have prepared their arrows in the quiver, to shoot in the dark the upright of heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For they have destroyed the things which thou hast made: but what has the just man done?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is in his holy temple, the Lord’s throne is in heaven. His eyes look on the poor man: his eyelids examine the sons of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord trieth the just and the wicked: but he that loveth iniquity, hateth his own soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall rain snares upon sinners: fire and brimstone, and storms of winds, shall be the portion of their cup.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord is just, and hath loved justice: his countenance hath beheld righteousness. Psalms Chapter 11 Salvum me fac. The prophet calls for God’s help against the wicked.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end: for the octave, a psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Save me, O Lord, for there is now no saint: truths are decayed from among the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have spoken vain things, every one to his neighbour: with deceitful lips, and with a double heart have they spoken.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the Lord destroy all deceitful lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who have said: We will magnify our tongue: our lips are our own: who is Lord over us?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By reason of the misery of the needy, and the groans of the poor, now will I arise, saith the Lord. I will set him in safety: I will deal confidently in his regard.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The words of the Lord are pure words: as silver tried by the fire, purged from the earth, refined seven times.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou, O Lord, wilt preserve us: and keep us from this generation for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked walk round about: according to thy highness, thou hast multiplied the children of men. Psalms Chapter 12 Usquequo, Domine. A prayer in tribulation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David. How long, O Lord, wilt thou forget me unto the end? how long dost thou turn away thy face from me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long shall I take counsels in my soul, sorrow in my heart all the day?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long shall my enemy be exalted over Me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Consider, and hear me, O Lord, my God. Enlighten my eyes, that I never sleep in death:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lest at any time my enemy say: I have prevailed against him. They that trouble me, will rejoice when I am moved:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I have trusted in thy mercy. My heart shall rejoice in thy salvation: I will sing to the Lord, who giveth me good things: yea, I will sing to the name of the Lord, the most high. Psalms Chapter 13 Dixit insipiens. The general corruption of man before our redemption by Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David. The fool hath said in his heart: There is no God. They are corrupt, and are become abominable in their ways: there is none that doth good, no not one.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there be any that understand and seek God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They are all gone aside, they are become unprofitable together: there is none that doth good: no not one. Their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they acted deceitfully: the poison of asps is under their lips. Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness; their feet are swift to shed blood. Destruction and unhappiness in their ways; and the way of peace they have not known: there is no fear of God before their eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shall not all they know that work iniquity, who devour my people as they eat bread?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have not called upon the Lord: there have they trembled for fear, where there was no fear.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord is in the just generation: you have confounded the counsel of the poor man; but the Lord is his hope.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who shall give out of Sion the salvation of Israel? when the Lord shall have turned away the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad. Psalms Chapter 14 Domine, quis habitabit. What kind of men shall dwell in the heavenly Sion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David. Lord, who shall dwell in thy tabernacle? or who shall rest in thy holy hill?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that walketh without blemish, and worketh justice:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that speaketh truth in his heart, who hath not used deceit in his tongue: Nor hath done evil to his neighbour: nor taken up a reproach against his neighbours.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In his sight the malignant is brought to nothing: but he glorifieth them that fear the Lord. He that sweareth to his neighbour, and deceiveth not;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that hath not put out his money to usury, nor taken bribes against the innocent: He that doth these things, shall not be moved for ever. Psalms Chapter 15 Conserva me, Domine. Christ’s future victory and triumph over the world and death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The inscription of a title to David himself. Preserve me, O Lord, for I have put my trust in thee. The inscription of a title.... That is, of a pillar or monument, staylographia: which is as much as to say, that this psalm is most worthy to be engraved on an everlasting monument.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have said to the Lord, thou art my God, for thou hast no need of my goods.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To the saints, who are in his land, he hath made wonderful all my desires in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their infirmities were multiplied: afterwards they made haste. I will not gather together their meetings for bloodofferings: nor will I be mindful of their names by my lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup: it is thou that wilt restore my inheritance to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The lines are fallen unto me in goodly places: for my inheritance is goodly to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will bless the Lord, who hath given me understanding: moreover, my reins also have corrected me even till night.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I set the Lord always in my sight: for he is at my right hand, that I be not moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore my heart hath been glad, and my tongue hath rejoiced: moreover, my flesh also shall rest in hope.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; nor wilt thou give thy holy one to see corruption.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast made known to me the ways of life, thou shalt fill me with joy with thy countenance: at thy right hand are delights even to the end. Psalms Chapter 16 Exaudi, Domine, justitiam. A just man’s prayer in tribulation against the malice of his enemy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The prayer of David. Hear, O Lord, my justice: attend to my supplication. Give ear unto my prayer, which proceedeth not from deceitful lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my judgment come forth from thy countenance: let thy eyes behold the things that are equitable.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast proved my heart, and visited it by night, thou hast tried me by fire: and iniquity hath not been found in me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That my mouth may not speak the works of men: for the sake of the words of thy lips, I have kept hard ways.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Perfect thou my goings in thy paths: that my footsteps be not moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have cried to thee, for thou, O God, hast heard me: O incline thy ear unto me, and hear my words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shew forth thy wonderful mercies; thou who savest them that trust in thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From them that resist thy right hand keep me, as the apple of thy eye. Protect me under the shadow of thy wings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From the face of the wicked who have afflicted me. My enemies have surrounded my soul:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have shut up their fat: their mouth hath spoken proudly. Their fat.... That is, their bowels of compassion: for they have none for me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have cast me forth, and now they have surrounded me: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have taken me, as a lion prepared for the prey; and as a young lion dwelling in secret places.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O Lord, disappoint him and supplant him; deliver my soul from the wicked one; thy sword

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From the enemies of thy hand. O Lord, divide them from the few of the earth in their life: their belly is filled from thy hidden stores. They are full of children: and they have left to their little ones the rest of their substance. Divide them from the few, etc.... That is, cut them off from the earth, and the few trifling things thereof; which they are so proud of, or divide them from the few; that is, from thy elect, who are but few; that they may no longer have it in their power to oppress them. It is not meant by way of a curse or imprecation; but, as many other the like passages in the psalms, by way of a prediction, or prophecy of what should come upon them, in punishment of their wickedness. Ibid. Thy hidden stores.... Thy secret treasures, out of which thou furnishest those earthly goods, which, with a bountiful hand thou hast distributed both to the good and the bad.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But as for me, I will appear before thy sight in justice: I shall be satisfied when thy glory shall appear. Psalms Chapter 17 Diligam te, Domine. David’s thanks to God for his delivery from all his enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for David, the servant of the Lord, who spoke to the Lord the words of this canticle, in the day that the Lord delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul: and he said:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will love thee, O Lord, my strength:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is my firmament, my refuge, and my deliverer. My God is my helper, and in him will I put my trust. My protector, and the horn of my salvation, and my support.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praising, I will call upon the Lord: and I shall be saved from my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sorrows of death surrounded me: and the torrents of iniquity troubled me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sorrows of hell encompassed me: and the snares of death prevented me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In my affliction I called upon the Lord, and I cried to my God: And he heard my voice from his holy temple: and my cry before him came into his ears.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The earth shook and trembled: the foundations of the mountains were troubled and were moved, because he was angry with them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There went up a smoke in his wrath: and a fire flamed from his face: coals were kindled by it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He bowed the heavens, and came down, and darkness was under his feet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he ascended upon the cherubim, and he flew; he flew upon the wings of the winds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he made darkness his covert, his pavilion round about him: dark waters in the clouds of the air.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: At the brightness that was before him the clouds passed, hail and coals of fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Lord thundered from heaven, and the Highest gave his voice: hail and coals of fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he sent forth his arrows, and he scattered them: he multiplied lightnings, and troubled them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then the fountains of waters appeared, and the foundations of the world were discovered: At thy rebuke, O Lord, at the blast of the spirit of thy wrath.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent from on high, and took me: and received me out of many waters.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He delivered me from my strongest enemies, and from them that hated me: for they were too strong for me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They prevented me in the day of my affliction: and the Lord became my protector.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he brought me forth into a large place: he saved me, because he was well pleased with me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Lord will reward me according to my justice; and will repay me according to the cleanness of my hands:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because I have kept the ways of the Lord; and have not done wickedly against my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For all his judgments are in my sight: and his justices I have not put away from me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I shall be spotless with him: and shall keep myself from my iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Lord will reward me according to my justice: and according to the cleanness of my hands before his eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With the holy thou wilt be holy; and with the innocent man thou wilt be innocent:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And with the elect thou wilt be elect: and with the perverse thou wilt be perverted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou wilt save the humble people; but wilt bring down the eyes of the proud.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou lightest my lamp, O Lord: O my God, enlighten my darkness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For by thee I shall be delivered from temptation; and through my God I shall go over a wall.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As for my God, his way is undefiled: the words of the Lord are fire-tried: he is the protector of all that trust in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For who is God but the Lord? or who is God but our God?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God, who hath girt me with strength; and made my way blameless.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who hath made my feet like the feet of harts: and who setteth me upon high places.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who teacheth my hands to war: and thou hast made my arms like a brazen bow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thou hast given me the protection of thy salvation: and thy right hand hath held me up: And thy discipline hath corrected me unto the end: and thy discipline, the same shall teach me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me; and my feet are not weakened.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will pursue after my enemies, and overtake them: and I will not turn again till they are consumed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will break them, and they shall not be able to stand: they shall fall under my feet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thou hast girded me with strength unto battle; and hast subdued under me them that rose up against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thou hast made my enemies turn their back upon me, and hast destroyed them that hated me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They cried, but there was none to save them, to the Lord: but he heard them not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I shall beat them as small as the dust before the wind; I shall bring them to nought, like the dirt in the streets.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou wilt deliver me from the contradictions of the people; thou wilt make me head of the Gentiles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A people which I knew not, hath served me: at the hearing of the ear they have obeyed me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The children that are strangers have lied to me, strange children have faded away, and have halted from their paths.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord liveth, and blessed be my God, and let the God of my salvation be exalted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God, who avengest me, and subduest the people under me, my deliverer from my enraged enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thou wilt lift me up above them that rise up against me: from the unjust man thou wilt deliver me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore will I give glory to thee, O Lord, among the nations, and I will sing a psalm to thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Giving great deliverance to his king, and shewing mercy to David, his anointed: and to his seed for ever. Psalms Chapter 18 Coeli enarrant. The works of God shew forth his glory: his law is greatly to be esteemed and loved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end. A Psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The heavens shew forth the glory of God, and the firmament declareth the work of his hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Day to day uttereth speech, and night to night sheweth knowledge.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There are no speeches nor languages, where their voices are not heard.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their sound hath gone forth into all the earth: and their words unto the ends of the world.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath set his tabernacle in the sun: and he as a bridegroom coming out of his bridechamber, Hath rejoiced as a giant to run the way:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His going out is from the end of heaven, And his circuit even to the end thereof: and there is no one that can hide himself from his heat.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The law of the Lord is unspotted, converting souls: the testimony of the Lord is faithful, giving wisdom to little ones.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The justices of the Lord are right, rejoicing hearts: the commandment of the Lord is lightsome, enlightening the eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The fear of the Lord is holy, enduring for ever and ever: the judgments of the Lord are true, justified in themselves.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: More to be desired than gold and many precious stones: and sweeter than honey and the honeycomb.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy servant keepeth them, and in keeping them there is a great reward.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who can understand sins? from my secret ones cleanse me, O Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And from those of others spare thy servant. If they shall have no dominion over me, then shall I be without spot: and I shall be cleansed from the greatest sin.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the words of my mouth shall be such as may please: and the meditation of my heart always in thy sight. O Lord, my helper and my Redeemer. Psalms Chapter 19 Exaudiat te Dominus. A prayer for the king.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end. A psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the Lord hear thee in the day of tribulation: may the name of the God of Jacob protect thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May he send thee help from the sanctuary: and defend thee out of Sion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May he be mindful of all thy sacrifices: and may thy whole burntoffering be made fat.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May he give thee according to thy own heart; and confirm all thy counsels.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We will rejoice in thy salvation; and in the name of our God we shall be exalted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord fulfil all thy petitions: now have I known that the Lord hath saved his anointed. He will hear him from his holy heaven: the salvation of his right hand is in powers. The salvation of his right hand is in powers.... That is, in strength. His right hand is strong and mighty to save them that trust in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will call upon the name of the Lord, our God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They are bound, and have fallen: but we are risen, and are set upright. O Lord, save the king: and hear us in the day that we shall call upon thee. Psalms Chapter 20 Domine, in virtute. Praise to God for Christ’s exaltation after his passion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end. A psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In thy strength, O Lord, the king shall joy; and in thy salvation he shall rejoice exceedingly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire: and hast not withholden from him the will of his lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast prevented him with blessings of sweetness: thou hast set on his head a crown of precious stones.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He asked life of thee: and thou hast given him length of days for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His glory is great in thy salvation: glory and great beauty shalt thou lay upon him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou shalt give him to be a blessing for ever and ever: thou shalt make him joyful in gladness with thy countenance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the king hopeth in the Lord: and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let thy hand be found by all thy enemies: let thy right hand find out all them that hate thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt make them as an oven of fire, in the time of thy anger: the Lord shall trouble them in his wrath, and fire shall devour them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth: and their seed from among the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For they have intended evils against thee: they have devised counsels which they have not been able to establish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou shalt make them turn their back: in thy remnants thou shalt prepare their face. In thy remnants thou shalt prepare their face.... Or thou shalt set thy remnants against their faces. That is, thou shalt make them see what punishments remain for them hereafter from thy justice. Instead of remnants, St. Jerome renders it funes, that is, cords or strings, viz., of the bow of divine justice, from which God directs his arrows against the faces of his enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be thou exalted, O Lord, in thy own strength: we will sing and praise thy power. Psalms Chapter 21 Deus Deus meus. Christ’s passion: and the conversion of the Gentiles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the morning protection, a psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God my God, look upon me: why hast thou forsaken me? Far from my salvation are the words of my sins. The words of my sins.... That is, the sins of the world, which I have taken upon myself, cry out against me, and are the cause of all my sufferings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O my God, I shall cry by day, and thou wilt not hear: and by night, and it shall not be reputed as folly in me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou dwellest in the holy place, the praise of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In thee have our fathers hoped: they have hoped, and thou hast delivered them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They cried to thee, and they were saved: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I am a worm, and no man: the reproach of men, and the outcast of the people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All they that saw me have laughed me to scorn: they have spoken with the lips, and wagged the head.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hoped in the Lord, let him deliver him: let him save him, seeing he delighteth in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou art he that hast drawn me out of the womb: my hope from the breasts of my mother.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I was cast upon thee from the womb. From my mother’s womb thou art my God,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Depart not from me. For tribulation is very near: for there is none to help me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many calves have surrounded me: fat bulls have besieged me. 21:14.They have opened their mouths against me, as a lion ravening and roaring.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am poured out like water; and all my bones are scattered. My heart is become like wax melting in the midst of my bowels.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue hath cleaved to my jaws: and thou hast brought me down into the dust of death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For many dogs have encompassed me: the council of the malignant hath besieged me. They have dug my hands and feet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have numbered all my bones. And they have looked and stared upon me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They parted my garments amongst them; and upon my vesture they cast lots.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou, O Lord, remove not thy help to a distance from me; look towards my defence.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver, O God, my soul from the sword: my only one from the hand of the dog.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Save me from the lion’s mouth; and my lowness from the horns of the unicorns.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will declare thy name to my brethren: in the midst of the church will I praise thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ye that fear the Lord, praise him: all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all the seed of Israel fear him: because he hath not slighted nor despised the supplication of the poor man. Neither hath he turned away his face from me: and when I cried to him he heard me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With thee is my praise in a great church: I will pay my vows in the sight of them that fear him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The poor shall eat and shall be filled: and they shall praise the Lord that seek him: their hearts shall live for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the ends of the earth shall remember, and shall be converted to the Lord: And all the kindreds of the Gentiles shall adore in his sight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the kingdom is the Lord’s; and he shall have dominion over the nations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the fat ones of the earth have eaten and have adored: all they that go down to the earth shall fall before him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And to him my soul shall live: and my seed shall serve him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There shall be declared to the Lord a generation to come: and the heavens shall shew forth his justice to a people that shall be born, which the Lord hath made. Psalms Chapter 22 Dominus regit me. God’s spiritual benefits to faithful souls.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David. The Lord ruleth me: and I shall want nothing. Ruleth me.... In Hebrew, Is my shepherd, viz., to feed, guide, and govern me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath set me in a place of pasture. He hath brought me up, on the water of refreshment:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath converted my soul. He hath led me on the paths of justice, for his own name’s sake.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For though I should walk in the midst of the shadow of death, I will fear no evils, for thou art with me. Thy rod and thy staff, they have comforted me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast prepared a table before me against them that afflict me. Thou hast anointed my head with oil; and my chalice which inebriateth me, how goodly is it!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thy mercy will follow me all the days of my life. And that I may dwell in the house of the Lord unto length of days. Psalms Chapter 23 Domini est terra. Who are they that shall ascend to heaven: Christ’s triumphant ascension thither.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: On the first day of the week, a psalm for David. The earth is the Lord’s and the fulness thereof: the world, and all they that dwell therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath founded it upon the seas; and hath prepared it upon the rivers.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who shall ascend into the mountain of the Lord: or who shall stand in his holy place?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The innocent in hands, and clean of heart, who hath not taken his soul in vain, nor sworn deceitfully to his neighbour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall receive a blessing from the Lord, and mercy from God his Saviour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is the generation of them that seek him, of them that seek the face of the God of Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lift up your gates, O ye princes, and be ye lifted up, O eternal gates: and the King of Glory shall enter in.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is this King of Glory? the Lord who is strong and mighty: the Lord mighty in battle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lift up your gates, O ye princes, and be ye lifted up, O eternal gates: and the King of Glory shall enter in.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is this King of Glory? the Lord of hosts, he is the King of Glory. Psalms Chapter 24 Ad te, Domine, levavi. A prayer for grace, mercy, and protection against our enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David. To thee, O Lord, have I lifted up my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In thee, O my God, I put my trust; let me not be ashamed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Neither let my enemies laugh at me: for none of them that wait on thee shall be confounded.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all them be confounded that act unjust things without cause. Shew, O Lord, thy ways to me, and teach me thy paths.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Direct me in thy truth, and teach me; for thou art God my Saviour; and on thee have I waited all the day long.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember, O Lord, thy bowels of compassion; and thy mercies that are from the beginning of the world.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sins of my youth and my ignorances do not remember. According to thy mercy remember thou me: for thy goodness’ sake, O Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is sweet and righteous: therefore he will give a law to sinners in the way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will guide the mild in judgment: he will teach the meek his ways.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the ways of the Lord are mercy and truth, to them that seek after his covenant and his testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy name’s sake, O Lord, thou wilt pardon my sin: for it is great.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is the man that feareth the Lord? He hath appointed him a law in the way he hath chosen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His soul shall dwell in good things: and his seed shall inherit the land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is a firmament to them that fear him: and his covenant shall be made manifest to them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eyes are ever towards the Lord: for he shall pluck my feet out of the snare.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Look thou upon me, and have mercy on me; for I am alone and poor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The troubles of my heart are multiplied: deliver me from my necessities.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: See my abjection and my labour; and forgive me all my sins.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Consider my enemies for they are multiplied, and have hated me with an unjust hatred.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Keep thou my soul, and deliver me: I shall not be ashamed, for I have hoped in thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The innocent and the upright have adhered to me: because I have waited on thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver Israel, O God, from all his tribulations. Psalms Chapter 25 Judica me, Domine. David’s prayer to God in his distress, to be delivered, that he may come to worship him in his tabernacle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David. Judge me, O Lord, for I have walked in my innocence: and I have put my trust in the Lord, and shall not be weakened.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Prove me, O Lord, and try me; burn my reins and my heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy mercy is before my eyes; and I am well pleased with thy truth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have not sat with the council of vanity: neither will I go in with the doers of unjust things.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have hated the assembly of the malignant; and with the wicked I will not sit.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will wash my hands among the innocent; and will compass thy altar, O Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That I may hear the voice of thy praise: and tell of all thy wondrous works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have loved, O Lord, the beauty of thy house; and the place where thy glory dwelleth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Take not away my soul, O God, with the wicked: nor my life with bloody men:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In whose hands are iniquities: their right hand is filled with gifts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But as for me, I have walked in my innocence: redeem me, and have mercy on me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My foot hath stood in the direct way: in the churches I will bless thee, O Lord. Psalms Chapter 26 Dominus illuminatio. David’s faith and hope in God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The psalm of David before he was anointed. The Lord is my light and my salvation, whom shall I fear? The Lord is the protector of my life: of whom shall I be afraid?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Whilst the wicked draw near against me, to eat my flesh. My enemies that trouble me, have themselves been weakened, and have fallen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If armies in camp should stand together against me, my heart shall not fear. If a battle should rise up against me, in this will I be confident.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: One thing I have asked of the Lord, this will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life. That I may see the delight of the Lord, and may visit his temple.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath hidden me in his tabernacle; in the day of evils, he hath protected me in the secret place of his tabernacle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath exalted me upon a rock: and now he hath lifted up my head above my enemies. I have gone round, and have offered up in his tabernacle a sacrifice of jubilation: I will sing, and recite a psalm to the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear, O Lord, my voice, with which I have cried to thee: have mercy on me and hear me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My heart hath said to thee: My face hath sought thee: thy face, O Lord, will I still seek.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn not away thy face from me; decline not in thy wrath from thy servant. Be thou my helper, forsake me not; do not thou despise me, O God my Saviour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my father and my mother have left me: but the Lord hath taken me up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Set me, O Lord, a law in thy way, and guide me in the right path, because of my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver me not over to the will of them that trouble me; for unjust witnesses have risen up against me; and iniquity hath lied to itself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I believe to see the good things of the Lord in the land of the living.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Expect the Lord, do manfully, and let thy heart take courage, and wait thou for the Lord. Psalms Chapter 27 Ad te, Domine, clamabo. David’s prayer that his enemies may not prevail over him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
