Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou, my God, hast heard my prayer: thou hast given an inheritance to them that fear thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou wilt add days to the days of the king: his years even to generation and generation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He abideth for ever in the sight of God: his mercy and truth who shall search?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So will I sing a psalm to thy name for ever and ever: that I may pay my vows from day to day. Psalms Chapter 61 Nonne Deo. The prophet encourageth himself and all others to trust in God, and serve him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for Idithun, a psalm of David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shall not my soul be subject to God? for from him is my salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he is my God and my saviour: he is my protector, I shall be moved no more.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long do you rush in upon a man? you all kill, as if you were thrusting down a leaning wall, and a tottering fence.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But they have thought to cast away my price; I ran in thirst: they blessed with their mouth, but cursed with their heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But be thou, O my soul, subject to God: for from him is my patience.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he is my God and my saviour: he is my helper, I shall not be moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In God is my salvation and my glory: he is the God of my help, and my hope is in God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Trust in him, all ye congregation of people: pour out your hearts before him. God is our helper for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But vain are the sons of men, the sons of men are liars in the balances: that by vanity they may together deceive. Are liars in the balances, etc.... They are so vain and light, that if they are put into the scales, they will be found to be of no weight; and to be mere lies, deceit, and vanity. Or, They are liars in their balances, by weighing things by false weights, and preferring the temporal before the eternal.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Trust not in iniquity, and cover not robberies: if riches abound, set not your heart upon them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God hath spoken once, these two things have I heard, that power belongeth to God,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And mercy to thee, O Lord; for thou wilt render to every man according to his works. Psalms Chapter 62 Deus Deus meus, ad te. The prophet aspireth after God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm of David while he was in the desert of Edom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God, my God, to thee do I watch at break of day. For thee my soul hath thirsted; for thee my flesh, O how many ways!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In a desert land, and where there is no way, and no water: so in the sanctuary have I come before thee, to see thy power and thy glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy mercy is better than lives: thee my lips will praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thus will I bless thee all my life long: and in thy name I will lift up my hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my soul be filled as with marrow and fatness: and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I have remembered thee upon my bed, I will meditate on thee in the morning:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because thou hast been my helper. And I will rejoice under the covert of thy wings:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul hath stuck close to thee: thy right hand hath received me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But they have sought my soul in vain, they shall go into the lower parts of the earth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shall be delivered into the hands of the sword, they shall be the portions of foxes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the king shall rejoice in God, all they shall be praised that swear by him: because the mouth is stopped of them that speak wicked things. Psalms Chapter 63 Exaudi Deus orationem. A prayer in affliction, with confidence in God that he will bring to nought the machinations of persecutors.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear O God, my prayer, when I make supplication to thee: deliver my soul from the fear of the enemy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast protected me from the assembly of the malignant; from the multitude of the workers of iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For they have whetted their tongues like a sword; they have bent their bow a bitter thing,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To shoot in secret the undefiled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They will shoot at him on a sudden, and will not fear: they are resolute in wickedness. They have talked of hiding snares; they have said: Who shall see them?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have searched after iniquities: they have failed in their search. Man shall come to a deep heart: A deep heart.... That is, crafty, subtle, deep projects and designs; which nevertheless shall not succeed; for God shall be exalted in bringing them to nought by his wisdom and power.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And God shall be exalted. The arrows of children are their wounds: The arrows of children are their wounds.... That is, the wounds, stripes, or blows, they seek to inflict upon the just, are but like the weak efforts of children’s arrows, which can do no execution: and their tongues, that is, their speeches against them come to nothing.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And their tongues against them are made weak. All that saw them were troubled;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And every man was afraid. And they declared the works of God, and understood his doings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The just shall rejoice in the Lord, and shall hope in him: and all the upright in heart shall be praised. Psalms Chapter 64 Te decet. God is to be praised in his church, to which all nations shall be called.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To the end, a psalm of David. The canticle of Jeremias and Ezechiel to the people of the captivity, when they began to go out. Of the captivity.... That is, the people of the captivity of Babylon. This is not in the Hebrew, but is found in the ancient translation of the Septuagint.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A hymn, O God, becometh thee in Sion: and a vow shall be paid to thee in Jerusalem.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O hear my prayer: all flesh shall come to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The words of the wicked have prevailed over us: and thou wilt pardon our transgressions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is he whom thou hast chosen and taken to thee: he shall dwell in thy courts. We shall be filled with the good things of thy house; holy is thy temple,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wonderful in justice. Hear us, O God our saviour, who art the hope of all the ends of the earth, and in the sea afar off.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou who preparest the mountains by thy strength, being girded with power:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who troublest the depth of the sea, the noise of its waves. The Gentiles shall be troubled,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they that dwell in the uttermost borders shall be afraid at thy signs: thou shalt make the outgoings of the morning and of the evening to be joyful.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast visited the earth, and hast plentifully watered it; thou hast many ways enriched it. The river of God is filled with water, thou hast prepared their food: for so is its preparation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Fill up plentifully the streams thereof, multiply its fruits; it shall spring up and rejoice in its showers.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt bless the crown of the year of thy goodness: and thy fields shall be filled with plenty.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The beautiful places of the wilderness shall grow fat: and the hills shall be girded about with joy,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The rams of the flock are clothed, and the vales shall abound with corn: they shall shout, yea they shall sing a hymn. Psalms Chapter 65 Jubilate Deo. An invitation to praise God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a canticle of a psalm of the resurrection. Shout with joy to God, all the earth,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing ye a psalm to his name; give glory to his praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Say unto God, How terrible are thy works, O Lord! in the multitude of thy strength thy enemies shall lie to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all the earth adore thee, and sing to thee: let it sing a psalm to thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Come and see the works of God; who is terrible in his counsels over the sons of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who turneth the sea into dry land, in the river they shall pass on foot: there shall we rejoice in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who by his power ruleth for ever: his eyes behold the nations; let not them that provoke him be exalted in themselves.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O bless our God, ye Gentiles: and make the voice of his praise to be heard.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who hath set my soul to live: and hath not suffered my feet to be moved:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us by fire, as silver is tried.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast brought us into a net, thou hast laid afflictions on our back:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast set men over our heads. We have passed through fire and water, and thou hast brought us out into a refreshment.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Which my lips have uttered, And my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will offer up to thee holocausts full of marrow, with burnt offerings of rams: I will offer to thee bullocks with goats.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will tell you what great things he hath done for my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I cried to him with my mouth: and I extolled him with my tongue.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I have looked at iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore hath God heard me, and hath attended to the voice of my supplication.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be God, who hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me. Psalms Chapter 66 Deus misereatur. A prayer for the propagation of the church.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, in hymns, a psalm of a canticle for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May God have mercy on us, and bless us: may he cause the light of his countenance to shine upon us, and may he have mercy on us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That we may know thy way upon earth: thy salvation in all nations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let people confess to thee, O God: let all people give praise to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the nations be glad and rejoice: for thou judgest the people with justice, and directest the nations upon earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the people, O God, confess to thee: let all the people give praise to thee:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The earth hath yielded her fruit. May God, our God bless us,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May God bless us: and all the ends of the earth fear him. Psalms Chapter 67 Exurgat Deus. The glorious establishment of the church of the New Testament, prefigured by the benefits bestowed on the people of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm of a canticle for David himself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let God arise, and let his enemies be scattered: and let them that hate him flee from before his face.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As smoke vanisheth, so let them vanish away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let the just feast, and rejoice before God: and be delighted with gladness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing ye to God, sing a psalm to his name, make a way for him who ascendeth upon the west: the Lord is his name. Rejoice ye before him: but the wicked shall be troubled at his presence, Who ascendeth upon the west.... Super occasum. St. Gregory understands it of Christ, who after his going down, like the sun, in the west, by his passion and death, ascended more glorious, and carried all before him. St. Jerome renders it, who ascendeth, or cometh up, through the deserts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is the father of orphans, and the judge of widows. God in his holy place:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God who maketh men of one manner to dwell in a house: Who bringeth out them that were bound in strength; in like manner them that provoke, that dwell in sepulchres. Of one manner.... That is, agreeing in faith, unanimous in love, and following the same manner of discipline. It is verified in the servants of God, living together in his house, which is the church. 1 Tim. 3.15.—Ibid. Them that were bound, etc.... The power and mercy of God appears in his bringing out of their captivity those that were strongly bound in their sins: and in restoring to his grace those whose behaviour had been most provoking; and who by their evil habits were not only dead, but buried in their sepulchres.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God, when thou didst go forth in the sight of thy people, when thou didst pass through the desert:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The earth was moved, and the heavens dropped at the presence of the God of Sina, at the presence of the God of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt set aside for thy inheritance a free rain, O God: and it was weakened, but thou hast made it perfect. A free rain.... the manna, which rained plentifully from heaven, in favour of God’s inheritance, that is, of his people Israel: which was weakened indeed under a variety of afflictions, but was made perfect by God; that is, was still supported by divine providence, and brought on to the promised land. It agrees particularly to the church of Christ his true inheritance, which is plentifully watered with the free rain of heavenly grace; and through many infirmities, that is, crosses and tribulations, is made perfect, and fitted for eternal glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In it shall thy animals dwell; in thy sweetness, O God, thou hast provided for the poor. In it, etc.... That is, in this church, which is thy fold and thy inheritance, shall thy animals, thy sheep, dwell: where thou hast plentifully provided for them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord shall give the word to them that preach good tidings with great power. To them that preach good tidings.... Evangelizantibus. That is, to the preachers of the gospel; who receiving the word from the Lord, shall with great power and efficacy preach throughout the world the glad tidings of a Saviour, and of eternal salvation through him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The king of powers is of the beloved, of the beloved; and the beauty of the house shall divide spoils. The king of powers.... That is, the mighty King, the Lord of hosts, is of the beloved, of the beloved; that is, is on the side of Christ, his most beloved son: and his beautiful house, viz., the church, in which God dwells forever, shall by her spiritual conquests divide the spoils of many nations. The Hebrew (as it now stands pointed) is thus rendered, The kings of armies have fled, they have fled, and she that dwells at home (or the beauty of the house) shall divide the spoils.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If you sleep among the midst of lots, you shall be as the wings of a dove covered with silver, and the hinder parts of her back with the paleness of gold. If you sleep among the midst of lots (intermedios cleros, etc.)... Viz., in such dangers and persecutions, as if your enemies were casting lots for your goods and persons: or in the midst of the lots, (intermedios terminos, as St. Jerome renders it,) that is, upon the very bounds or borders of the dominions of your enemies: you shall be secure nevertheless under the divine protection; and shall be enabled to fly away, like a dove, with glittering wings and feathers shining like the palest and most precious gold; that is, with great increase of virtue, and glowing with the fervour of charity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When he that is in heaven appointeth kings over her, they shall be whited with snow in Selmon. Kings over her.... That is, pastors and rulers over his church, viz., the apostles and their successors. Then by their ministry shall men be made whiter than the snow which lies on the top of the high mountain Selmon.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The mountain of God is a fat mountain. A curdled mountain, a fat mountain. The mountain of God.... The church, which, Isa. 2.2, is called The mountain of the house of the Lord upon the top of mountains. It is here called a fat and a curdled mountain; that is to say, most fruitful, and enriched by the spiritual gifts and graces of the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why suspect, ye curdled mountains? A mountain in which God is well pleased to dwell: for there the Lord shall dwell unto the end. Why suspect, ye curdled mountains?.... Why do you suppose or imagine there may be any other such curdled mountains? You are mistaken: the mountain thus favoured by God is but one; and this same he has chosen for his dwelling for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The chariot of God is attended by ten thousands; thousands of them that rejoice: the Lord is among them in Sina, in the holy place. The chariot of God.... Descending to give his law on mount Sina: as also of Jesus Christ his Son, ascending into heaven, to send from thence the Holy Ghost, to publish his new law, is attended with ten thousands, that is, with an innumerable multitude of joyful angels.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive; thou hast received gifts in men. Yea for those also that do not believe, the dwelling of the Lord God. Led captivity captive.... Carrying away with thee to heaven those who before had been the captives of Satan; and receiving from God the Father gifts to be distributed to men; even to those who were before unbelievers.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the Lord day by day: the God of our salvation will make our journey prosperous to us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our God is the God of salvation: and of the Lord, of the Lord are the issues from death. The issues from death.... The Lord alone is master of the issues, by which we may escape from death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But God shall break the heads of his enemies: the hairy crown of them that walk on in their sins.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord said: I will turn them from Basan, I will turn them into the depth of the sea: I will turn them from Basan, etc.... I will cast out my enemies from their rich possessions, signified by Basan, a fruitful country; and I will drive them into the depth of the sea: and make such a slaughter of them, that the feet of my servants may be dyed in their blood, etc.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thy enemies; the tongue of thy dogs be red with the same.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have seen thy goings, O God, the goings of my God: of my king who is in his sanctuary. Thy goings.... Thy ways, thy proceedings, by which thou didst formerly take possession of the promised land in favour of thy people; and shalt afterwards of the whole world, which thou shalt subdue to thy Son.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Princes went before joined with singers, in the midst of young damsels playing on timbrels. Princes.... The apostles, the first converters of nations; attended by numbers of perfect souls, singing the divine praises, and virgins consecrated to God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the churches bless ye God the Lord, from the fountains of Israel. From the fountains of Israel.... From whom both Christ and his apostles sprung. By Benjamin, the holy fathers on this place understand St. Paul, who was of that tribe, named here a youth, because he was the last called to the apostleship. By the princes of Juda, Zabulon, and Nephthali, we may understand the other apostles, who were of the tribe of Juda; or of the tribes of Zabulon, and Nephthali, where our Lord began to preach, Matt. 4.13, etc.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There is Benjamin a youth, in ecstasy of mind. The princes of Juda are their leaders: the princes of Zabulon, the princes of Nephthali.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Command thy strength, O God confirm, O God, what thou hast wrought in us. Command thy strength.... Give orders that thy strength may be always with us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From thy temple in Jerusalem, kings shall offer presents to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Rebuke the wild beasts of the reeds, the congregation of bulls with the kine of the people; who seek to exclude them who are tried with silver. Scatter thou the nations that delight in wars: Rebuke the wild beasts of the reeds.... or the wild beasts, which lie hid in the reeds. That is, the devils, who hide themselves in order to surprise their prey. Or by wild beasts, are here understood persecutors, who, for all their attempts against the Church, are but as weak reeds, which cannot prevail against them who are supported by the strength of the Almighty. The same are also called the congregation of bulls (from their rage against the Church) who assemble together all their kine, that is, the people their subjects, to exclude if they can, from Christ and his inheritance, his constant confessors, who are like silver tried by fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ambassadors shall come out of Egypt: Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands to God. Ambassadors shall come, etc.... It is a prophecy of the conversion of the Gentiles, and by name of the Egyptians and Ethiopians.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing to God, ye kingdoms of the earth: sing ye to the Lord: Sing ye to God,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who mounteth above the heaven of heavens, to the east. Behold he will give to his voice the voice of power: To the east.... From mount Olivet, which is on the east side of Jerusalem.—Ibid. The voice of power.... That is, he will make his voice to be a powerful voice: by calling from death to life, such as were dead in mortal sin: as at the last day he will by the power of his voice call all the dead from their graves.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give ye glory to God for Israel, his magnificence, and his power is in the clouds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God is wonderful in his saints: the God of Israel is he who will give power and strength to his people. Blessed be God. Psalms Chapter 68 Salvum me fac, Deus. Christ in his passion declareth the greatness of his sufferings, and the malice of his persecutors the Jews; and foretelleth their reprobation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for them that shall be changed; for David. For them that shall be changed.... A psalm for Christian converts, to remember the passion of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Save me, O God: for the waters are come in even unto my soul. The waters.... Of afflictions and sorrows. My soul is sorrowful even unto death. Matt. 26.38.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I stick fast in the mire of the deep and there is no sure standing. I am come into the depth of the sea, and a tempest hath overwhelmed me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have laboured with crying; my jaws are become hoarse, my eyes have failed, whilst I hope in my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They are multiplied above the hairs of my head, who hate me without cause. My enemies are grown strong who have wrongfully persecuted me: then did I pay that which I took not away. I pay that which I took not away.... Christ in his passion made restitution of what he had not taken away, by suffering the punishment due to our sins, and so repairing the injury we had done to God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my offences are not hidden from thee: My foolishness and my offences.... which my enemies impute to me: or the follies and sins of men, which I have taken upon myself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let not them be ashamed for me, who look for thee, O Lord, the Lord of hosts. Let them not be confounded on my account, who seek thee, O God of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am become a stranger to my brethren, and an alien to the sons of my mother.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the zeal of thy house hath eaten me up: and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I covered my soul in fasting: and it was made a reproach to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I made haircloth my garment: and I became a byword to them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that sat in the gate spoke against me: and they that drank wine made me their song.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But as for me, my prayer is to thee, O Lord; for the time of thy good pleasure, O God. In the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Draw me out of the mire, that I may not stick fast: deliver me from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let not the tempest of water drown me, nor the deep water swallow me up: and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear me, O Lord, for thy mercy is kind; look upon me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And turn not away thy face from thy servant: for I am in trouble, hear me speedily.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Attend to my soul, and deliver it: save me because of my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou knowest my reproach, and my confusion, and my shame.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In thy sight are all they that afflict me; my heart hath expected reproach and misery. And I looked for one that would grieve together with me, but there was none: and for one that would comfort me, and I found none.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they gave me gall for my food, and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let their table become as a snare before them, and a recompense, and a stumblingblock. Let their table, etc.... What here follows in the style of an imprecation, is a prophecy of the wretched state to which the Jews should be reduced in punishment of their wilful obstinacy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let their eyes be darkened that they see not; and their back bend thou down always.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Pour out thy indignation upon them: and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let their habitation be made desolate: and let there be none to dwell in their tabernacles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because they have persecuted him whom thou hast smitten; and they have added to the grief of my wounds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Add thou iniquity upon their iniquity: and let them not come into thy justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living; and with the just let them not be written.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I am poor and sorrowful: thy salvation, O God, hath set me up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise the name of God with a canticle: and I will magnify him with praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And it shall please God better than a young calf, that bringeth forth horns and hoofs.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the poor see and rejoice: seek ye God, and your soul shall live.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord hath heard the poor: and hath not despised his prisoners.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the heavens and the earth praise him; the sea, and every thing that creepeth therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For God will save Sion, and the cities of Juda shall be built up. And they shall dwell there, and acquire it by inheritance. Sion.... The catholic church. The cities of Juda, etc., her places of worship, which shall be established throughout the world. And there, viz., in this church of Christ, shall his servants dwell, etc.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the seed of his servants shall possess it; and they that love his name shall dwell therein. Psalms Chapter 69 Deus in adjutorium. A prayer in persecution.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David, to bring to remembrance that the Lord saved him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God, come to my assistance; O Lord, make haste to help me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them be confounded and ashamed that seek my soul:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them be turned backward, and blush for shame that desire evils to me: Let them be presently turned away blushing for shame that say to me: ’Tis well, ’tis well. ’Tis well, ’tis well.... Euge, euge. St. Jerome renders it, vah, vah! which is the voice of one insulting and deriding. Some understand it as a detestation of deceitful flatterers.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee; and let such as love thy salvation say always: The Lord be magnified.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I am needy and poor; O God, help me. Thou art my helper and my deliverer: O lord, make no delay. Psalms Chapter 70 In te, Domine. A prayer for perseverance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David. Of the sons of Jonadab, and the former captives. In thee, O Lord, I have hoped, let me never be put to confusion: Of the sons of Jonadab.... The Rechabites, of whom see Jer. 35. By this addition of the seventy-two interpreters, we gather that this psalm was usually sung in the synagogue, in the person of the Rechabites, and of those who were first carried away into captivity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver me in thy justice, and rescue me. Incline thy ear unto me, and save me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be thou unto me a God, a protector, and a place of strength: that thou mayst make me safe. For thou art my firmament and my refuge.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the sinner, and out of the hand of the transgressor of the law and of the unjust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou art my patience, O Lord: my hope, O Lord, from my youth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By thee have I been confirmed from the womb: from my mother’s womb thou art my protector. Of thee I shall continually sing:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am become unto many as a wonder, but thou art a strong helper.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my mouth be filled with praise, that I may sing thy glory; thy greatness all the day long.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Cast me not off in the time of old age: when my strength shall fail, do not thou forsake me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my enemies have spoken against me; and they that watched my soul have consulted together,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Saying: God hath forsaken him: pursue and take him, for there is none to deliver him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God, be not thou far from me: O my God, make haste to my help.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them be confounded and come to nothing that detract my soul; let them be covered with confusion and shame that seek my hurt.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I will always hope; and will add to all thy praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My mouth shall shew forth thy justice; thy salvation all the day long. Because I have not known learning, Learning.... As much as to say, I build not upon human learning, but only on the power and justice of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will enter into the powers of the Lord: O Lord, I will be mindful of thy justice alone.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast taught me, O God, from my youth: and till now I will declare thy wonderful works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And unto old age and grey hairs: O God, forsake me not, Until I shew forth thy arm to all the generation that is to come: Thy power,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thy justice, O God, even to the highest great things thou hast done: O God, who is like to thee?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How great troubles hast thou shewn me, many and grievous: and turning thou hast brought me to life, and hast brought me back again from the depths of the earth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast multiplied thy magnificence; and turning to me thou hast comforted me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I will also confess to thee thy truth with the instruments of psaltery: O God, I will sing to thee with the harp, thou holy one of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My lips shall greatly rejoice, when I shall sing to thee; and my soul which thou hast redeemed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Yea and my tongue shall meditate on thy justice all the day; when they shall be confounded and put to shame that seek evils to me. Psalms Chapter 71 Deus, judicium tuum. A prophecy of the coming of Christ, and of his kingdom: prefigured by Solomon and his happy reign.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm on Solomon.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give to the king thy judgment, O God, and to the king’s son thy justice: To judge thy people with justice, and thy poor with judgment.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the mountains receive peace for the people: and the hills justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall judge the poor of the people, and he shall save the children of the poor: and he shall humble the oppressor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall continue with the sun and before the moon, throughout all generations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall come down like rain upon the fleece; and as showers falling gently upon the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In his days shall justice spring up, and abundance of peace, till the moon be taken away.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall rule from sea to sea, and from the river unto the ends of the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Before him the Ethiopians shall fall down: and his enemies shall lick the ground.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The kings of Tharsis and the islands shall offer presents: the kings of the Arabians and of Saba shall bring gifts:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And all kings of the earth shall adore him: all nations shall serve him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he shall deliver the poor from the mighty: and the needy that had no helper.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall spare the poor and needy: and he shall save the souls of the poor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall redeem their souls from usuries and iniquity: and their names shall be honourable in his sight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Arabia, for him they shall always adore: they shall bless him all the day.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And there shall be a firmament on the earth on the tops of mountains, above Libanus shall the fruit thereof be exalted: and they of the city shall flourish like the grass of the earth. A firmament on the earth, etc.... This may be understood of the church of Christ, ever firm and visible: and of the flourishing condition of its congregation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let his name be blessed for evermore: his name continueth before the sun. And in him shall all the tribes of the earth be blessed: all nations shall magnify him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who alone doth wonderful things.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And blessed be the name of his majesty for ever: and the whole earth shall be filled with his majesty. So be it. So be it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The praises of David, the son of Jesse, are ended. Are ended.... By this it appears that this psalm, though placed here, was in order of time the last of those which David composed. Psalms Chapter 72 Quam bonus Israel Deus. The temptation of the weak, upon seeing the prosperity of the wicked, is overcome by the consideration of the justice of God, who will quickly render to every one according to his works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for Asaph. How good is God to Israel, to them that are of a right heart!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But my feet were almost moved; my steps had well nigh slipped.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because I had a zeal on occasion of the wicked, seeing the prosperity of sinners.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For there is no regard to their death, nor is there strength in their stripes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They are not in the labour of men: neither shall they be scourged like other men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore pride hath held them fast: they are covered with their iniquity and their wickedness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their iniquity hath come forth, as it were from fatness: they have passed into the affection of the heart. Fatness.... Abundance and temporal prosperity, which hath encouraged them in their iniquity: and made them give themselves up to their irregular affections.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have thought and spoken wickedness: they have spoken iniquity on high.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have set their mouth against heaven: and their tongue hath passed through the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore will my people return here and full days shall be found in them. Return here.... or hither. The weak among the servants of God, will be apt often to return to this thought, and will be shocked when they consider the full days, that is, the long and prosperous life of the wicked; and will be tempted to make the reflections against providence which are set down in the following verses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they said: How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold these are sinners; and yet, abounding in the world they have obtained riches.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I said: Then have I in vain justified my heart, and washed my hands among the innocent.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I have been scourged all the day; and my chastisement hath been in the mornings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I said: I will speak thus; behold I should condemn the generation of thy children. If I said, etc.... That is, if I should indulge such thoughts as these.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I studied that I might know this thing, it is a labour in my sight:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Until I go into the sanctuary of God, and understand concerning their last ends.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But indeed for deceits thou hast put it to them: when they were lifted up thou hast cast them down. Thou hast put it to them.... In punishment of their deceits, or for deceiving them, thou hast brought evils upon them in their last end, which, in their prosperity they never apprehended.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How are they brought to desolation? they have suddenly ceased to be: they have perished by reason of their iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As the dream of them that awake, O Lord; so in thy city thou shalt bring their image to nothing.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my heart hath been inflamed, and my reins have been changed:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I am brought to nothing, and I knew not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am become as a beast before thee: and I am always with thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast held me by my right hand; and by thy will thou hast conducted me, and with thy glory thou hast received me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For what have I in heaven? and besides thee what do I desire upon earth?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thee my flesh and my heart hath fainted away: thou art the God of my heart, and the God that is my portion for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For behold they that go far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that are disloyal to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But it is good for me to adhere to my God, to put my hope in the Lord God: That I may declare all thy praises, in the gates of the daughter of Sion. Psalms Chapter 73 Ut quid, Deus. A prayer of the church under grievous persecutions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Understanding for Asaph. O God, why hast thou cast us off unto the end: why is thy wrath enkindled against the sheep of thy pasture?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast possessed from the beginning. The sceptre of thy inheritance which thou hast redeemed: mount Sion in which thou hast dwelt.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lift up thy hands against their pride unto the end; see what things the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they that hate thee have made their boasts, in the midst of thy solemnity. They have set up their ensigns for signs, Their ensigns, etc.... They have fixed their colours for signs and trophies, both on the gates, and on the highest top of the temple: and they knew not, that is, they regarded not the sanctity of the place. This psalm manifestly foretells the time of the Machabees, and the profanation of the temple by Antiochus.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they knew not both in the going out and on the highest top. As with axes in a wood of trees,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have cut down at once the gates thereof, with axe and hatchet they have brought it down.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have set fire to thy sanctuary: they have defiled the dwelling place of thy name on the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They said in their heart, the whole kindred of them together: Let us abolish all the festival days of God from the land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our signs we have not seen, there is now no prophet: and he will know us no more.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long, O God, shall the enemy reproach: is the adversary to provoke thy name for ever?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why dost thou turn away thy hand: and thy right hand out of the midst of thy bosom for ever?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But God is our king before ages: he hath wrought salvation in the midst of the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou by thy strength didst make the sea firm: thou didst crush the heads of the dragons in the waters. The sea firm.... By making the waters of the Red Sea stand like firm walls, whilst Israel passed through: and destroying the Egyptians called here dragons from their cruelty, in the same waters, with their king: casting up their bodies on the shore to be stripped by the Ethiopians inhabiting in those days the coast of Arabia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast broken the heads of the dragon: thou hast given him to be meat for the people of the Ethiopians.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast broken up the fountains and the torrents: thou hast dried up the Ethan rivers. Ethan rivers.... That is, rivers which run with strong streams. This was verified in Jordan, Jos. 3, and in Arnon, Num. 21.14.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thine is the day, and thine is the night: thou hast made the morning light and the sun.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast made all the borders of the earth: the summer and the spring were formed by thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember this, the enemy hath reproached the Lord: and a foolish people hath provoked thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver not up to beasts the souls that confess to thee: and forget not to the end the souls of thy poor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have regard to thy covenant: for they that are the obscure of the earth have been filled with dwellings of iniquity. The obscure of the earth.... Mean and ignoble wretches have been filled, that is, enriched, with houses of iniquity, that is, with our estates and possessions, which they have unjustly acquired.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let not the humble be turned away with confusion: the poor and needy shall praise thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O God, judge thy own cause: remember thy reproaches with which the foolish man hath reproached thee all the day.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Forget not the voices of thy enemies: the pride of them that hate thee ascendeth continually. Psalms Chapter 74 Confitebimur tibi. There is a just judgment to come: therefore let the wicked take care.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, corrupt not, a psalm of a canticle for Asaph. Corrupt not.... It is believed to have been the beginning of some ode or hymn, to the tune of which this psalm was to be sung. St. Augustine and other fathers take it to be an admonition of the spirit of God, not to faint or fail in our hope: but to persevere with constancy in good: because God will not fail in his due time to render to every man according to his works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We will praise thee, O God: we will praise, and we will call upon thy name. We will relate thy wondrous works:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When I shall take a time, I will judge justices. When I shall take a time.... In proper times: particularly at the last day, when the earth shall melt away at the presence of the great Judge: the same who originally laid the foundations of it, and as it were established its pillars.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The earth is melted, and all that dwell therein: I have established the pillars thereof.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I said to the wicked: Do not act wickedly: and to the sinners: Lift not up the horn.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lift not up your horn on high: speak not iniquity against God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the desert hills:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For God is the judge. One he putteth down, and another he lifteth up:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For in the hand of the Lord there is a cup of strong wine full of mixture. And he hath poured it out from this to that: but the dregs thereof are not emptied: all the sinners of the earth shall drink.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I will declare for ever: I will sing to the God of Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I will break all the horns of sinners: but the horns of the just shall be exalted. Psalms Chapter 75 Notus in Judaea. God is known in his church: and exerts his power in protecting it. It alludes to the slaughter of the Assyrians, in the days of king Ezechias.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, in praises, a psalm for Asaph: a canticle to the Assyrians.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In Judea God is known: his name is great in Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And his place is in peace: and his abode in Sion:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There hath he broken the powers of bows, the shield, the sword, and the battle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou enlightenest wonderfully from the everlasting hills.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the foolish of heart were troubled. They have slept their sleep; and all the men of riches have found nothing in their hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, they have all slumbered that mounted on horseback.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art terrible, and who shall resist thee? from that time thy wrath. From that time, etc.... From the time that thy wrath shall break out.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast caused judgment to be heard from heaven: the earth trembled and was still,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When God arose in judgment, to save all the meek of the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the thought of man shall give praise to thee: and the remainders of the thought shall keep holiday to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Vow ye, and pay to the Lord your God: all you that are round about him bring presents. To him that is terrible,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Even to him who taketh away the spirit of princes: to the terrible with the kings of the earth. Psalms Chapter 76 Voce mea. The faithful have recourse to God in trouble of mind, with confidence in his mercy and power.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for Idithun, a psalm of Asaph.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I cried to the Lord with my voice; to God with my voice, and he gave ear to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the day of my trouble I sought God, with my hands lifted up to him in the night, and I was not deceived. My soul refused to be comforted:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I remembered God, and was delighted, and was exercised, and my spirit swooned away.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eyes prevented the watches: I was troubled, and I spoke not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I thought upon the days of old: and I had in my mind the eternal years.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I meditated in the night with my own heart: and I was exercised and I swept my spirit.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Will God then cast off for ever? or will he never be more favourable again?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Or will he cut off his mercy for ever, from generation to generation?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Or will God forget to shew mercy? or will he in his anger shut up his mercies?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I said, Now have I begun: this is the change of the right hand of the most High.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I remembered the works of the Lord: for I will be mindful of thy wonders from the beginning.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I will meditate on all thy works: and will be employed in thy inventions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy way, O God, is in the holy place: who is the great God like our God?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art the God that dost wonders. Thou hast made thy power known among the nations:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With thy arm thou hast redeemed thy people the children of Jacob and of Joseph.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee: and they were afraid, and the depths were troubled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Great was the noise of the waters: the clouds sent out a sound. For thy arrows pass:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The voice of thy thunder in a wheel. Thy lightnings enlightened the world: the earth shook and trembled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy way is in the sea, and thy paths in many waters: and thy footsteps shall not be known.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast conducted thy people like sheep, by the hand of Moses and Aaron. Psalms Chapter 77 Attendite. God’s great benefits to the people of Israel, notwithstanding their ingratitude.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Understanding for Asaph. Attend, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will open my mouth in parables: I will utter propositions from the beginning. Propositions.... Deep and mysterious sayings. By this it appears that the historical facts of ancient times, commemorated in this psalm, were deep and mysterious: as being figures of great truths appertaining to the time of the New Testament.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How great things have we heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have not been hidden from their children, in another generation. Declaring the praises of the Lord, and his powers, and his wonders which he hath done.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he set up a testimony in Jacob: and made a law in Israel. How great things he commanded our fathers, that they should make the same known to their children:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That another generation might know them. The children that should be born and should rise up, and declare them to their children.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That they may put their hope in God and may not forget the works of God: and may seek his commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That they may not become like their fathers, a perverse and exasperating generation. A generation that set not their heart aright: and whose spirit was not faithful to God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sons of Ephraim who bend and shoot with the bow: they have turned back in the day of battle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They kept not the covenant of God: and in his law they would not walk.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they forgot his benefits, and his wonders that he had shewn them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wonderful things did he do in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Tanis.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He divided the sea and brought them through: and he made the waters to stand as in a vessel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he conducted them with a cloud by day: and all the night with a light of fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He struck the rock in the wilderness: and gave them to drink, as out of the great deep.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He brought forth water out of the rock: and made streams run down as rivers.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they added yet more sin against him: they provoked the most High to wrath in the place without water.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they tempted God in their hearts, by asking meat for their desires.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they spoke ill of God: they said: Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he struck the rock, and the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed. Can he also give bread, or provide a table for his people?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore the Lord heard, and was angry: and a fire was kindled against Jacob, and wrath came up against Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because they believed not in God: and trusted not in his salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he had commanded the clouds from above, and had opened the doors of heaven.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them the bread of heaven.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Man ate the bread of angels: he sent them provisions in abundance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He removed the south wind from heaven: and by his power brought in the south-west wind.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he rained upon them flesh as dust: and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they fell in the midst of their camp, round about their pavilions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So they did eat, and were filled exceedingly, and he gave them their desire:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: they were not defrauded of that which they craved. As yet their meat was in their mouth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the wrath of God came upon them. And he slew the fat ones amongst them, and brought down the chosen men of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In all these things they sinned still: and they believed not for his wondrous works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And their days were consumed in vanity, and their years in haste.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned, and came to him early in the morning.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they remembered that God was their helper: and the most high God their redeemer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they loved him with their mouth: and with their tongue they lied unto him:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But their heart was not right with him: nor were they counted faithful in his covenant.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But he is merciful, and will forgive their sins: and will not destroy them. And many a time did he turn away his anger: and did not kindle all his wrath.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he remembered that they are flesh: a wind that goeth and returneth not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How often did they provoke him in the desert: and move him to wrath in the place without water?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they turned back and tempted God: and grieved the holy one of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They remembered not his hand, in the day that he redeemed them from the hand of him that afflicted them:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How he wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Tanis.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he turned their rivers into blood, and their showers that they might not drink.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent amongst them divers sorts of flies, which devoured them: and frogs which destroyed them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he gave up their fruits to the blast, and their labours to the locust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he destroyed their vineyards with hail, and their mulberry trees with hoarfrost.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he gave up their cattle to the hail, and their stock to the fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he sent upon them the wrath of his indignation: indignation and wrath and trouble, which he sent by evil angels.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He made a way for a path to his anger: he spared not their souls from death, and their cattle he shut up in death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he killed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt: the firstfruits of all their labour in the tabernacles of Cham.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he took away his own people as sheep: and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he brought them out in hope and they feared not: and the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he brought them into the mountain of his sanctuary: the mountain which his right hand had purchased. And he cast out the Gentiles before them: and by lot divided to them their land by a line of distribution.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tabernacles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Yet they tempted, and provoked the most high God: and they kept not his testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they turned away, and kept not the covenant: even like their fathers they were turned aside as a crooked bow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They provoked him to anger on their hills: and moved him to jealousy with their graven things.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God heard, and despised them, and he reduced Israel exceedingly as it were to nothing.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he put away the tabernacle of Silo, his tabernacle where he dwelt among men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he delivered their strength into captivity: and their beauty into the hands of the enemy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shut up his people under the sword: and he despised his inheritance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Fire consumed their young men: and their maidens were not lamented.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their priests fell by the sword: and their widows did not mourn.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Lord was awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that hath been surfeited with wine.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he smote his enemies on the hinder parts: he put them to an everlasting reproach.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he rejected the tabernacle of Joseph: and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But he chose the tribe of Juda, mount Sion which he loved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he built his sanctuary as of unicorns, in the land which he founded for ever. As of unicorns.... That is, firm and strong like the horn of the unicorn. This is one of the chiefest of the propositions of this psalm, foreshewing the firm establishment of the one, true, and everlasting sanctuary of God, in his church.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he chose his servant David, and took him from the flocks of sheep: he brought him from following the ewes great with young,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To feed Jacob his servant and Israel his inheritance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he fed them in the innocence of his heart: and conducted them by the skilfulness of his hands. Psalms Chapter 78 Deus, venerunt gentes. The church in time of persecution prayeth for relief. It seems to belong to the time of the Machabees.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for Asaph. O God, the heathens are come into thy inheritance, they have defiled thy holy temple: they have made Jerusalem as a place to keep fruit.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have given the dead bodies of thy servants to be meat for the fowls of the air: the flesh of thy saints for the beasts of the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have poured out their blood as water, round about Jerusalem and there was none to bury them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We are become a reproach to our neighbours: a scorn and derision to them that are round about us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long, O Lord, wilt thou be angry for ever: shall thy zeal be kindled like a fire?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that have not known thee: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because they have devoured Jacob; and have laid waste his place.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember not our former iniquities: let thy mercies speedily prevent us, for we are become exceeding poor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Help us, O God, our saviour: and for the glory of thy name, O Lord, deliver us: and forgive us our sins for thy name’s sake:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lest they should say among the Gentiles: Where is their God? And let him be made known among the nations before our eyes, By the revenging the blood of thy servants, which hath been shed:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the sighing of the prisoners come in before thee. According to the greatness of thy arm, take possession of the children of them that have been put to death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And render to our neighbours sevenfold in their bosom: the reproach wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But we thy people, and the sheep of thy pasture, will give thanks to thee for ever. We will shew forth thy praise, unto generation and generation. Psalms Chapter 79 Qui regis Israel. A prayer for the church in tribulation, commemorating God’s former favours.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for them that shall be changed, a testimony for Asaph, a psalm.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give ear, O thou that rulest Israel: thou that leadest Joseph like a sheep. Thou that sittest upon the cherubims, shine forth

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasses. Stir up thy might, and come to save us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Convert us, O God: and shew us thy face, and we shall be saved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy servant?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long wilt thou feed us with the bread of tears: and give us for our drink tears in measure?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast made us to be a contradiction to our neighbours: and our enemies have scoffed at us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God of hosts, convert us: and shew thy face, and we shall be saved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast brought a vineyard out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the Gentiles and planted it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou wast the guide of its journey in its sight: thou plantedst the roots thereof, and it filled the land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The shadow of it covered the hills: and the branches thereof the cedars of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It stretched forth its branches unto the sea, and its boughs unto the river.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why hast thou broken down the hedge thereof, so that all they who pass by the way do pluck it?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The boar out of the wood hath laid it waste: and a singular wild beast hath devoured it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn again, O God of hosts, look down from heaven, and see, and visit this vineyard:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And perfect the same which thy right hand hath planted: and upon the son of man whom thou hast confirmed for thyself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Things set on fire and dug down shall perish at the rebuke of thy countenance. Things set on fire, etc.... So this vineyard of thine, almost consumed already, must perish, if thou continue thy rebukes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand: and upon the son of man whom thou hast confirmed for thyself. The man of thy right hand.... Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And we depart not from thee, thou shalt quicken us: and we will call upon thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord God of hosts, convert us and shew thy face, and we shall be saved. Psalms Chapter 80 Exultate Deo. An invitation to a solemn praising of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the winepresses, a psalm for Asaph himself. For the winepresses, etc.... Torcularibus. It either signifies a musical instrument, or that this psalm was to be sung at the feast of the tabernacles after the gathering in of the vintage.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Rejoice to God our helper: sing aloud to the God of Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel: the pleasant psaltery with the harp.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blow up the trumpet on the new moon, on the noted day of your solemnity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For it is a commandment in Israel, and a judgment to the God of Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He ordained it for a testimony in Joseph, when he came out of the land of Egypt: he heard a tongue which he knew not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He removed his back from the burdens: his hands had served in baskets.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou calledst upon me in affliction, and I delivered thee: I heard thee in the secret place of tempest: I proved thee at the waters of contradiction. In the secret place of tempest.... Heb., Of thunder. When thou soughtest to hide thyself from the tempest: or, when I came down to mount Sina, hidden from thy eyes in a storm of thunder.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear, O my people, and I will testify to thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken to me,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: there shall be no new god in thee: neither shalt thou adore a strange god.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I am the Lord thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But my people heard not my voice: and Israel hearkened not to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So I let them go according to the desires of their heart: they shall walk in their own inventions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If my people had heard me: if Israel had walked in my ways:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I should soon have humbled their enemies, and laid my hand on them that troubled them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The enemies of the Lord have lied to him: and their time shall be for ever. Their time shall be forever.... Impenitent sinners shall suffer for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he fed them with the fat of wheat, and filled them with honey out of the rock. Psalms Chapter 81 Deus stetit. An exhortation to judges and men in power.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for Asaph. God hath stood in the congregation of gods: and being in the midst of them he judgeth gods.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long will you judge unjustly: and accept the persons of the wicked?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Judge for the needy and fatherless: do justice to the humble and the poor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Rescue the poor; and deliver the needy out of the hand of the sinner.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have not known nor understood: they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth shall be moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have said: You are gods and all of you the sons of the most High.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But you like men shall die: and shall fall like one of the princes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O God, judge thou the earth: for thou shalt inherit among all the nations. Psalms Chapter 82 Deus, quis similis. A prayer against the enemies of God’s church.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A canticle of a psalm for Asaph.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God, who shall be like to thee? hold not thy peace, neither be thou still, O God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For lo, thy enemies have made a noise: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have taken a malicious counsel against thy people, and have consulted against thy saints.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have said: Come and let us destroy them, so that they be not a nation: and let the name of Israel be remembered no more.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For they have contrived with one consent: they have made a covenant together against thee,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The tabernacles of the Edomites, and the Ishmahelites: Moab, and the Agarens,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Gebal, and Ammon and Amalec: the Philistines, with the inhabitants of Tyre.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Yea, and the Assyrian also is joined with them: they are come to the aid of the sons of Lot.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Do to them as thou didst to Madian and to Sisara: as to Jabin at the brook of Cisson.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who perished at Endor: and became as dung for the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Make their princes like Oreb, and Zeb, and Zebee, and Salmana. All their princes,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who have said: Let us possess the sanctuary of God for an inheritance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O my God, make them like a wheel; and as stubble before the wind.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As fire which burneth the wood: and as a flame burning mountains:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So shalt thou pursue them with thy tempest: and shalt trouble them in thy wrath.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Fill their faces with shame; and they shall seek thy name, O Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them be ashamed and troubled for ever and ever: and let them be confounded and perish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let them know that the Lord is thy name: thou alone art the most High over all the earth. Psalms Chapter 83 Quam dilecta. The soul aspireth after heaven; rejoicing in the mean time, in being in the communion of God’s church upon earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the winepresses, a psalm for the sons of Core.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How lovely are thy tabernacles, O Lord of hosts!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: my soul longeth and fainteth for the courts of the Lord. My heart and my flesh have rejoiced in the living God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the sparrow hath found herself a house, and the turtle a nest for herself where she may lay her young ones: Thy altars, O Lord of hosts, my king and my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house, O Lord: they shall praise thee for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the man whose help is from thee: in his heart he hath disposed to ascend by steps, In his heart he hath disposed to ascend by steps, etc.... Ascensiones in corde suo disposuit. As by steps men ascended to the temple of God situated on a hill; so the good Christian ascends towards the eternal temple by certain steps of virtue disposed or ordered within the heart: and this whilst he lives as yet in the body, in this vale of tears, the place which man hath set: that is, which he hath brought himself to: being cast out of paradise for his sin.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the vale of tears, in the place which he hath set.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the lawgiver shall give a blessing, they shall go from virtue to virtue: the God of gods shall be seen in Sion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold, O God our protector: and look on the face of thy Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For better is one day in thy courts above thousands. I have chosen to be an abject in the house of my God, rather than to dwell in the tabernacles of sinners.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For God loveth mercy and truth: the Lord will give grace and glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will not deprive of good things them that walk in innocence: O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee. Psalms Chapter 84 Benedixisti, Domine. The coming of Christ, to bring peace and salvation to man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the sons of Core, a psalm.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lord, thou hast blessed thy land: thou hast turned away the captivity of Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people: thou hast covered all their sins.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast mitigated all thy anger: thou hast turned away from the wrath of thy indignation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Convert us, O God our saviour: and turn off thy anger from us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wilt thou be angry with us for ever: or wilt thou extend thy wrath from generation to generation?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou wilt turn, O God, and bring us to life: and thy people shall rejoice in thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shew us, O Lord, thy mercy; and grant us thy salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will hear what the Lord God will speak in me: for he will speak peace unto his people: And unto his saints: and unto them that are converted to the heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Surely his salvation is near to them that fear him: that glory may dwell in our land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Mercy and truth have met each other: justice and peace have kissed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Truth is sprung out of the earth: and justice hath looked down from heaven.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord will give goodness: and our earth shall yield her fruit.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Justice shall walk before him: and shall set his steps in the way. Psalms Chapter 85 Inclina, Domine. A prayer for God’s grace to assist us to the end.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A prayer for David himself. Incline thy ear, O Lord, and hear me: for I am needy and poor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Preserve my soul, for I am holy: save thy servant, O my God, that trusteth in thee. I am holy.... I am by my office and profession dedicated to thy service.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I have cried to thee all the day.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give joy to the soul of thy servant, for to thee, O Lord, I have lifted up my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou, O Lord, art sweet and mild: and plenteous in mercy to all that call upon thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give ear, O Lord, to my prayer: and attend to the voice of my petition.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have called upon thee in the day of my trouble: because thou hast heard me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There is none among the gods like unto thee, O Lord: and there is none according to thy works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the nations thou hast made shall come and adore before thee, O Lord: and they shall glorify thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou art great and dost wonderful things: thou art God alone.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Conduct me, O Lord, in thy way, and I will walk in thy truth: let my heart rejoice that it may fear thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with my whole heart, and I will glorify thy name for ever:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy mercy is great towards me: and thou hast delivered my soul out of the lower hell.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God, the wicked are risen up against me, and the assembly of the mighty have sought my soul: and they have not set thee before their eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thou, O Lord, art a God of compassion, and merciful, patient, and of much mercy, and true.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O look upon me, and have mercy on me: give thy command to thy servant, and save the son of thy handmaid.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shew me a token for good: that they who hate me may see, and be confounded, because thou, O Lord, hast helped me and hast comforted me. Psalms Chapter 86 Fundamenta ejus. The glory of the church of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the sons of Core, a psalm of a canticle. The foundations thereof are in the holy mountains: The holy mountains.... The apostles and prophets. Eph. 2.20.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord loveth the gates of Sion above all the tabernacles of Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Glorious things are said of thee, O city of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will be mindful of Rahab and of Babylon knowing me. Behold the foreigners, and Tyre, and the people of the Ethiopians, these were there. Rahab.... Egypt, etc. To this Sion, which is the church of God, many shall resort from all nations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shall not Sion say: This man and that man is born in her? and the Highest himself hath founded her. Shall not Sion say, etc.... The meaning is, that Sion, viz., the church, shall not only be able to commemorate this or that particular person of renown born in her, but also to glory in great multitudes of people and princes of her communion; who have been foretold in the writings of the prophets, and registered in the writings of the apostles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord shall tell in his writings of peoples and of princes, of them that have been in her.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The dwelling in thee is as it were of all rejoicing. Psalms Chapter 87 Domine, Deus salutis. A prayer of one under grievous affliction: it agrees to Christ in his passion, and alludes to his death and burial.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A canticle of a psalm for the sons of Core: unto the end, for Maheleth, to answer understanding of Eman the Ezrahite. Maheleth.... A musical instrument, or chorus of musicians, to answer one another.—Ibid. Understanding.... Or a psalm of instruction, composed by Eman the Ezrahite, or by David, in his name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
