Text: O Lord, the God of my salvation: I have cried in the day, and in the night before thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my prayer come in before thee: incline thy ear to my petition.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my soul is filled with evils: and my life hath drawn nigh to hell.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am counted among them that go down to the pit: I am become as a man without help,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Free among the dead. Like the slain sleeping in the sepulchres, whom thou rememberest no more: and they are cut off from thy hand.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have laid me in the lower pit: in the dark places, and in the shadow of death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy wrath is strong over me: and all thy waves thou hast brought in upon me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast put away my acquaintance far from me: they have set me an abomination to themselves. I was delivered up, and came not forth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eyes languished through poverty. All the day I cried to thee, O Lord: I stretched out my hands to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wilt thou shew wonders to the dead? or shall physicians raise to life, and give praise to thee?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shall any one in the sepulchre declare thy mercy: and thy truth in destruction?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shall thy wonders be known in the dark; and thy justice in the land of forgetfulness?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I, O Lord, have cried to thee: and in the morning my prayer shall prevent thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lord, why castest thou off my prayer: why turnest thou away thy face from me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am poor, and in labours from my youth: and being exalted have been humbled and troubled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy wrath hath come upon me: and thy terrors have troubled me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have come round about me like water all the day: they have compassed me about together.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Friend and neighbour thou hast put far from me: and my acquaintance, because of misery. Psalms Chapter 88 Misericordias Domini. The perpetuity of the church of Christ, in consequence of the promise of God: which, notwithstanding, God permits her to suffer sometimes most grievous afflictions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Of understanding, for Ethan the Ezrahite.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The mercies of the Lord I will sing for ever. I will shew forth thy truth with my mouth to generation and generation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast said: Mercy shall be built up for ever in the heavens: thy truth shall be prepared in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have made a covenant with my elect: I have sworn to David my servant:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy seed will I settle for ever. And I will build up thy throne unto generation and generation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The heavens shall confess thy wonders, O Lord: and thy truth in the church of the saints.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For who in the clouds can be compared to the Lord: or who among the sons of God shall be like to God?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God, who is glorified in the assembly of the saints: great and terrible above all them that are about him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord God of hosts, who is like to thee? thou art mighty, O Lord, and thy truth is round about thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou rulest the power of the sea: and appeasest the motion of the waves thereof.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast humbled the proud one, as one that is slain: with the arm of thy strength thou hast scattered thy enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thine are the heavens, and thine is the earth: the world and the fulness thereof thou hast founded:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The north and the sea thou hast created. Thabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy arm is with might. Let thy hand be strengthened, and thy right hand exalted:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Justice and judgment are the preparation of thy throne. Mercy and truth shall go before thy face:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the people that knoweth jubilation. They shall walk, O Lord, in the light of thy countenance:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And in thy name they shall rejoice all the day, and in thy justice they shall be exalted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy good pleasure shall our horn be exalted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For our protection is of the Lord, and of our king the holy one of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then thou spokest in a vision to thy saints, and saidst: I have laid help upon one that is mighty, and have exalted one chosen out of my people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have found David my servant: with my holy oil I have anointed him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my hand shall help him: and my arm shall strengthen him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The enemy shall have no advantage over him: nor the son of iniquity have power to hurt him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I will cut down his enemies before his face; and them that hate him I will put to flight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And my truth and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I will set his hand in the sea; and his right hand in the rivers.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall cry out to me: Thou art my father: my God, and the support of my salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I will make him my firstborn, high above the kings of the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will keep my mercy for him for ever: and my covenant faithful to him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I will make his seed to endure for evermore: and his throne as the days of heaven.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And if his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If they profane my justices: and keep not my commandments:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will visit their iniquities with a rod and their sins with stripes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But my mercy I will not take away from him: nor will I suffer my truth to fail.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Neither will I profane my covenant: and the words that proceed from my mouth I will not make void.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Once have I sworn by my holiness: I will not lie unto David:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His seed shall endure for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And his throne as the sun before me: and as the moon perfect for ever, and a faithful witness in heaven.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou hast rejected and despised: thou hast been angry with my anointed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast overthrown the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his sanctuary on the earth. Overthrown the covenant, etc.... All this seems to relate to the time of the captivity of Babylon, in which, for the sins of the people and their princes, God seemed to have set aside for a while the covenant he made with David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast broken down all his hedges: thou hast made his strength fear.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All that pass by the way have robbed him: he is become a reproach to his neighbours.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast set up the right hand of them that oppress him: thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast turned away the help of his sword; and hast not assisted him in battle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast made his purification to cease: and thou hast cast his throne down to the ground.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast shortened the days of his time: thou hast covered him with confusion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long, O Lord, turnest thou away unto the end? shall thy anger burn like fire?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember what my substance is: for hast thou made all the children of men in vain?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is the man that shall live, and not see death: that shall deliver his soul from the hand of hell?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lord, where are thy ancient mercies, according to what thou didst swear to David in thy truth?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be mindful, O Lord, of the reproach of thy servants (which I have held in my bosom) of many nations:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wherewith thy enemies have reproached, O Lord; wherewith they have reproached the change of thy anointed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the Lord for evermore. So be it. So be it. Psalms Chapter 89 Domine, refugium. A prayer for the mercy of God: recounting the shortness and miseries of the days of man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A prayer of Moses the man of God. Lord, thou hast been our refuge from generation to generation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Before the mountains were made, or the earth and the world was formed; from eternity and to eternity thou art God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn not man away to be brought low: and thou hast said: Be converted, O ye sons of men. Turn not man away, etc.... Suffer him not quite to perish from thee, since thou art pleased to call upon him to be converted to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For a thousand years in thy sight are as yesterday, which is past. And as a watch in the night,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Things that are counted nothing, shall their years be.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the morning man shall grow up like grass; in the morning he shall flourish and pass away: in the evening he shall fall, grow dry, and wither.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For in thy wrath we have fainted away: and are troubled in thy indignation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast set our iniquities before thy eyes: our life in the light of thy countenance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For all our days are spent; and in thy wrath we have fainted away. Our years shall be considered as a spider: As a spider.... As frail and weak as a spider’s web; and miserable withal, whilst like a spider we spend our bowels in weaving webs to catch flies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The days of our years in them are threescore and ten years. But if in the strong they be fourscore years: and what is more of them is labour and sorrow. For mildness is come upon us: and we shall be corrected. Mildness is come upon us, etc.... God’s mildness corrects us; inasmuch as he deals kindly with us, in shortening the days of this miserable life; and so weaning our affections from all its transitory enjoyments, and teaching us true wisdom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who knoweth the power of thy anger, and for thy fear

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Can number thy wrath? So make thy right hand known: and men learned in heart, in wisdom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Return, O Lord, how long? and be entreated in favour of thy servants.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We are filled in the morning with thy mercy: and we have rejoiced, and are delighted all our days.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We have rejoiced for the days in which thou hast humbled us: for the years in which we have seen evils.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Look upon thy servants and upon their works: and direct their children.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let the brightness of the Lord our God be upon us: and direct thou the works of our hands over us; yea, the work of our hands do thou direct. Psalms Chapter 90 Qui habitat. The just is secure under the protection of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The praise of a canticle for David. He that dwelleth in the aid of the most High, shall abide under the protection of the God of Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall say to the Lord: Thou art my protector, and my refuge: my God, in him will I trust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath delivered me from the snare of the hunters: and from the sharp word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will overshadow thee with his shoulders: and under his wings thou shalt trust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His truth shall compass thee with a shield: thou shalt not be afraid of the terror of the night.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Of the arrow that flieth in the day, of the business that walketh about in the dark: of invasion, or of the noonday devil.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand: but it shall not come nigh thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou shalt consider with thy eyes: and shalt see the reward of the wicked.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because thou, O Lord, art my hope: thou hast made the most High thy refuge.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There shall no evil come to thee: nor shall the scourge come near thy dwelling.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath given his angels charge over thee; to keep thee in all thy ways.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In their hands they shall bear thee up: lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt walk upon the asp and the basilisk: and thou shalt trample under foot the lion and the dragon.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he hoped in me I will deliver him: I will protect him because he hath known my name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall cry to me, and I will hear him: I am with him in tribulation, I will deliver him, and I will glorify him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will fill him with length of days; and I will shew him my salvation. Psalms Chapter 91 Bonum est confiteri. God is to be praised for his wondrous works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm of a canticle on the sabbath day.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is good to give praise to the Lord: and to sing to thy name, O most High.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To shew forth thy mercy in the morning, and thy truth in the night:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Upon an instrument of ten strings, upon the psaltery: with a canticle upon the harp.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast given me, O Lord, a delight in thy doings: and in the works of thy hands I shall rejoice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, how great are thy works! thy thoughts are exceeding deep.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The senseless man shall not know: nor will the fool understand these things.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When the wicked shall spring up as grass: and all the workers of iniquity shall appear: That they may perish for ever and ever:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou, O Lord, art most high for evermore.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For behold thy enemies, O lord, for behold thy enemies shall perish: and all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But my horn shall be exalted like that of the unicorn: and my old age in plentiful mercy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eye also hath looked down upon my enemies: and my ear shall hear of the downfall of the malignant that rise up against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The just shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow up like the cedar of Libanus.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that are planted in the house of the Lord shall flourish in the courts of the house of our God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shall still increase in a fruitful old age: and shall be well treated,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That they may shew, That the Lord our God is righteous, and there is no iniquity in him. Psalms Chapter 92 Dominus regnavit. The glory and stability of the kingdom; that is, of the church of Christ. Praise in the way of a canticle, for David himself, on the day before the sabbath, when the earth was founded.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath reigned, he is clothed with beauty: the Lord is clothed with strength, and hath girded himself. For he hath established the world which shall not be moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My throne is prepared from of old: thou art from everlasting.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The floods have lifted up, O Lord: the floods have lifted up their voice. The floods have lifted up their waves,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With the noise of many waters. Wonderful are the surges of the sea: wonderful is the Lord on high.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy testimonies are become exceedingly credible: holiness becometh thy house, O Lord, unto length of days. Psalms Chapter 93 Deus ultionum. God shall judge and punish the oppressors of his people. A psalm for David himself on the fourth day of the week.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is the God to whom revenge belongeth: the God of revenge hath acted freely.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lift up thyself, thou that judgest the earth: render a reward to the proud.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long shall sinners, O Lord: how long shall sinners glory?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shall they utter, and speak iniquity: shall all speak who work injustice?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy people, O Lord, they have brought low: and they have afflicted thy inheritance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have slain the widow and the stranger: and they have murdered the fatherless.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they have said: The Lord shall not see: neither shall the God of Jacob understand.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Understand, ye senseless among the people: and, you fools, be wise at last.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? or he that formed the eye, doth he not consider?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that chastiseth nations, shall he not rebuke: he that teacheth man knowledge?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord knoweth the thoughts of men, that they are vain.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the man whom thou shalt instruct, O Lord: and shalt teach him out of thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That thou mayst give him rest from the evil days: till a pit be dug for the wicked. Rest from the evil days.... That thou mayst mitigate the sorrows, to which he is exposed, during the short and evil days of his mortality.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord will not cast off his people: neither will he forsake his own inheritance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Until justice be turned into judgment: and they that are near it are all the upright in heart. Until justice be turned into judgment, etc.... By being put in execution; which will be agreeable to all the upright in heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who shall rise up for me against the evildoers? or who shall stand with me against the workers of iniquity?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unless the Lord had been my helper, my soul had almost dwelt in hell.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I said: My foot is moved: thy mercy, O Lord, assisted me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: According to the multitude of my sorrows in my heart, thy comforts have given joy to my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Doth the seat of iniquity stick to thee, who framest labour in commandment? Doth the seat of iniquity stick to thee, etc.... That is, wilt thou, O God, who art always just, admit of the seat of iniquity: that is, of injustice, or unjust judges, to have any partnership with thee? Thou who framest, or makest, labour in commandment, that is, thou who obligest us to labour with all diligence to keep thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They will hunt after the soul of the just, and will condemn innocent blood.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the Lord is my refuge: and my God the help of my hope.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he will render them their iniquity: and in their malice he will destroy them: the Lord our God will destroy them. Psalms Chapter 94 Venite exultemus. An invitation to adore and serve God, and to hear his voice. Praise of a canticle for David himself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Come let us praise the Lord with joy: let us joyfully sing to God our saviour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving; and make a joyful noise to him with psalms.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord is a great God, and a great King above all gods.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For in his hand are all the ends of the earth: and the heights of the mountains are his.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the sea is his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Come let us adore and fall down: and weep before the Lord that made us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he is the Lord our God: and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To day if you shall hear his voice, harden not your hearts:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As in the provocation, according to the day of temptation in the wilderness: where your fathers tempted me, they proved me, and saw my works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Forty years long was I offended with that generation, and I said: These always err in heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And these men have not known my ways: so I swore in my wrath that they shall not enter into my rest. Psalms Chapter 95 Cantate Domino. An exhortation to praise God for the coming of Christ and his kingdom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A canticle for David himself, when the house was built after the captivity. Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle: sing to the Lord, all the earth. When the house was built, etc.... Alluding to that time, and then ordered to be sung: but principally relating to the building of the church of Christ, after our redemption from the captivity of Satan.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing ye to the Lord and bless his name: shew forth his salvation from day to day.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Declare his glory among the Gentiles: his wonders among all people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord is great, and exceedingly to be praised: he is to be feared above all gods.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For all the gods of the Gentiles are devils: but the Lord made the heavens.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise and beauty are before him: holiness and majesty in his sanctuary.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bring ye to the Lord, O ye kindreds of the Gentiles, bring ye to the Lord glory and honour:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bring to the Lord glory unto his name. Bring up sacrifices, and come into his courts:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Adore ye the Lord in his holy court. Let all the earth be moved at his presence.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Say ye among the Gentiles, the Lord hath reigned. For he hath corrected the world, which shall not be moved: he will judge the people with justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad, let the sea be moved, and the fulness thereof:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The fields and all things that are in them shall be joyful. Then shall all the trees of the woods rejoice

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: before the face of the Lord, because he cometh: because he cometh to judge the earth. He shall judge the world with justice, and the people with his truth. Psalms Chapter 96 Dominus regnavit. All are invited to rejoice at the glorious coming and reign of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the same David, when his land was restored again to him. The Lord hath reigned, let the earth rejoice: let many islands be glad.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Clouds and darkness are round about him: justice and judgment are the establishment of his throne. Clouds and darkness.... The coming of Christ in the clouds with great terror and majesty to judge the world, is here prophesied.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A fire shall go before him, and shall burn his enemies round about.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His lightnings have shone forth to the world: the earth saw and trembled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The mountains melted like wax, at the presence of the Lord: at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The heavens declared his justice: and all people saw his glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them be all confounded that adore graven things, and that glory in their idols. Adore him, all you his angels:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sion heard, and was glad. And the daughters of Juda rejoiced, because of thy judgments, O Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou art the most high Lord over all the earth: thou art exalted exceedingly above all gods.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: You that love the Lord, hate evil: the Lord preserveth the souls of his saints, he will deliver them out of the hand of the sinner.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Light is risen to the just, and joy to the right of heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Rejoice, ye just, in the Lord: and give praise to the remembrance of his holiness. Psalms Chapter 97 Cantate Domino. All are again invited to praise the Lord, for the victories of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David himself. Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle: because he hath done wonderful things. His right hand hath wrought for him salvation, and his arm is holy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath made known his salvation: he hath revealed his justice in the sight of the Gentiles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath remembered his mercy and his truth toward the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing joyfully to God, all the earth; make melody, rejoice and sing.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing praise to the Lord on the harp, on the harp, and with the voice of a psalm:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With long trumpets, and sound of cornet. Make a joyful noise before the Lord our king:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the sea be moved and the fullness thereof: the world and they that dwell therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The rivers shall clap their hands, the mountains shall rejoice together

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: At the presence of the Lord: because he cometh to judge the earth. He shall judge the world with justice, and the people with equity. Psalms Chapter 98 Dominus regnavit. The reign of the Lord in Sion: that is, of Christ in his church.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David himself. The Lord hath reigned, let the people be angry: he that sitteth on the cherubims: let the earth be moved. Let the people be angry.... Though many enemies rage, and the whole earth be stirred up to oppose the reign of Christ, he shall still prevail.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The lord is great in Sion, and high above all people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them give praise to thy great name: for it is terrible and holy:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the king’s honour loveth judgment. Thou hast prepared directions: thou hast done judgment and justice in Jacob. Loveth judgment.... Requireth discretion.—Ibid. Directions.... Most right and just laws to direct men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Exalt ye the Lord our God, and adore his footstool, for it is holy. Adore his footstool.... The ark of the covenant was called, in the Old Testament, God’s footstool: over which he was understood to sit, on his propitiatory, or mercy seat, as on a throne, between the wings of the cherubims, in the sanctuary: to which the children of Israel paid a great veneration. But as this psalm evidently relates to Christ, and the New Testament, where the ark has no place, the holy fathers understand this text, of the worship paid by the church to the body and blood of Christ in the sacred mysteries: inasmuch as the humanity of Christ is, as it were, the footstool of the divinity. So St. Ambrose, L. 3. De Spiritu Sancto, c. 12. And St. Augustine upon this psalm.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Moses and Aaron among his priests: and Samuel among them that call upon his name. They called upon the Lord, and he heard them: Moses and Aaron among his priests.... By this it is evident, that Moses also was a priest, and indeed the chief priest, inasmuch as he consecrated Aaron, and offered sacrifice for him. Lev. 8. So that his pre-eminence over Aaron makes nothing for lay church headship.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He spoke to them in the pillar of the cloud. They kept his testimonies, and the commandment which he gave them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou didst hear them, O Lord our God: thou wast a merciful God to them, and taking vengeance on all their inventions. All their inventions.... that is, all the enterprises of their enemies against them, as in the case of Core, Dathan, and Abiron.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Exalt ye the Lord our God, and adore at his holy mountain: for the Lord our God is holy. Psalms Chapter 99 Jubilate Deo. All are invited to rejoice in God the creator of all.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm of praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing joyfully to God, all the earth: serve ye the Lord with gladness. Come in before his presence with exceeding great joy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Know ye that the Lord he is God: he made us, and not we ourselves. We are his people and the sheep of his pasture.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Go ye into his gates with praise, into his courts with hymns: and give glory to him. Praise ye his name:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord is sweet, his mercy endureth for ever, and his truth to generation and generation. Psalms Chapter 100 Misericordiam et judicium. The prophet exhorteth all by his example, to follow mercy and justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David himself. Mercy and judgment I will sing to thee, O Lord: I will sing,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I will understand in the unspotted way, when thou shalt come to me. I walked in the innocence of my heart, in the midst of my house. I will understand, etc.... That is, I will apply my mind, I will do my endeavour, to know and to follow the perfect way of thy commandments: not trusting to my own strength, but relying on thy coming to me by thy grace.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will not set before my eyes any unjust thing: I hated the workers of iniquities.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The perverse heart did not cleave to me: and the malignant, that turned aside from me, I would not know.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The man that in private detracted his neighbour, him did I persecute. With him that had a proud eye, and an unsatiable heart, I would not eat.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eyes were upon the faithful of the earth, to sit with me: the man that walked in the perfect way, he served me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that worketh pride shall not dwell in the midst of my house: he that speaketh unjust things did not prosper before my eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the morning I put to death all the wicked of the land: that I might cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of the Lord. Psalms Chapter 101 Domine, exaudi. A prayer for one in affliction: the fifth penitential psalm.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The prayer of the poor man, when he was anxious, and poured out his supplication before the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear, O Lord, my prayer: and let my cry come to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn not away thy face from me: in the day when I am in trouble, incline thy ear to me. In what day soever I shall call upon thee, hear me speedily.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my days are vanished like smoke, and my bones are grown dry like fuel for the fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am smitten as grass, and my heart is withered: because I forgot to eat my bread.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Through the voice of my groaning, my bone hath cleaved to my flesh.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am become like to a pelican of the wilderness: I am like a night raven in the house. A pelican, etc.... I am become through grief, like birds that affect solitude and darkness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have watched, and am become as a sparrow all alone on the housetop.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the day long my enemies reproached me: and they that praised me did swear against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I did eat ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because of thy anger and indignation: for having lifted me up thou hast thrown me down.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My days have declined like a shadow, and I am withered like grass.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou, O Lord, endurest for ever: and thy memorial to all generations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt arise and have mercy on Sion: for it is time to have mercy on it, for the time is come.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the stones thereof have pleased thy servants: and they shall have pity on the earth thereof.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Gentiles shall fear thy name, O Lord, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord hath built up Sion: and he shall be seen in his glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath had regard to the prayer of the humble: and he hath not despised their petition.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let these things be written unto another generation: and the people that shall be created shall praise the Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he hath looked forth from his high sanctuary: from heaven the Lord hath looked upon the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That he might hear the groans of them that are in fetters: that he might release the children of the slain:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That they may declare the name of the Lord in Sion: and his praise in Jerusalem;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When the people assemble together, and kings, to serve the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He answered him in the way of his strength: Declare unto me the fewness of my days. He answered him in the way of his strength.... That is, the people, mentioned in the foregoing verse, or the penitent, in whose person this psalm is delivered, answered the Lord in the way of his strength: that is, according to the best of his power and strength: or when he was in the flower of his age and strength: inquiring after the fewness of his days: to know if he should live long enough to see the happy restoration of Sion, etc.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Call me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are unto generation and generation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the beginning, O Lord, thou foundedst the earth: and the heavens are the works of thy hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shall perish but thou remainest: and all of them shall grow old like a garment: And as a vesture thou shalt change them, and they shall be changed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou art always the selfsame, and thy years shall not fail.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The children of thy servants shall continue and their seed shall be directed for ever. Psalms Chapter 102 Benedic, anima. Thanksgiving to God for his mercies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For David himself. Bless the Lord, O my soul: and let all that is within me bless his holy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless the Lord, O my soul, and never forget all he hath done for thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who forgiveth all thy iniquities: who healeth all thy diseases.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction: who crowneth thee with mercy and compassion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who satisfieth thy desire with good things: thy youth shall be renewed like the eagle’s.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord doth mercies, and judgment for all that suffer wrong.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath made his ways known to Moses: his wills to the children of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is compassionate and merciful: longsuffering and plenteous in mercy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will not always be angry: nor will he threaten for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath not dealt with us according to our sins: nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For according to the height of the heaven above the earth: he hath strengthened his mercy towards them that fear him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our iniquities from us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As a father hath compassion on his children, so hath the Lord compassion on them that fear him:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he knoweth our frame. He remembereth that we are dust:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Man’s days are as grass, as the flower of the field so shall he flourish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the spirit shall pass in him, and he shall not be: and he shall know his place no more.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the mercy of the Lord is from eternity and unto eternity upon them that fear him: And his justice unto children’s children,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To such as keep his covenant, And are mindful of his commandments to do them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The lord hath prepared his throne in heaven: and his kingdom shall rule over all.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless the Lord, all ye his angels: you that are mighty in strength, and execute his word, hearkening to the voice of his orders.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless the Lord, all ye his hosts: you ministers of his that do his will.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless the Lord, all his works: in every place of his dominion, O my soul, bless thou the Lord. Psalms Chapter 103 Benedic, anima. God is to be praised for his mighty works, and wonderful providence.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For David himself. Bless the Lord, O my soul: O Lord my God, thou art exceedingly great. Thou hast put on praise and beauty:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And art clothed with light as with a garment. Who stretchest out the heaven like a pavilion:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who coverest the higher rooms thereof with water. Who makest the clouds thy chariot: who walkest upon the wings of the winds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who makest thy angels spirits: and thy ministers a burning fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who hast founded the earth upon its own bases: it shall not be moved for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The deep like a garment is its clothing: above the mountains shall the waters stand.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: At thy rebuke they shall flee: at the voice of thy thunder they shall fear.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The mountains ascend, and the plains descend into the place which thou hast founded for them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast set a bound which they shall not pass over; neither shall they return to cover the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou sendest forth springs in the vales: between the midst of the hills the waters shall pass.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the beasts of the field shall drink: the wild asses shall expect in their thirst.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Over them the birds of the air shall dwell: from the midst of the rocks they shall give forth their voices.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou waterest the hills from thy upper rooms: the earth shall be filled with the fruit of thy works:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bringing forth grass for cattle, and herb for the service of men. That thou mayst bring bread out of the earth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And that wine may cheer the heart of man. That he may make the face cheerful with oil: and that bread may strengthen man’s heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The trees of the field shall be filled, and the cedars of Libanus which he hath planted:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There the sparrows shall make their nests. The highest of them is the house of the heron.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The high hills are a refuge for the harts, the rock for the irchins.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath made the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast appointed darkness, and it is night: in it shall all the beasts of the woods go about:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The young lions roaring after their prey, and seeking their meat from God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sun ariseth, and they are gathered together: and they shall lie down in their dens.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Man shall go forth to his work, and to his labour until the evening.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How great are thy works, O Lord? thou hast made all things in wisdom: the earth is filled with thy riches.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So is this great sea, which stretcheth wide its arms: there are creeping things without number: Creatures little and great.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There the ships shall go. This sea dragon which thou hast formed to play therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All expect of thee that thou give them food in season.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What thou givest to them they shall gather up: when thou openest thy hand, they shall all be filled with good.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But if thou turnest away thy face, they shall be troubled: thou shalt take away their breath, and they shall fail, and shall return to their dust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt send forth thy spirit, and they shall be created: and thou shalt renew the face of the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the glory of the Lord endure for ever: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He looketh upon the earth, and maketh it tremble: he toucheth the mountains, and they smoke.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will sing to the Lord as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my speech be acceptable to him: but I will take delight in the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let sinners be consumed out of the earth, and the unjust, so that they be no more: O my soul, bless thou the Lord. Psalms Chapter 104 Confitemini Domino. A thanksgiving to God for his benefits to his people Israel. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give glory to the Lord, and call upon his name: declare his deeds among the Gentiles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing to him, yea sing praises to him: relate all his wondrous works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Seek ye the lord, and be strengthened: seek his face evermore.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember his marvellous works which he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O ye seed of Abraham his servant; ye sons of Jacob his chosen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He is the Lord our God: his judgments are in all the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath remembered his covenant for ever: the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Which he made to Abraham; and his oath to Isaac:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he appointed the same to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting testament:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Saying: To thee will I give the land of Chanaan, the lot of your inheritance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When they were but a small number: yea very few, and sojourners therein:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they passed from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He suffered no man to hurt them: and he reproved kings for their sakes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Touch ye not my anointed: and do no evil to my prophets.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he called a famine upon the land: and he broke in pieces all the support of bread.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent a man before them: Joseph, who was sold for a slave.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They humbled his feet in fetters: the iron pierced his soul,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Until his word came. The word of the Lord inflamed him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The king sent, and he released him: the ruler of the people, and he set him at liberty.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He made him master of his house, and ruler of all his possession.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That he might instruct his princes as himself, and teach his ancients wisdom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And Israel went into Egypt: and Jacob was a sojourner in the land of Cham.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he increased his people exceedingly: and strengthened them over their enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He turned their heart to hate his people: and to deal deceitfully with his servants. He turned their heart, etc.... Not that God (who is never the author of sin) moved the Egyptians to hate and persecute his people; but that the Egyptians took occasion of hating and envying them, from the sight of the benefits which God bestowed upon them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent Moses his servant: Aaron the man whom he had chosen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He gave them power to shew them signs, and his wonders in the land of Cham.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent darkness, and made it obscure: and grieved not his words. Grieved not his words.... That is, he was not wanting to fulfil his words: or he did not grieve Moses and Aaron, the carriers of his words: or he did not grieve his words, that is, his sons, the children of Israel, who enjoyed light whilst the Egyptians were oppressed with darkness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He turned their waters into blood, and destroyed their fish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their land brought forth frogs, in the inner chambers of their kings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He spoke, and there came divers sorts of flies and sciniphs in all their coasts. Sciniphs.... See the annotation, Ex.8.16.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He gave them hail for rain, a burning fire in the land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he destroyed their vineyards and their fig trees: and he broke in pieces the trees of their coasts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He spoke, and the locust came, and the bruchus, of which there was no number. Bruchus.... An insect of the locust kind.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they devoured all the grass in their land, and consumed all the fruit of their ground.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he slew all the firstborn in their land: the firstfruits of all their labour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he brought them out with silver and gold: and there was not among their tribes one that was feeble.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them lay upon them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He spread a cloud for their protection, and fire to give them light in the night.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They asked, and the quail came: and he filled them with the bread of heaven.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He opened the rock, and waters flowed: rivers ran down in the dry land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he remembered his holy word, which he had spoken to his servant Abraham.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he gave them the lands of the Gentiles: and they possessed the labours of the people:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That they might observe his justifications, and seek after his law. His justifications.... That is, his commandments; which here, and in many other places of the scripture, are called justifications, because the keeping of them makes man just. The Protestants render it by the word statutes, in favour of their doctrine, which does not allow good works to justify. Psalms Chapter 105 Confitemini Domino. A confession of the manifold sins and ingratitudes of the Israelites. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give glory to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who shall declare the powers of the Lord? who shall set forth all his praises?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and do justice at all times.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember us, O Lord, in the favour of thy people: visit us with thy salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That we may see the good of thy chosen, that we may rejoice in the joy of thy nation: that thou mayst be praised with thy inheritance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We have sinned with our fathers: we have acted unjustly, we have wrought iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt: they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies: And they provoked to wrath going up to the sea, even the Red Sea.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he saved them for his own name’s sake: that he might make his power known.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he rebuked the Red Sea and it was dried up: and he led them through the depths, as in a wilderness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he saved them from the hand of them that hated them: and he redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the water covered them that afflicted them: there was not one of them left.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they believed his words: and they sang his praises.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They had quickly done, they forgot his works: and they waited not for his counsel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they coveted their desire in the desert: and they tempted God in the place without water.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he gave them their request: and sent fulness into their souls.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they provoked Moses in the camp, Aaron the holy one of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan: and covered the congregation of Abiron.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And a fire was kindled in their congregation: the flame burned the wicked.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They made also a calf in Horeb: and they adored the graven thing.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they changed their glory into the likeness of a calf that eateth grass.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They forgot God, who saved them, who had done great things in Egypt,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wondrous works in the land of Cham: terrible things in the Red Sea.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he said that he would destroy them: had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach: To turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they set at nought the desirable land. They believed not his word,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they murmured in their tents: they hearkened not to the voice of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he lifted up his hand over them: to overthrow them in the desert;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And to cast down their seed among the nations, and to scatter them in the countries.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They also were initiated to Beelphegor: and ate the sacrifices of the dead. Initiated.... That is, they dedicated, or consecrated themselves to the idol of the Moabites and Madianites, called Beelphegor, or Baal-Peor. Num. 25.3.—Ibid. The dead.... Viz., idols without life.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they provoked him with their inventions: and destruction was multiplied among them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then Phinees stood up, and pacified him: and the slaughter ceased.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And it was reputed to him unto justice, to generation and generation for evermore.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They provoked him also at the waters of contradiction: and Moses was afflicted for their sakes:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because they exasperated his spirit. And he distinguished with his lips. He distinguished with his lips.... Moses, by occasion of the people’s rebellion and incredulity, was guilty of distinguishing with his lips; when, instead of speaking to the rock, as God had commanded, he said to the people, with a certain hesitation in his faith, Hear ye, rebellious and incredulous: Can we from this rock bring out water for you? Num. 20.10.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They did not destroy the nations of which the Lord spoke unto them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they were mingled among the heathens, and learned their works:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And served their idols, and it became a stumblingblock to them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they sacrificed their sons, and their daughters to devils.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they shed innocent blood: the blood of their sons and of their daughters which they sacrificed to the idols of Chanaan. And the land was polluted with blood,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And was defiled with their works: and they went aside after their own inventions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Lord was exceedingly angry with his people: and he abhorred his inheritance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he delivered them into the hands of the nations: and they that hated them had dominion over them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And their enemies afflicted them: and they were humbled under their hands:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many times did he deliver them. But they provoked him with their counsel: and they were brought low by their iniquities.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he saw when they were in tribulation: and he heard their prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he was mindful of his covenant: and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he gave them unto mercies, in the sight of all those that had made them captives.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Save us, O Lord, our God: and gather us from among the nations: That we may give thanks to thy holy name, and may glory in thy praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the Lord the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say: So be it, so be it. Psalms Chapter 106 Confitemini Domino. All are invited to give thanks to God for his perpetual providence over men. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give glory to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them say so that have been redeemed by the Lord, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy: and gathered out of the countries.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From the rising and from the setting of the sun, from the north and from the sea.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They wandered in a wilderness, in a place without water: they found not the way of a city for their habitation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They were hungry and thirsty: their soul fainted in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they cried to the Lord in their tribulation: and he delivered them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he led them into the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: and his wonderful works to the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath satisfied the empty soul, and hath filled the hungry soul with good things.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death: bound in want and in iron.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because they had exasperated the words of God: and provoked the counsel of the most High:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And their heart was humbled with labours: they were weakened, and there was none to help them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he delivered them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he brought them out of darkness, and the shadow of death; and broke their bonds in sunder.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him, and his wonderful works to the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he hath broken gates of brass, and burst iron bars.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He took them out of the way of their iniquity: for they were brought low for their injustices.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their soul abhorred all manner of meat: and they drew nigh even to the gates of death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he delivered them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent his word, and healed them: and delivered them from their destructions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: and his wonderful works to the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let them sacrifice the sacrifice of praise: and declare his works with joy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that go down to the sea in ships, doing business in the great waters:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: These have seen the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He said the word, and there arose a storm of wind: and the waves thereof were lifted up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They mount up to the heavens, and they go down to the depths: their soul pined away with evils.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They were troubled, and reeled like a drunken man; and all their wisdom was swallowed up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he brought them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he turned the storm into a breeze: and its waves were still.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they rejoiced because they were still: and he brought them to the haven which they wished for.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him, and his wonderful works to the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let them exalt him in the church of the people: and praise him in the chair of the ancients.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath turned rivers into a wilderness: and the sources of waters into dry ground:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath turned a wilderness into pools of waters, and a dry land into water springs.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And hath placed there the hungry; and they made a city for their habitation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they sowed fields, and planted vineyards: and they yielded fruit of birth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he blessed them, and they were multiplied exceedingly: and their cattle he suffered not to decrease.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then they were brought to be few: and they were afflicted through the trouble of evils and sorrow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Contempt was poured forth upon their princes: and he caused them to wander where there was no passing, and out of the way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he helped the poor out of poverty: and made him families like a flock of sheep.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The just shall see, and shall rejoice, and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is wise, and will keep these things; and will understand the mercies of the Lord? Psalms Chapter 107 Paratum cor meum. The prophet praiseth God for benefits received.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A canticle of a psalm for David himself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My heart is ready, O God, my heart is ready: I will sing, and will give praise, with my glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, my glory; arise, psaltery and harp: I will arise in the morning early.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: and I will sing unto thee among the nations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth even unto the clouds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens, and thy glory over all the earth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That thy beloved may be delivered. Save with thy right hand and hear me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God hath spoken in his holiness. I will rejoice, and I will divide Sichem and I will mete out the vale of tabernacles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Galaad is mine: and Manasses is mine and Ephraim the protection of my head. Juda is my king:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Moab the pot of my hope. Over Edom I will stretch out my shoe: the aliens are become my friends.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our armies?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O grant us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Through God we shall do mightily: and he will bring our enemies to nothing. Psalms Chapter 108 Deus, laudem meam. David in the person of Christ, prayeth against his persecutors; more especially the traitor Judas: foretelling and approving his just punishment for his obstinacy in sin and final impenitence.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God, be not thou silent in my praise: for the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful man is opened against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have spoken against me with deceitful tongues; and they have compassed me about with words of hatred; and have fought against me without cause.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Instead of making me a return of love, they detracted me: but I gave myself to prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they repaid me evil for good: and hatred for my love.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Set thou the sinner over him: and may the devil stand at his right hand. Set thou the sinner over him, etc.... Give to the devil, that arch-sinner, power over him: let him enter into him, and possess him. The imprecations, contained in the thirty verses of this psalm, are opposed to the thirty pieces of silver for which Judas betrayed our Lord; and are to be taken as prophetic denunciations of the evils that should befall the traitor and his accomplices the Jews; and not properly as curses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When he is judged, may he go out condemned; and may his prayer be turned to sin.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May his days be few: and his bishopric let another take.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let his children be carried about vagabonds, and beg; and let them be cast out of their dwellings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the usurer search all his substance: and let strangers plunder his labours.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May there be none to help him: nor none to pity his fatherless offspring.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May his posterity be cut off; in one generation may his name be blotted out.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered in the sight of the Lord: and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May they be before the Lord continually, and let the memory of them perish from the earth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: because he remembered not to shew mercy,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But persecuted the poor man and the beggar; and the broken in heart, to put him to death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he loved cursing, and it shall come unto him: and he would not have blessing, and it shall be far from him. And he put on cursing, like a garment: and it went in like water into his entrails, and like oil in his bones.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May it be unto him like a garment which covereth him; and like a girdle with which he is girded continually.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is the work of them who detract me before the Lord; and who speak evils against my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou, O Lord, do with me for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is sweet. Do thou deliver me,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is troubled within me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am taken away like the shadow when it declineth: and I am shaken off as locusts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My knees are weakened through fasting: and my flesh is changed for oil. For oil.... Propter oleum. The meaning is, my flesh is changed, being perfectly emaciated and dried up, as having lost all its oil or fatness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I am become a reproach to them: they saw me and they shaked their heads.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Help me, O Lord my God; save me; according to thy mercy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let them know that this is thy hand: and that thou, O Lord, hast done it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They will curse and thou wilt bless: let them that rise up against me be confounded: but thy servant shall rejoice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them that detract me be clothed with shame: and let them be covered with their confusion as with a double cloak.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will give great thanks to the Lord with my mouth: and in the midst of many I will praise him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he hath stood at the right hand of the poor, to save my soul from persecutors. Psalms Chapter 109 Dixit Dominus. Christ’s exaltation and everlasting priesthood.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David. The Lord said to my Lord: Sit thou at my right hand: Until I make thy enemies thy footstool.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord will send forth the sceptre of thy power out of Sion: rule thou in the midst of thy enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With thee is the principality in the day of thy strength: in the brightness of the saints: from the womb before the day star I begot thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath sworn, and he will not repent: Thou art a priest for ever according to the order of Melchisedech.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord at thy right hand hath broken kings in the day of his wrath.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall judge among nations, he shall fill ruins: he shall crush the heads in the land of many.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall drink of the torrent in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head. Psalms Chapter 110 Confitebor tibi, Domine. God is to be praised for his graces, and benefits to his church. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise thee, O Lord, with my whole heart; in the council of the just, and in the congregation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Great are the works of the Lord: sought out according to all his wills.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His work is praise and magnificence: and his justice continueth for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath made a remembrance of his wonderful works, being a merciful and gracious Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath given food to them that fear him. He will be mindful for ever of his covenant:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will shew forth to his people the power of his works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That he may give them the inheritance of the Gentiles: the works of his hands are truth and judgment.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All his commandments are faithful: confirmed for ever and ever, made in truth and equity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath sent redemption to his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever. Holy and terrible is his name:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. A good understanding to all that do it: his praise continueth for ever and ever. Psalms Chapter 111 Beatus vir. The good man is happy. Alleluia, of the returning of Aggeus and Zacharias. Of the returning, etc.... This is in the Greek and Latin, but not in the Hebrew. It signifies that this psalm was proper to be sung at the time of the return of the people from their captivity; to inculcate to them, how happy they might be, if they would be constant in the service of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the man that feareth the Lord: he shall delight exceedingly in his commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the righteous shall be blessed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Glory and wealth shall be in his house: and his justice remaineth for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To the righteous a light is risen up in darkness: he is merciful, and compassionate and just.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Acceptable is the man that sheweth mercy and lendeth: he shall order his words with judgment:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he shall not be moved for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The just shall be in everlasting remembrance: he shall not fear the evil hearing. His heart is ready to hope in the Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His heart is strengthened, he shall not be moved until he look over his enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath distributed, he hath given to the poor: his justice remaineth for ever and ever: his horn shall be exalted in glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked shall see, and shall be angry, he shall gnash with his teeth and pine away: the desire of the wicked shall perish. Psalms Chapter 112 Laudate, pueri. God is to be praised for his regard to the poor and humble. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise the Lord, ye children: praise ye the name of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the name of the Lord, from henceforth now and for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same, the name of the Lord is worthy of praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is high above all nations; and his glory above the heavens.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is as the Lord our God, who dwelleth on high:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: and looketh down on the low things in heaven and in earth?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Raising up the needy from the earth, and lifting up the poor out of the dunghill:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That he may place him with princes, with the princes of his people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who maketh a barren woman to dwell in a house, the joyful mother of children. Psalms Chapter 113 In exitu Israel. God hath shewn his power in delivering his people: idols are vain. The Hebrews divide this into two psalms. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a barbarous people:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Judea was made his sanctuary, Israel his dominion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sea saw and fled: Jordan was turned back.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The mountains skipped like rams, and the hills like the lambs of the flock.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou didst flee: and thou, O Jordan, that thou wast turned back?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams, and ye hills, like lambs of the flock?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: At the presence of the Lord the earth was moved, at the presence of the God of Jacob:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who turned the rock into pools of water, and the stony hill into fountains of waters.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Not to us, O Lord, not to us; but to thy name give glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy mercy, and for thy truth’s sake: lest the Gentiles should say: Where is their God?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But our God is in heaven: he hath done all things whatsoever he would.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The idols of the Gentiles are silver and gold, the works of the hands of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have mouths and speak not: they have eyes and see not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have ears and hear not: they have noses and smell not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have hands and feel not: they have feet and walk not: neither shall they cry out through their throat.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them that make them become like unto them: and all such as trust in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The house of Israel hath hoped in the Lord: he is their helper and their protector.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The house of Aaron hath hoped in the Lord: he is their helper and their protector.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that fear the Lord have hoped in the Lord: he is their helper and their protector.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath been mindful of us, and hath blessed us. He hath blessed the house of Israel: he hath blessed the house of Aaron.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath blessed all that fear the Lord, both little and great.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the Lord add blessings upon you: upon you, and upon your children.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be you of the Lord, who made heaven and earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The heaven of heaven is the Lord’s: but the earth he has given to the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The dead shall not praise thee, O Lord: nor any of them that go down to hell.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But we that live bless the Lord: from this time now and for ever. Psalms Chapter 114 Dilexi. The prayer of a just man in affliction, with a lively confidence in God. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have loved, because the Lord will hear the voice of my prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me: and in my days I will call upon him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sorrows of death have compassed me: and the perils of hell have found me. I met with trouble and sorrow:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I called upon the name of the Lord. O Lord, deliver my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is merciful and just, and our God sheweth mercy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is the keeper of little ones: I was humbled, and he delivered me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn, O my soul, into thy rest: for the Lord hath been bountiful to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath delivered my soul from death: my eyes from tears, my feet from falling.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will please the Lord in the land of the living. Psalms Chapter 115 Credidi. This in the Hebrew is joined with the foregoing psalm, and continues to express the faith and gratitude of the psalmist. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have believed, therefore have I spoken; but I have been humbled exceedingly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I said in my excess: Every man is a liar.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What shall I render to the Lord, for all the things that he hath rendered to me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will take the chalice of salvation; and I will call upon the name of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will pay my vows to the Lord before all his people:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, for I am thy servant: I am thy servant, and the son of thy handmaid. Thou hast broken my bonds:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will sacrifice to thee the sacrifice of praise, and I will call upon the name of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will pay my vows to the Lord in the sight of all his people:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the courts of the house of the Lord, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Psalms Chapter 116 Laudate Dominum. All nations are called upon to praise God for his mercy and truth. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Praise the Lord, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For his mercy is confirmed upon us: and the truth of the Lord remaineth for ever. Psalms Chapter 117 Confitemini Domino. The psalmist praiseth God for his delivery from evils: putteth his whole trust in him; and foretelleth the coming of Christ. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give praise to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let Israel now say, that he is good: that his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them that fear the Lord now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In my trouble I called upon the Lord: and the Lord heard me, and enlarged me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is my helper: I will not fear what man can do unto me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is my helper: and I will look over my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is good to confide in the Lord, rather than to have confidence in man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is good to trust in the Lord, rather than to trust in princes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All nations compassed me about; and, in the name of the Lord I have been revenged on them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Surrounding me they compassed me about: and in the name of the Lord I have been revenged on them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They surrounded me like bees, and they burned like fire among thorns: and in the name of the Lord I was revenged on them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Being pushed I was overturned that I might fall: but the Lord supported me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is my strength and my praise: and he is become my salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The voice of rejoicing and of salvation is in the tabernacles of the just.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The right hand of the Lord hath wrought strength: the right hand of the Lord hath exalted me: the right hand of the Lord hath wrought strength.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I shall not die, but live: and shall declare the works of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord chastising hath chastised me: but he hath not delivered me over to death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Open ye to me the gates of justice: I will go in to them, and give praise to the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is the gate of the Lord, the just shall enter into it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will give glory to thee because thou hast heard me: and art become my salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The stone which the builders rejected; the same is become the head of the corner.

Book: The Book of Psalms
