Text: For if, flying from the pollutions of the world, through the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they be again entangled in them and overcome: their latter state is become unto them worse than the former.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For it had been better for them not to have known the way of justice than, after they have known it, to turn back from that holy commandment which was delivered to them.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For, that of the true proverb has happened to them: The dog is returned to his vomit; and: The sow that was washed to her wallowing in the mire. 2 Peter Chapter 3 Against scoffers denying the second coming of Christ. He declares the sudden dissolution of this world and exhorts to holiness of life.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Behold this second epistle I write to you, my dearly beloved, in which, I stir up by way of admonition your sincere mind:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: That you may be mindful of those words which I told you before from the holy prophets, and of your apostles, of the precepts of the Lord and Saviour.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Knowing this first: That in the last days there shall come deceitful scoffers, walking after their own lusts,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Saying: Where is his promise or his coming? For since the time that the fathers slept, all things continue as they were from the beginning of the creation.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For this they are wilfully ignorant of: That the heavens were before, and the earth out of water and through water, consisting by the word of God:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Whereby the world that then was, being overflowed with water, perished.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the heavens and the earth which are now, by the same word are kept in store, reserved unto fire against the day of judgment and perdition of the ungodly men.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But of this one thing be not ignorant, my beloved, that one day with the Lord is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: The Lord delayeth not his promise, as some imagine, but dealeth patiently for your sake, not willing that any should perish, but that all should return to penance,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the day of the Lord shall come as a thief, in which the heavens shall pass away with great violence and the elements shall be melted with heat and the earth and the works which are in it shall be burnt up.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Seeing then that all these things are to be dissolved, what manner of people ought you to be in holy conversation and godliness?

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Looking for and hasting unto the coming of the day of the Lord, by which the heavens being on fire shall be dissolved, and the elements shall melt with the burning heat?

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But we look for new heavens and a new earth according to his promises, in which justice dwelleth.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherefore, dearly beloved, waiting for these things, be diligent that you may be found before him unspotted and blameless in peace.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And account the longsuffering of our Lord, salvation: as also our most dear brother Paul, according to the wisdom given him, hath written to you:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As also in all his epistles, speaking in them of these things; in which are certain things hard to be understood, which the unlearned and unstable wrest, as they do also the other scriptures, to their own destruction.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: You therefore, brethren, knowing these things before, take heed, lest being led aside by the error of the unwise, you fall from your own steadfastness.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But grow in grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and unto the day of eternity, Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Paul and Sylvanus and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians. In God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Grace unto you: and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: We are bound to give thanks always to God for you, brethren, as it is fitting, because your faith groweth exceedingly and the charity of every one of you towards each other aboundeth.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: So that we ourselves also glory in you in the churches of God, for your patience and faith, and in all your persecutions and tribulations: which you endure

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For an example of the just judgment of God, that you may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which also you suffer.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Seeing it is a just thing with God to repay tribulation to them that trouble you:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And to you who are troubled, rest with us, when the Lord Jesus shall be revealed from heaven with the angels of his power:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: In a flame of fire, giving vengeance to them who know not God and who obey not the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Who shall suffer eternal punishment in destruction, from the face of the Lord and from the glory of his power:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: When he shall come to be glorified in his saints and to be made wonderful in all them who have believed; because our testimony was believed upon you in that day.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore also we pray always for you: That our God would make you worthy of his vocation and fulfil all the good pleasure of his goodness and the work of faith in power:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: That the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, and you in him, according to the grace of our God and of the Lord Jesus Christ. 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 The day of the Lord is not to come till the man of sin be revealed. The apostle’s traditions are to be observed.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and of our gathering together unto him:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: That you be not easily moved from your sense nor be terrified, neither by spirit nor by word nor by epistle, as sent from us, as if the day of the Lord were at hand.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Let no man deceive you by any means: for unless there come a revolt first, and the man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition, A revolt.... This revolt, or falling off, is generally understood, by the ancient fathers, of a revolt from the Roman empire, which was first to be destroyed, before the coming of Antichrist. It may, perhaps, be understood also of a revolt of many nations from the Catholic Church; which has, in part, happened already, by means of Mahomet, Luther, &c., and it may be supposed, will be more general in the days of the Antichrist. The man of sin.... Here must be meant some particular man, as is evident from the frequent repetition of the Greek article: o`, ‘the’ man of sin, ‘the’ son of perdition, ‘the’ adversary or opposer. It agrees to the wicked and great Antichrist, who will come before the end of the world.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Who opposeth and is lifted up above all that is called God or that is worshipped, so that he sitteth in the temple of God, shewing himself as if he were God. In the temple.... Either that of Jerusalem which some think he will rebuild; or in some Christian church, which he will pervert to his own worship: as Mahomet has done by the churches of the east.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Remember you not that, when I was yet with you, I told you these things?

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And now you know what withholdeth, that he may be revealed in his time.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For the mystery of iniquity already worketh: only that he who now holdeth do hold, until he be taken out of the way.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And then that wicked one shall be revealed: whom the Lord Jesus shall kill with the spirit of his mouth and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming: him

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Whose coming is according to the working of Satan, in all power and signs and lying wonders:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And in all seduction of iniquity to them that perish: because they receive not the love of the truth, that they might be saved. Therefore God shall send them the operation of error, to believe lying: God shall send.... That is God shall suffer them to be deceived by lying wonders, and false miracles, in punishment of their not entertaining the love of truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: That all may be judged who have not believed the truth but have consented to iniquity.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But we ought to give thanks to God always for you, brethren, beloved of God, for that God hath chosen you firstfruits unto salvation, in sanctification of the spirit and faith of the truth:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Whereunto also he hath called you by our gospel, unto the purchasing of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Therefore, brethren, stand fast: and hold the traditions, which you have learned, whether by word or by our epistle. Traditions.... See here that the unwritten traditions are no less to be received than their epistles.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God and our Father, who hath loved us and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope in grace,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Exhort your hearts and confirm you in every good work and word. 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 He begs their prayers and warns them against idleness.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For the rest, brethren, pray for us that the word of God may run and may be glorified, even as among you: May run.... That is, may spread itself, and have free course.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And that we may be delivered from importunate and evil men: for all men have not faith.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But God is faithful, who will strengthen and keep you from evil.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And we have confidence concerning you in the Lord that the things which we command, you both do and will do.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And the Lord direct your hearts, in the charity of God and the patience of Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And we charge you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you withdraw yourselves from every brother walking disorderly and not according to the tradition which they have received of us.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For yourselves know how you ought to imitate us. For we were not disorderly among you.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Neither did we eat any man’s bread for nothing: but in labour and in toil we worked night and day, lest we should be chargeable to any of you.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Not as if we had not power: but that we might give ourselves a pattern unto you, to imitate us.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For also, when we were with you, this we declared to you: that, if any man will not work, neither let him eat.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For we have heard there are some among you who walk disorderly: working not at all, but curiously meddling.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Now we charge them that are such and beseech them by the Lord Jesus Christ that, working with silence, they would eat their own bread.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But you, brethren, be not weary in well doing.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And if any man obey not our word by this epistle, note that man and do not keep company with him, that he may be ashamed.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Yet do not esteem him as an enemy but admonish him as a brother.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Now the Lord of peace himself give you everlasting peace in every place. The Lord be with you all.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: The salutation of Paul with my own hand: which is the sign in every epistle. So I write.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: To Timothy, my dearly beloved son. Grace, mercy and peace, from God the Father and from Christ Jesus our Lord.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I give thanks to God, whom I serve from my forefathers, with a pure conscience, that without ceasing I have a remembrance of thee in my prayers, night and day.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Desiring to see thee, being mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Calling to mind that faith which is in thee unfeigned, which also dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois and in thy mother Eunice, and I am certain that in thee also.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For which cause I admonish thee that thou stir up the grace of God which is in thee by the imposition of my hands.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For God hath not given us the spirit of fear: but of power and of love and of sobriety.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Be not thou therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner: but labour with the gospel, according to the power of God.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Who hath delivered us and called us by his holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the times of the world:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But is now made manifest by the illumination of our Saviour Jesus Christ, who hath destroyed death and hath brought to light life and incorruption by the gospel. By the illumination.... That is, by the bright coming and appearing of our Saviour.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Wherein I am appointed a preacher and an apostle and teacher of the Gentiles.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For which cause, I also suffer these things: but I am not ashamed. For I know whom I have believed and I am certain that he is able to keep that which I have committed unto him, against that day.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Hold the form of sound words which thou hast heard of me: in faith and in the love which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Keep the good thing committed to thy trust by the Holy Ghost who dwelleth in us.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Thou knowest this, that all they who are in Asia are turned away from me: of whom are Phigellus and Hermogenes.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: The Lord give mercy to the house of Onesiphorus: because he hath often refreshed me and hath not been ashamed of my chain:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But when he was come to Rome, he carefully sought me and found me.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: The Lord grant unto him to find mercy of the Lord in that day. And in how many things he ministered unto me at Ephesus, thou very well knowest. 2 Timothy Chapter 2 He exhorts him to diligence in his office and patience in suffering. The danger of the delusions of heretics.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace which is in Christ Jesus:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And the things which thou hast heard of me by many witnesses, the same commend to faithful men who shall be fit to teach others also.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Labour as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: No man, being a soldier to God, entangleth himself with secular businesses: that he may please him to whom he hath engaged himself.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For he also that striveth for the mastery is not crowned, except he strive lawfully.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: The husbandman that laboureth must first partake of the fruits.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Understand what I say: for the Lord will give thee in all things understanding.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Be mindful that the Lord Jesus Christ is risen again from the dead, of the seed of David, according to my gospel:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Wherein I labour even unto bands, as an evildoer. But the word of God is not bound.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Therefore I endure all things for the sake of the elect, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus, with heavenly glory.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: A faithful saying: for if we be dead with him, we shall live also with him.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: If we suffer, we shall also reign with him. If we deny him, he will also deny us.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: If we believe not, he continueth faithful, he cannot deny himself.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Of these things put them in mind, charging them before the Lord. Contend not in words: for it is to no profit, but to the subverting of the hearers.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Carefully study to present thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly handling the word of truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But shun profane and vain babblings: for they grow much towards ungodliness.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And their speech spreadeth like a canker: of whom are Hymeneus and Philetus:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Who have erred from the truth, saying that the resurrection is past already, and have subverted the faith of some.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But the sure foundation of God standeth firm, having this seal: the Lord knoweth who are his; and let every one depart from iniquity who nameth the name of the Lord.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth: and some indeed unto honour, but some unto dishonour.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: If any man therefore shall cleanse himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified and profitable to the Lord, prepared unto every good work.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But flee thou youthful desires, and pursue justice, faith, charity and peace with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And avoid foolish and unlearned questions, knowing that they beget strifes.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But the servant of the Lord must not wrangle: but be mild toward all men, apt to teach, patient,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: With modesty admonishing them that resist the truth: if peradventure God may give them repentance to know the truth;

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And they may recover themselves from the snares of the devil by whom they are held captive at his will. 2 Timothy Chapter 3 The character of heretics of latter days. He exhorts Timothy to constancy. Of the great profit of the knowledge of the scriptures.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Know also this, that in the last days shall come dangerous times.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Men shall be lovers of themselves, covetous, haughty, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, ungrateful, wicked,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Without affection, without peace, slanderers, incontinent, unmerciful, without kindness,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Traitors, stubborn, puffed up, and lovers of pleasures more than of God:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Having an appearance indeed of godliness but denying the power thereof. Now these avoid.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For of these sort are they who creep into houses and lead captive silly women laden with sins, who are led away with divers desires:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Ever learning, and never attaining to the knowledge of the truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Now as Jannes and Mambres resisted Moses, so these also resist the truth, men corrupted in mind, reprobate concerning the faith. Jannes and Mambres.... The magicians of king Pharao.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But they shall proceed no farther: for their folly shall be manifest to all men, as theirs also was.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, love, patience,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Persecutions, afflictions: such as came upon me at Antioch, at Iconium and at Lystra: what persecutions I endured, and out of them all the Lord delivered me.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But evil men and seducers shall grow worse and worse: erring, and driving into error,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But continue thou in those things which thou hast learned and which have been committed to thee, knowing of whom thou hast learned them:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And because from thy infancy thou hast known the holy scriptures which can instruct thee to salvation by the faith which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: All scripture, inspired of God, is profitable to teach, to reprove, to correct, to instruct in justice: All scripture, ... Every part of divine scripture is certainly profitable for all these ends. But, if we would have the whole rule of Christian faith and practice, we must not be content with those Scriptures, which Timothy knew from his infancy, that is, with the Old Testament alone: nor yet with the New Testament, without taking along with it the traditions of the apostles, and the interpretation of the church, to which the apostles delivered both the book, and the true meaning of it.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: That the man of God may be perfect, furnished to every good work. 2 Timothy Chapter 4 His charge to Timothy. He tells him of his approaching death and desires him to come to him.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I charge thee, before God and Jesus Christ, who shall judge the living and the dead, by his coming and his kingdom:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Preach the word: be instant in season, out of season: reprove, entreat, rebuke in all patience and doctrine.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For there shall be a time when they will not endure sound doctrine but, according to their own desires, they will heap to themselves teachers having itching ears:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And will indeed turn away their hearing from the truth, but will be turned unto fables.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But be thou vigilant, labour in all things, do the work of an evangelist, fulfil thy ministry. Be sober. An evangelist ... a diligent preacher of the gospel.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For I am even now ready to be sacrificed: and the time of my dissolution is at hand.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I have fought a good fight: I have finished my course: I have kept the faith.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: As to the rest, there is laid up for me a crown of justice which the Lord the just judge will render to me in that day: and not only to me, but to them also that love his coming. Make haste to come to me quickly.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For Demas hath left me, loving this world, and is gone to Thessalonica:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Crescens into Galatia, Titus into Dalmatia.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But Tychicus I have sent to Ephesus.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: The cloak that I left at Troas, with Carpus, when thou comest, bring with thee: and the books, especially the parchments.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Alexander the coppersmith hath done me much evil: the Lord will reward him according to his works:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Whom do thou also avoid: for he hath greatly withstood our words.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: At my first answer, no man stood with me: but all forsook me. May it not be laid to their charge!

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But the Lord stood by me and strengthened me, that by me the preaching may be accomplished and that all the Gentiles may hear. And I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: The Lord hath delivered me from every evil work and will preserve me unto his heavenly kingdom. To whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Salute Prisca, and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Erastus remained at Corinth. And Trophimus I left sick at Miletus.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Make haste to come before winter. Eubulus and Pudens and Linus and Claudia and all the brethren, salute thee.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: The Ancient, to the dearly beloved Gaius, whom I love in truth.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, concerning all things I make it my prayer that thou mayest proceed prosperously and fare well, as thy soul doth prosperously.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I was exceedingly glad when the brethren came and gave testimony to the truth in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I have no greater grace than this, to hear that my children walk in truth. No greater grace.... that is nothing that gives me greater joy and satisfaction.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, thou dost faithfully whatever thou dost for the brethren: and that for strangers,

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Who have given testimony to thy charity in the sight of the church. Whom thou shalt do well to bring forward on their way in a manner worthy of God:

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Because, for his name they went out, taking nothing of the Gentiles. Taking nothing of the Gentiles.... These ministers of the gospel are commended by St. John, who took nothing from the Gentiles, lest they should seem to preach in order to get money by it.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: We therefore ought to receive such: that we may be fellow helpers of the truth.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I had written perhaps to the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, doth not receive us.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For this cause, if I come, I will advertise his works which he doth, with malicious words prating against us. And as if these things were not enough for him, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and them that do receive them he forbiddeth, and casteth out of the church. Diotrephes who loveth.... This man seemeth to be in power, but not a friend to the faithful; therefore this part of the letter might be an admonition to him from the apostle.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, follow not that which is evil: but that which is good. He that doth good is of God: he that doth evil hath not seen God.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: To Demetrius, testimony is given by all, and by the truth itself: yea and we also give testimony. And thou knowest that our testimony is true.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I had many things to write unto thee: but I would not by ink and pen write to thee.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But I hope speedily to see thee: and we will speak mouth to mouth. Peace be to thee. Our friends salute thee. Salute the friends by name. THE CATHOLIC EPISTLE OF ST. JUDE St. Jude, who wrote this Epistle, was one of the twelve Apostles and brother to St. James the Less. The time it was written is uncertain: only it may be inferred from verse 17 that few or none of the Apostles were then living, except St. John. He inveighs against the heresies and wicked practices of the Simonians, Nicolaites, and Gnostics, etc., describing them and their leaders by strong epithets and similes, He exhorts the faithful to contend earnestly for the faith first delivered to them and to beware of heretics. Jude Chapter 1 He exhorts them to stand to the faith first delivered to them and to beware of heretics.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Jude, the servant of Jesus Christ and brother of James: to them that are beloved in God the Father and preserved in Jesus Christ and called.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Mercy unto you and peace: and charity be fulfilled.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, taking all care to write unto you concerning your common salvation, I was under a necessity to write unto you: to beseech you to contend earnestly for the faith once delivered to the saints.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For certain men are secretly entered in (who were written of long ago unto this judgment), ungodly men, turning the grace of our Lord God into riotousness and denying the only sovereign Ruler and our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I will therefore admonish you, though ye once knew all things, that Jesus, having saved the people out of the land of Egypt, did afterwards destroy them that believed not.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the angels who kept not their principality but forsook their own habitation, he hath reserved under darkness in everlasting chains, unto the judgment of the great day. Principality.... That is, the state in which they were first created, their original dignity.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: As Sodom and Gomorrha and the neighbouring cities, in like manner, having given themselves to fornication and going after other flesh, were made an example, suffering the punishment of eternal fire.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In like manner, these men also defile the flesh and despise dominion and blaspheme majesty. Blaspheme majesty.... Speak evil of them that are in dignity; and even utter blasphemies against the divine majesty.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: When Michael the archangel, disputing with the devil, contended about the body of Moses, he durst not bring against him the judgment of railing speech, but said: The Lord command thee. Contended about the body, etc.... This contention, which is no where else mentioned in holy writ, was originally known by revelation, and transmitted by tradition. It is thought the occasion of it was, that the devil would have had the body buried in such a place and manner, as to be worshipped by the Jews with divine honours. Command thee.... or rebuke thee.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But these men blaspheme whatever things they know not: and what things soever they naturally know, like dumb beasts, in these they are corrupted.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Woe unto them! For they have gone in the way of Cain: and after the error of Balaam they have for reward poured out themselves and have perished in the contradiction of Core. Gone in the way, etc.... Heretics follow the way of Cain, by murdering the souls of their brethren; the way of Balaam, by putting a scandal before the people of God, for their own private ends; and the way of Core or Korah, by their opposition to the church governors of divine appointment.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: These are spots in their banquets, feasting together without fear, feeding themselves: clouds without water, which are carried about by winds: trees of the autumn, unfruitful, twice dead, plucked up by the roots:

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Raging waves of the sea, foaming out their own confusion: wandering stars, to whom the storm of darkness is reserved for ever.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Now of these Enoch also, the seventh from Adam, prophesied, saying: Behold, the Lord cometh with thousands of his saints: Prophesied.... This prophecy was either known by tradition, or from some book that is since lost.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: To execute judgment upon all and to reprove all the ungodly for all the works of their ungodliness, whereby they have done ungodly: and for all the hard things which ungodly sinners have spoken against God.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: These are murmurers, full of complaints, walking according to their own desires: and their mouth speaketh proud things, admiring persons, for gain’s sake.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But you, my dearly beloved, be mindful of the words which have been spoken before by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ: But you, my dearly beloved, be mindful, etc.... He now exhorts the faithful to remain steadfast in the belief and practice of what they had heard from the apostles, who had also foretold that in aftertimes (lit. in the last time) there should be false teachers, scoffing and ridiculing all revealed truths, abandoning themselves to their passions and lusts; who separate themselves from the Catholic communion by heresies and schisms. Sensual men.... carried away and enslaved by the pleasures of the senses.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Who told you that in the last time there should come mockers, walking according to their own desires in ungodlinesses.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: These are they who separate themselves, sensual men, having not the Spirit.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But you, my beloved, building yourselves upon your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Ghost,

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Keep yourselves in the love of God, waiting for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ, unto life everlasting. Building yourselves upon your most holy faith.... Raising by your actions, a spiritual building, founded, 1st, upon faith; 2d, on the love of God; 3d, upon hope, whilst you are waiting for the mercies of God, and the reward of eternal life; 4th, joined with the great duty of prayer.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And some indeed reprove, being judged:

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But others save, pulling them out of the fire. And on others have mercy, in fear, hating also the spotted garment which is carnal. And some indeed reprove being judged.... He gives them another instruction to practice charity in endeavouring to convert their neighbour, where they will meet with three sorts of persons: 1st, With persons obstinate in their errors and sins; these may be said to be already judged and condemned; they are to be sharply reprehended, reproved, and if possible convinced of their error. 2d, As to others you must endeavour to save them, by pulling them, as it were, out of the fire, from the ruin they stand in great danger of. 3d, You must have mercy on others in fear, when you see them through ignorance of frailty, in danger of being drawn into the snares of these heretics; with these you must deal more gently and mildly, with a charitable compassion, hating always, and teaching others to hate the carnal garment which is spotted, their sensual and corrupt manners, that defile both the soul and body.

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Now to him who is able to preserve you without sin and to present you spotless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy, in the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ:

Book: The Third Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: To the only God our Saviour through Jesus Christ our Lord, be glory and magnificence, empire and power, before all ages, and now, and for all ages of ages. Amen. Now to him, etc.... St. Jude concludes his epistle with this doxology of praising God, and praying to the only God our Saviour, which may either signify God the Father, or God as equally agreeing to all the three persons, who are equally the cause of Christ’s incarnation, and man’s salvation, through Jesus Christ our Lord, who, being God from eternity, took upon him our human nature, that he might become our Redeemer.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of the elect of God and the acknowledging of the truth, which is according to godliness:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Unto the hope of life everlasting, which God, who lieth not, hath promised before the times of the world:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: But hath in due times manifested his word in preaching, which is committed to me according to the commandment of God our Saviour:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: To Titus, my beloved son according to the common faith, grace and peace, from God the Father and from Christ Jesus our Saviour.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: For this cause I left thee in Crete: that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting and shouldest ordain priests in every city, as I also appointed thee:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: If any be without crime, the husband of one wife, having faithful children, not accused of riot or unruly.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: For a bishop must be without crime, as the steward of God: not proud, not subject to anger, not given to wine, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: But given to hospitality, gentle, sober, just, holy, continent:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Embracing that faithful word which is according to doctrine, that he may be able to exhort in sound doctrine and to convince the gainsayers.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: For there are also many disobedient, vain talkers and seducers: especially they who are of the circumcision.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Who must be reproved, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: One of them a prophet of their own, said: The Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, slothful bellies.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: This testimony is true. Wherefore, rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Not giving heed to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn themselves away from the truth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: All things are clean to the clean: but to them that are defiled and to unbelievers, nothing is clean: but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: They profess that they know God: but in their works they deny him: being abominable and incredulous and to every good work reprobate. Titus Chapter 2 How he is to instruct both old and young. The duty of servants. The Christian’s rule of life.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: But speak thou the things that become sound doctrine:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: That the aged men be sober, chaste, prudent, sound in faith, in love, in patience.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: The aged women, in like manner, in holy attire, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teaching well:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: That they may teach the young women to be wise, to love their husbands, to love their children.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: To be discreet, chaste, sober, having a care of the house, gentle, obedient to their husbands: that the word of God be not blasphemed.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Young men, in like manner, exhort that they be sober.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: In all things shew thyself an example of good works, in doctrine, in integrity, in gravity,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: The sound word that can not be blamed: that he who is on the contrary part may be afraid, having no evil to say of us.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Exhort servants to be obedient to their masters: in all things pleasing, not gainsaying:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Not defrauding, but in all things shewing good fidelity, that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: For the grace of God our Saviour hath appeared to all men:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Instructing us, that, denying ungodliness and worldly desires, we should live soberly and justly and godly in this world,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Looking for the blessed hope and coming of the glory of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity and might cleanse to himself a people acceptable, a pursuer of good works.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: These things speak and exhort and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee. Titus Chapter 3 Other instructions and directions for life and doctrine.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Admonish them to be subject to princes and powers, to obey at a word, to be ready to every good work.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: To speak evil of no man, not to be litigious but gentle: shewing all mildness towards all men.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: For we ourselves also were some time unwise, incredulous, erring, slaves to divers desires and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful and hating one another.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: But when the goodness and kindness of God our Saviour appeared:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Not by the works of justice which we have done, but according to his mercy, he saved us, by the laver of regeneration and renovation of the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Whom he hath poured forth upon us abundantly, through Jesus Christ our Saviour:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: That, being justified by his grace, we may be heirs according to hope of life everlasting.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: It is a faithful saying. And these things I will have thee affirm constantly, that they who believe in God may be careful to excel in good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: But avoid foolish questions and genealogies and contentions and strivings about the law. For they are unprofitable and vain.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: A man that is a heretic, after the first and second admonition, avoid:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Knowing that he that is such an one is subverted and sinneth, being condemned by his own judgment. By his own judgment.... Other offenders are judged, and cast out of the church, by the sentence of the pastors of the same church. Heretics, more unhappy, run out of the church of their own accord, and by doing so, give judgment and sentence against their own souls.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: When I shall send to thee Artemas or Tychicus, make haste to come unto me to Nicopolis. For there I have determined to winter.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: Send forward Zenas the lawyer and Apollo, with care that nothing be wanting to them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: And let our men also learn to excel in good works for necessary uses: that they be not unfruitful.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to Titus
Text: All that are with me salute thee. Salute them that love us in the faith. The grace of God be with you all. Amen.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave unto him, to make known to his servants the things which must shortly come to pass: and signified, sending by his angel to his servant John, The things which must shortly come; ... and again it is said, ver. 3, The time is at hand.... This can not be meant of all the things prophesied in the Apocalypse, where mention is made also of the day of judgment, and of the glory of heaven at the end of the world. That some things were to come to pass shortly, is evident, by what is said to the Seven Churches, chap. 2 and 3, Or that the persecutions foretold should begin shortly. Or that these words signified, that all time is short, and that from the coming of Christ, we are now in the last age or last hour. See 1 John 2.18.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Who hath given testimony to the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ, what things soever he hath seen.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Blessed is he that readeth and heareth the words of this prophecy: and keepeth those things which are written in it. For the time is at hand.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: John to the seven churches which are in Asia. Grace be unto you and peace, from him that is and that was and that is to come: and from the seven spirits which are before his throne:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And from Jesus Christ, who is the faithful witness, the first begotten of the dead and the prince of the kings of the earth, who hath loved us and washed us from our sins in his own blood,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And hath made us a kingdom, and priests to God and his Father. To him be glory and empire for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Behold, he cometh with the clouds, and every eye shall see him: and they also that pierced him. And all the tribes of the earth shall bewail themselves because of him. Even so. Amen.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, saith the Lord God, who is and who was and who is to come, the Almighty. I am Alpha and Omega.... These are the names of the first and last letters of the Greek alphabet, and signify the same as what follows: The beginning and the end: the first cause and last end of all beings: who is, and who was, and who is to come, the Almighty.... These words signify the true God only, and are here applied to our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, who is to come again to judge the living and the dead.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I, John, your brother and your partner in tribulation and in the kingdom and patience in Christ Jesus, was in the island which is called Patmos, for the word of God and for the testimony of Jesus.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I was in the spirit on the Lord’s day and heard behind me a great voice, as of a trumpet,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Saying: What thou seest, write in a book and send to the seven churches which are in Asia: to Ephesus and to Smyrna and to Pergamus and to Thyatira and to Sardis and to Philadelphia and to Laodicea.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I turned to see the voice that spoke with me. And being turned, I saw seven golden candlesticks:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks, one like to the Son of man, clothed with a garment down to the feet, and girt about the paps with a golden girdle.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And his head and his hairs were white as white wool and as snow. And his eyes were as a flame of fire:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And his feet like unto fine brass, as in a burning furnace. And his voice as the sound of many waters.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he had in his right hand seven stars. And from his mouth came out a sharp two-edged sword. And his face was as the sun shineth in his power.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when I had seen him, I fell at his feet as dead. And he laid his right hand upon me, saying: Fear not. I am the First and the Last,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And alive, and was dead. And behold I am living for ever and ever and have the keys of death and of hell.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Write therefore the things which thou hast seen: and which are: and which must be done hereafter.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: The mystery of the seven stars, which thou sawest in my right hand and the seven golden candlesticks. The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches. And the seven candlesticks are the seven churches. Apocalypse Chapter 2 Directions what to write to the angels or bishops of Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamus and Thyatira.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Unto the angel of the church of Ephesus write: These things saith he who holdeth the seven stars in his right hand, who walketh in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I know thy works and thy labour and thy patience and how thou canst not bear them that are evil. And thou hast tried them who say they are apostles and are not: and hast found them liars:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And thou hast patience and hast endured for my name and hast not fainted.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: But I have somewhat against thee, because thou hast left thy first charity.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Be mindful therefore from whence thou art fallen: and do penance and do the first works. Or else I come to thee and will move thy candlestick out of its place, except thou do penance.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: But this thou hast, that thou hatest the deeds of the Nicolaites, which I also hate.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hath an ear let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches: To him that overcometh I will give to eat of the tree of life which is in the paradise of my God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And to the angel of the church of Smyrna write: These things saith the First and the Last, who was dead and is alive:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I know thy tribulation and thy poverty: but thou art rich. And thou art blasphemed by them that say they are Jews and are not, but are the synagogue of Satan.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Fear none of those things which thou shalt suffer. Behold, the devil will cast some of you into prison, that you may be tried: and you shall have tribulation ten days. Be thou faithful unto death: and I will give thee the crown of life.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches: He that shall overcome shall not be hurt by the second death.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And to the angel of the church of Pergamus write: These things saith he that hath the sharp two-edged sword:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I know where thou dwellest, where the seat of Satan is. And thou holdest fast my name and hast not denied my faith. Even in those days when Antipas was my faithful witness, who was slain among you, where Satan dwelleth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: But I have against thee a few things: because thou hast there them that hold the doctrine of Balaam who taught Balac to cast a stumblingblock before the children of Israel, to eat and to commit fornication.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: So hast thou also them that hold the doctrine of the Nicolaites.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: In like manner do penance. If not, I will come to thee quickly and will fight against them with the sword of my mouth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches: To him that overcometh I will give the hidden manna and will give him a white counter: and in the counter, a new name written, which no man knoweth but he that receiveth it.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And to the angel of the church of Thyatira write: These things saith the Son of God, who hath his eyes like to a flame of fire and his feet like to fine brass.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I know thy works and thy faith and thy charity and thy ministry and thy patience and thy last works, which are more than the former.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: But I have against thee a few things: because thou sufferest the woman Jezabel, who calleth herself a prophetess, to teach and to seduce my servants, to commit fornication and to eat of things sacrificed to idols.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I gave her a time that she might do penance: and she will not repent of her fornication.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Behold, I will cast her into a bed: and they that commit adultery with her shall be in very great tribulation, except they do penance from their deeds,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I will kill her children with death: and all the churches shall know that I am he that searcheth the reins and hearts. And I will give to every one of you according to your works. But to you I say,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And to the rest who are at Thyatira: Whosoever have not this doctrine and who have not known the depths of Satan, as they say: I will not put upon you any other burthen.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Yet that which you have, hold fast till I come.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he that shall overcome and keep my works unto the end, I will give him power over the nations. Power over the nations.... This shews, that the saints, who are with Christ our Lord in heaven, receive power from him to preside over nations and provinces, as patrons; and shall come with him at the end of the world to execute his will against those who have not kept his commandments.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he shall rule them with a rod of iron: and as the vessel of a potter they shall be broken:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: As I also have received of my Father. And I will give him the morning star.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches. Apocalypse Chapter 3 Directions what to write to Sardis, Philadelphia and Laodicea.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And to the angel of the church of Sardis write: These things saith he that hath the seven spirits of God and the seven stars: I know thy works, that thou hast the name of being alive. And thou art dead.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Be watchful and strengthen the things that remain, which are ready to die. For I find not thy works full before my God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Have in mind therefore in what manner thou hast received and heard: and observe and do penance: If then thou shalt not watch, I will come to thee as a thief: and thou shalt not know at what hour I will come to thee.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: But thou hast a few names in Sardis which have not defiled their garments: and they shall walk with me in white, because they are worthy.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that shall overcome shall thus be clothed in white garments: and I will not blot out his name out of the book of life. And I will confess his name before my Father and before his angels.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And to the angel of the church of Philadelphia write: These things saith the Holy One and the true one, he that hath the key of David, he that openeth and no man shutteth, shutteth and no man openeth:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I know thy works. Behold, I have given before thee a door opened, which no man can shut: because thou hast a little strength and hast kept my word and hast not denied my name.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Behold, I will bring of the synagogue of Satan, who say they are Jews and are not, but do lie. Behold, I will make them to come and adore before thy feet. And they shall know that I have loved thee.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, I will also keep thee from the hour of temptation, which shall come upon the whole world to try them that dwell upon the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Behold, I come quickly: hold fast that which thou hast, that no man take thy crown.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that shall overcome, I will make him a pillar in the temple of my God: and he shall go out no more. And I will write upon him the name of my God and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem, which cometh down out of heaven from my God, and my new name.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And to the angel of the church of Laodicea write: These things saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, who is the beginning of the creation of God: The Amen, ... that is, the true one, the Truth itself; the Word and Son of God. The beginning ... that is, the principle, the source, and the efficient cause of the whole creation.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot. I would thou wert cold or hot.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: But because thou art lukewarm and neither cold nor hot, I will begin to vomit thee out of my mouth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Because thou sayest: I am rich and made wealthy and have need of nothing: and knowest not that thou art wretched and miserable and poor and blind and naked.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: I counsel thee to buy of me gold, fire tried, that thou mayest be made rich and mayest be clothed in white garments: and that the shame of thy nakedness may not appear. And anoint thy eyes with eyesalve, that thou mayest see.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Such as I love, I rebuke and chastise. Be zealous therefore and do penance.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Behold, I stand at the gate and knock. If any man shall hear my voice and open to me the door, I will come in to him and will sup with him: and he with me.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: To him that shall overcome, I will give to sit with me in my throne: as I also have overcome and am set down with my Father in his throne.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches. Apocalypse Chapter 4 The vision of the throne of God, the twenty-four ancients and the four living creatures.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: After these things I looked, and behold a door was opened in heaven, and the first voice which I heard, as it were, of a trumpet speaking with me, said: Come up hither, and I will shew thee the things which must be done hereafter.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And immediately I was in the spirit. And behold, there was a throne set in heaven, and upon the throne one sitting.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he that sat was to the sight like the jasper and the sardine stone. And there was a rainbow round about the throne, in sight like unto an emerald.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And round about the throne were four and twenty seats: and upon the seats, four and twenty ancients sitting, clothed in white garments. And on their heads were crowns of gold.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And from the throne proceeded lightnings and voices and thunders. And there were seven lamps burning before the throne, which are the seven spirits of God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And in the sight of the throne was, as it were, a sea of glass like to crystal: and in the midst of the throne, and round about the throne, were four living creatures, full of eyes before and behind.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the first living creature was like a lion: and the second living creature like a calf: and the third living creature, having the face, as it were, of a man: and the fourth living creature was like an eagle flying.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the four living creatures had each of them six wings: and round about and within they are full of eyes. And they rested not day and night, saying: Holy, Holy, Holy, Lord God Almighty, who was and who is and who is to come.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when those living creatures gave glory and honour and benediction to him that sitteth on the throne, who liveth for ever and ever:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: The four and twenty ancients fell down before him that sitteth on the throne and adored him that liveth for ever and ever and cast their crowns before the throne, saying:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Thou art worthy, O Lord our God, to receive glory and honour and power. Because thou hast created all things: and for thy will they were and have been created. Apocalypse Chapter 5 The book sealed with seven seals is opened by the Lamb, who thereupon receives adoration and praise from all.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw, in the right hand of him that sat on the throne, a book, written within and without, sealed with seven seals.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw a strong angel, proclaiming with a loud voice: Who is worthy to open the book and to loose the seals thereof?

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And no man was able, neither in heaven nor on earth nor under the earth, to open the book, nor to look on it.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I wept much, because no man was found worthy to open the book, nor to see it.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And one of the ancients said to me: Weep not: behold the lion of the tribe of Juda, the root of David, hath prevailed to open the book and to loose the seven seals thereof.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw: and behold in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures and in the midst of the ancients, a Lamb standing, as it were slain, having seven horns and seven eyes: which are the seven Spirits of God, sent forth into all the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat on the throne.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the book, the four living creatures and the four and twenty ancients fell down before the Lamb, having every one of them harps and golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints. The prayers of saints.... Here we see that the saints in heaven offer up to Christ the prayers of the faithful upon earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they sung a new canticle, saying: Thou art worthy, O Lord, to take the book and to open the seals thereof: because thou wast slain and hast redeemed us to God, in thy blood, out of every tribe and tongue and people and nation:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And hast made us to our God a kingdom and priests, and we shall reign on the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I beheld, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the living creatures and the ancients (and the number of them was thousands of thousands),

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Saying with a loud voice: The Lamb that was slain is worthy to receive power and divinity and wisdom and strength and honour and glory and benediction.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And every creature which is in heaven and on the earth and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, I heard all saying: To him that sitteth on the throne and to the Lamb, benediction and honour and glory and power, for ever and ever.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the four living creatures said: Amen. And the four and twenty ancients fell down on their faces and adored him that liveth for ever and ever. Apocalypse Chapter 6 What followed upon opening six of the seals.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw that the Lamb had opened one of the seven seals: and I heard one of the four living creatures, as it were the voice of thunder, saying: Come and see.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw: and behold a white horse, and he that sat on him had a bow, and there was a crown given him, and he went forth conquering that he might conquer. White horse.... He that sitteth on the white horse is Christ, going forth to subdue the world by his gospel. The other horses that follow represent the judgments and punishment that were to fall on the enemies of Christ and his church. The red horse signifies war; the black horse, famine; and the pale horse (which has Death for its rider), plagues or pestilence.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature saying: Come and see.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there went out another horse that was red. And to him that sat thereon, it was given that he should take peace from the earth: and that they should kill one another. And a great sword was given to him.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature saying: Come and see. And behold a black horse. And he that sat on him had a pair of scales in his hand.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard, as it were a voice in the midst of the four living creatures, saying: Two pounds of wheat for a penny, and thrice two pounds of barley for a penny: and see thou hurt not the wine and the oil.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature saying: Come and see.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And behold a pale horse: and he that sat upon him, his name was Death. And hell followed him. And power was given to him over the four parts of the earth, to kill with sword, with famine and with death and with the beasts of the earth.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of them that were slain for the word of God and for the testimony which they held. Under the altar.... Christ, as man, is this altar, under which the souls of the martyrs live in heaven, as their bodies are here deposited under our altars.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they cried with a loud voice, saying: How long, O Lord (Holy and True), dost thou not judge and revenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth? Revenge our blood.... They ask not this out of hatred to their enemies, but out of zeal for the glory of God, and a desire that the Lord would accelerate the general judgment, and the complete beatitude of all his elect.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And white robes were given to every one of them one; And it was said to them that they should rest for a little time till their fellow servants and their brethren, who are to be slain even as they, should be filled up.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw, when he had opened the sixth seal: and behold there was a great earthquake. And the sun became black as sackcloth of hair: and the whole moon became as blood.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the stars from heaven fell upon the earth, as the fig tree casteth its green figs when it is shaken by a great wind.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the heaven departed as a book folded up. And every mountain, and the islands, were moved out of their places.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the kings of the earth and the princes and tribunes and the rich and the strong and every bondman and every freeman hid themselves in the dens and in the rocks of mountains:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they say to the mountains and the rocks: Fall upon us and hide us from the face of him that sitteth upon the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For the great day of their wrath is come. And who shall be able to stand? Apocalypse Chapter 7 The number of them that were marked with the seal of the living God and clothed in white robes.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: After these things, I saw four angels standing on the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, that they should not blow upon the earth nor upon the sea nor on any tree.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw another angel ascending from the rising of the sun, having the sign of the living God. And he cried with a loud voice to the four angels to whom it was given to hurt the earth and the sea,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Saying: Hurt not the earth nor the sea nor the trees, till we sign the servants of our God in their foreheads.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I heard the number of them that were signed. An hundred forty-four thousand were signed, of every tribe of the children of Israel.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Of the tribe of Juda, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Ruben, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Gad, twelve thousand signed:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Of the tribe of Aser, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Nephthali, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Manasses, twelve thousand signed:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Of the tribe of Simeon, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Levi, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Issachar, twelve thousand signed:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Of the tribe of Zabulon, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Joseph, twelve thousand signed: Of the tribe of Benjamin, twelve thousand signed.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: After this, I saw a great multitude, which no man could number, of all nations and tribes and peoples and tongues, standing before the throne and in sight of the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palms in their hands.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And they cried with a loud voice, saying: Salvation to our God, who sitteth upon the throne and to the Lamb.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And all the angels stood round about the throne and the ancients and the four living creatures. And they fell down before the throne upon their faces and adored God,

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Saying: Amen. Benediction and glory and wisdom and thanksgiving, honour and power and strength, to our God, for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And one of the ancients answered and said to me: These that are clothed in white robes, who are they? And whence came they?

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I said to him: My Lord, thou knowest. And he said to me: These are they who are come out of great tribulation and have washed their robes and have made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: Therefore, they are before the throne of God: and they serve him day and night in his temple. And he that sitteth on the throne shall dwell over them.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: They shall no more hunger nor thirst: neither shall the sun fall on them, nor any heat.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: For the Lamb, which is in the midst of the throne, shall rule them and shall lead them to the fountains of the waters of life: and God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes. Apocalypse Chapter 8 The seventh seal is opened. The angels with the seven trumpets.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And when he had opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven, as it were for half an hour.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And I saw seven angels standing in the presence of God: and there were given to them seven trumpets.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And another angel came and stood before the altar, having a golden censer: and there was given to him much incense, that he should offer of the prayers of all saints, upon the golden altar which is before the throne of God.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the smoke of the incense of the prayers of the saints ascended up before God from the hand of the angel.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the angel took the censer and filled it with the fire of the altar and cast it on the earth: and there were thunders and voices and lightnings and a great earthquake.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the seven angels who had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound the trumpet.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the first angel sounded the trumpet: and there followed hail and fire, mingled with blood: and it was cast on the earth. And the third part of the earth was burnt up: and the third part of the trees was burnt up: and all green grass was burnt up.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the second angel sounded the trumpet: and, as it were, a great mountain, burning with fire, was cast into the sea. And the third part of the sea became blood.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the third part of those creatures died which had life in the sea: and the third part of the ships was destroyed.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the third angel sounded the trumpet: and a great star fell from heaven, burning as it were a torch. And it fell on the third part of the rivers and upon the fountains of waters:

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the name of the star is called Wormwood. And the third part of the waters became wormwood. And many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.

Book: The Apocalypse of St. John the Apostle
